loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 27-year-old married man from Rafah city. He lives with his wife and one daughter in a simple humble house. Mohammad works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income for the family.

Mohammad would like to improve the family's living conditions so he took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a water purification machine for his house. This will enable him to provide clean water for his family.

Mohammad appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a water purification machine for his house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Alya

texts.en:
Alya is a 58-year-old married woman living with her husband. She, in cooperation with her spouse, works untiringly to be able to ultimately satisfy their requirements.

Alya is a farmer and has been in this business for the past 8 years. Currently, with her loan requested from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l, she will buy a new car so she can distribute her products to and from the market more easily.

Alya is very positive about her future and wishes to keep on improving her standards of living.

loans.use: to buy a new car to transport her products to market.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
Josefina tiene 38 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive en casa propia junto a su cónyuge y sus 3 hijos en el distrito de La Matanza que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Morropón, región Piura, en la costa norte de Perú. La vida en este distrito se desarrolla tranquilamente, sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y crianza de animales.

La actividad que realiza Josefina es la venta de chicha de jora, cerveza y comida preparada, realiza esta actividad desde hace más de 3 años contando con experiencia en este negocio y con clientes fijos quienes brindan muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de ella. El destino del crédito será para la compra de una mayor cantidad de cerveza e insumos como arroz, aceite, fideos, entre otros, para la elaboración de sus alimentos, con esto ella espera ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes lo que le permitirá incrementar su nivel de ventas, mejorar sus ingresos y de esta manera mejorará su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Josefina is 38 years old, in a domestic partnership, and lives in her own home with her spouse and her three children. They live in the La Matanza district, which is located in the Morropón province, in the Piura region, on the northern coast of Perú. Life in this district is peaceful; the people work in agriculture and livestock raising.

Josefina's business is selling corn beer chicha, beer, and prepared food. She has done this for more than three years. She counts on her experience with this business and on her regular customers who provide very good personal and professional references.

This loan will be for the purchase of a large quantity of beer and ingredients like rice, oil, noodles, and other goods for the preparation of her meals. With this, she hopes to offer better service to her customers, which will enable her to increase her level of sales, and she hopes to improve her earnings to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of beer and ingredients, such as rice, oil, noodles, and other goods, for the preparation of food.

loans.name: Mayette

texts.en:
Mayette is 33 years old and married with three children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Mayette is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Mayette has been raising pigs for five years and also earns income from food vending. She is working tirelessly toward attaining her dream: to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Nelson Rene

texts.es:
Nelson tiene 57 años de edad, no pudo estudiar por los escasos recursos económicos, está casado y tiene 4 hijos de los cuales 3 ya están acompañados y el menor se encuentra estudiando.

Nelson ya tiene 35 años de trabajar la tierra, es de donde él  ha sacado sus ingresos para criar su familia y la sigue trabajando para cubrir  los gastos de su ultimo hijo y para llevar el pan de cada día a sus casa .

Este crédito lo necesita para pagar el alquiler del terreno donde trabaja, pues se acerca la temporada productiva y quiere estar listo.
El planea seguir trabajando la agricultura mientras Dios le de fuerzas para seguir y asi ayudar a su hijo a que pueda terminar su carrera.
texts.en:
Nelson is 57 years old and could not study as a child for lack of economic resources. He is married and has four children, of whom three are already married and the youngest is still in school.

Nelson has worked the land for 35 years. This is how he has earned the income to raise his family, and he continues working to cover the expenses of his last child and to provide the daily bread for his household.

He needs this loan to pay the rent on the land he works, since the planting season is approaching and Nelson wants to get ready.

He plans to continue working in agriculture so long as God gives him the strength and, thus, to help his son complete his studies and prepare to pursue a career.

loans.use: to pay rent on the land he farms as planting season approaches.

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es: Maria es una joven soltera de 25 años de edad, Maria se dedica al negocio de crianza de animales menores y también trabaja de vendedora en una tienda de lapidas, Maria está embarazada y comenta que  con el dinero del crédito va a comprar pollos que los cría en la casa donde ella vive con sus padres, La aspiración mas grande de Maria es de mejorar su negocio y de las ganancias de este poder estar preparada económicamente para  su  bebe que esta por llegar.
texts.en:
Maria is a single young woman who is 25 years of age. She raises small animals, but she also works as a salesperson at a shop that sells tombstones.

Maria is pregnant and says that the money from the loan will be used to buy chickens that she will raise at her house where she lives with her parents. Her greatest aspiration is to improve her business and her earnings will help her to be financially prepared for when her baby arrives.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Peris

texts.en:
Peris lives in Kapsumai village, situated in the Kapsowar area of Kenya, near Eldoret town. Land in Kapsumai is extremely fertile for agriculture. Most families in Kapsumai practice agriculture. Peris, and her husband, own a small piece of land in this region. They live together with their adorable children. They have been doing dairy farming for the last six years to earn a living. Her primary income source is milk. 

Peris is seeking a loan to purchase an additional dairy cow. As her children grow older, the upkeep and educational expenses keep rising. In order to meet these needs, Peris needs to boost her milk production to earn more income. With your loan, she will be able to afford a high-yielding dairy cow. She will use the additional income from milk sales to pay the loan installments and, later on, school fees.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Dorcas's Group

texts.en:
Dorcas is 61 years old and has 11 children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 10 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya.

Dorcas has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2010. This decision was largely a result of her desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods and, although she described her last harvest as excellent, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Dorcas also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Dorcas's Group will be able to receive a total of 9 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 5.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Khosiyat

texts.ru: Хосият 44 лет. Она замужем и у нее двое детей. Один сын и одна дочка. Муж находится за границей. Хосият жительница района Шахритус. Она занимается земледелием. Хосият занято этой деятельностью уже более 7 лет.  В этом году она хочет сажать арбуз. Она планирует получить качественный и богатый урожай, поэтому она хочет купить качественные проверенные удобрения.  Но на такое количество удобрений ей не хватает не большая сумма денег. Хосият запрашивает кредит для приобретения минеральных удобрений и семян арбуз.  Ей очень нужно Ваша поддержка. Поддержите ее.
texts.en: Khosiyat is 44 years old, married and has two children. She has one son and one daughter. Her husband is abroad. Khosiyat is a resident of the Shahrituz district. She is involved in farming. Khosiyat has been involved in this business for over 7 years. She wants to plant watermelons this year. She plans to receive a quality and plentiful harvest, and this is why she wants to purchase quality, tested fertilizers and watermelon seeds, but is short a small sum of money to buy this amount of fertilizers. She really needs Your support. Please support her.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and watermelon seeds

loans.name: Ghada

texts.en:
Ghada is a 40-year-old married woman from Lebanon. She has one child attending school and does her best to support him through her barely sufficient income from her hairdressing occupation. Her business is established at her house, and she welcomes her customers in a very pleasant way. 

Presently, with the aim of acquiring new tools and supplies, Ghada is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. She looks forward to opening her own beauty salon in the future, where she will also be selling beauty products and cosmetics.

loans.use: to acquire new tools and supplies

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 26-year-old married man living with his wife and only child. He has been working in the construction field for the past 10 years. He is a freelancer working jointly with construction entrepreneurs and independently by serving customers wherever they are.

With his loan requested from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l, Mohamad intends to enlarge his business by purchasing required tools and equipment. He seeks to deal with more entrepreneurs, and this is why he is in real need of getting those purchases, so that he can be ready to satisfy all needs.

loans.use: to purchase required tools and equipment

loans.name: Albert

texts.en:
Albert is from Vanadzor town where he lives with his wife and two children. Albert has been involved in a construction business for already ten years. He is asking for this loan to purchase tools needed for stone processing. This will make Albert's work more efficient and less time-consuming. 

Albert's loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for tools needed for stone processing.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Letecia has requested a 22,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy more fish to sell. She has been running her business for 15 years now.

Letecia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Ayşe

texts.en:
Ayşe is married and has one child. She is an optician like her father. After graduating from university, she decided to enter her father's profession because she has worked there and knows it. She opened a small store. At the beginning she hardly made any money, but later on she made good money and enlarged her store.

She heard about microcredit for women and applied for it. With her first loan, she bought a lot of frames and and earned good money. With the second loan, she is buying optical materials. She wants to earn more in order to prepare a good future for her child.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff

Ayşe hanım evli bir çocuk annesi. Baba mesleği olan gözlükçülük işi yapıyor. Üniversiteyi bitirdikten sonra gözlükçülük işini biliyorum ben ve bu işi yapmalıyım diyor. Küçük bir dükkan açıyor. İlk açtığı tarihlerde işler yavaş gidiyor, sonra güzel gitmeye başlıyor ve dükkanını büyütüyor. Kadınlara imkan tanınan mikro kredi ile tanışıyor ve mikro kredi kullanıyor. İlk çektiği kredi ile dükkanına gözlük çerçevesi alıyor ve güzel para kazanıyor. İkinci kredi ile gözlük malzemesi aldı ve satışa sunarak para kazanmak istiyor. Çocuğuna iyi bir gelecek hazırlamak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy optical materials

loans.name: Sevtap

texts.en:
Sevtap is married and the mother of a 5-year-old and a 3-month-old. Although her children are young, she does waxing at home to earn money. She has done this work for six years. At first she did it for her friends and family, but gradually she attracted customers. Now her customers make appointments to come to her home. With her loan from Maya, she will buy supplies. In the future she would like to open a beauty salon.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Sevtap Hanım evli ve biri 5 yaşında diğeri 3 aylık iki çocuk annesi.  Çocuklarının küçük olmasına rağmen evde ağda yaparak aile ekonomisine katkı sağlıyor.  Sevtap Hanım ağda yapmaya 6 yıl önce başladı.  Önce yakın çevresine ağda yaparak daha sonra günlere giderek ve sonra da müşterileri çoğalınca kendi evinde ağda yapmaya başladı.  Şu anda müşterilerini evinde randevuyla alıyor.  MAYA’dan aldığı kredi ile ağda malzemesi aldı.  Gelecekte güzellik salonu açmak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy waxing supplies

loans.name: Zhypargul

texts.ru: Жыпаргул 22 года, замужем, есть ребенок, образование средне-специальное. Она ведет свое хозяйство, занимается швейным делом. Благодаря упорному труду Жыпаргул, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 4 коровы, 10 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 30,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Жыпаргул обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от бизнеса Жыпаргул планирует вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса.
texts.en: Zhypargul is 22 years old, married and has one child. She has a secondary education. She runs a farm and is involved in a sewing business. Thanks to Zhypargul's hard work, today she has 4 cows and 10 sheep. The monthly income amounts to 30,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Zhypargul requested a loan in the amount of 150,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy cows to increase her livestock headcount. Zhypargul plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further developing her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional cows in order to increase the livestock headcount

loans.name: Aişe Betül

texts.en:
Betül began her career selling from a catalog. Later with a loan from Maya, she opened a small hosiery shop in her neighborhood. Since business was good, she decided to expand her shop. She opened a new shop on an avenue where there were more potential customers.  

Now she has built up her business opening a stationary shop next door. With this loan she will buy goods. Betül’s biggest goal is to make her name a brand and open a larger shop in the shopping district.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Betül Hanım iş hayatına evde katalogdan satış yaparak başladı.  Daha sonra MAYA’dan aldığı kredi ile mahalle arasında çok küçük bir tuhafiye dükkânı açtı.  İşleri iyi gidince tuhafiye dükkânını büyütmeye karar verdi.  Müşteri potansiyelinin daha fazla olduğu bir cadde üzerine yeni dükkânını açtı.  Şimdi tuhafiye dükkânın yan tarafına birde kırtasiye açarak işini geliştirdi.  Maya'dan aldığı kredi ile malzeme alacak.  Betül hanımın en büyük hedefi kendi adına bir marka oluşturmak ve çarşı içinde daha büyük bir dükkân açmak.

loans.use: to buy goods.

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es:
Juan de 71 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar por la situación económica, es viudo y procreo 4 hijos pero ninguno vive con el pues están acompañados, el vive en casa de su prima y le ayuda con los gastos del hogar.

Juan se dedica a la crianza de ganado y a la carpintería, tiene mas de 25 años de dedicarse a este oficio, lo aprendió de  su padre y de su abuelo, el trabajo de carpintería ya no lo hace mucho por su edad, su prima le ayuda con el cuido del ganado.

Juan solicita este creidito para comprar  ganado de repasto.

El sueña con seguir trabajando la tierra y tener siempre fuerzas para poder hacerlo.
texts.en:
Juan is 71 and did not have the opportunity to study because of his financial situation. He is a widow, with 4 children who do not live with him because they all have partners. He lives in his cousin's house and helps with the household costs. 

Juan raises cattle and is also a carpenter. He has been doing this for over 25 years. He learned from his father and from his grandfather. He does not do much carpentry work any more because of his age. His cousin helps him with looking after the cattle.

Juan is asking for this loan to buy grazing cattle. 

He dreams of continuing to work the land and of always having the strength to be able to do so.

loans.use: to buy grazing cattle

loans.name: Margaret's Group

texts.en:
Margaret is a 54-year-old proud mother of 12 children. She is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing her group of 13 farmers in Webuye District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Margaret has noticed that she has been able to consistently feed her family.

Margaret described her harvest as very good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Margaret’s Group will be able to plant a total of 6.25 acres of land and purchase a total of 7 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Fortunato

texts.es:
Fortunato estudia la carrera de enfermería, por medio de su profesión quiere poder ayudar a su familia, e ir abriéndose camino en el mundo laboral para poder tener sus propio ingresos por medio de sus estudios. Comenta que su préstamo anterior le ha sido de mucha ayuda para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera.
Hoy pide este nuevo préstamo para poder pagar nuevamente sus cuotas, y con ello poder seguir con sus estudios. Agradece por esta nueva oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Fortunato is studying for a degree in Nursing. Through this profession, he wants to help his family and open doors into the workplace so that he can earn his own income as a result of his studies. He says that his previous loan was a great help since he was able to pay his degree fees.

Today he is requesting this new loan so that he can pay his fees once again. With these funds, he will be able to continue his studies. Fortunato is grateful for this new opportunity he has received so that he can keep studying.

loans.use: to pay his university fees.

loans.name: Rajabgul

texts.ru:
Рачабгулу 40 лет. Она замужем за трудового мигранта. Ее муж как большинство мужчин находится за приделами Родины, также с мужем ее старший 24 летний сын. Рачабгул живет вместе с двумя сыновьями, которым 16 и 12 лет и с 5 летней девочкой. Рачабгул понимает, как мужу и сыну дается нелегко в чужой стране и всячески их поддерживает. 
Рачабгул на Родине не сидит без дела. Она на дому шьет женскую одежду. Заказов у нее не много. Рачабгул много времени тратила на домашние дела и на детей. Сейчас дети подросли, и у нее имеется достаточно времени, чтобы уделить внимание работе. Она хочет купить новую машинку, так как ее старая машинка скоро выйдет из строя. Приобретав новую швейную машинку, она сможет принимать больше заказов и получать больше дохода и помогать мужу и сыну кормить семью.
texts.en:
Rajabgul is 40 years old and married to a migrant worker. Her husband, just like the majority of men, is outside their homeland, and their 24-year-old son is there with him. Rajabgul lives together with her two sons, who are 16 and 12 years old, and her 5-year-old daughter. Rajabgul understands how difficult it must be for her husband and son in a foreign country and tries to support them however she can.

Rajabgul does not stay unoccupied in her homeland. She sews women's clothing at home, but does not have many orders. Rajabgul had spent a lot of time on household work and her children. Now that her children have grown up, she has plenty of time to devote attention to her work. She wants to purchase a new sewing machine because her old one will soon stop working. By purchasing a new sewing machine, she will be able to accept more orders and earn more income, and help her husband and son to support the family.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Varduhi

texts.en:
Varduhi is sure that this partnership with Kiva also will be profitable. She has a vocational education with the specialty of saleswoman, but she never managed to work, as very early she became engaged in framing and agriculture with her husband’s family. 

Now in the village Yeghvard in Syunik region she is an owner of big farm, where she takes care of cows, calves, bulls and chickens. She notes that her farm milk, meat and eggs she sells perfectly as she has a lot of regular customers for them; these are her villagers, the owners of food-shops of her village, also a lot of butchers from the city and etc. 

She also has 20 beehives and each season she manages to sell great quantity of pure and healing honey. The work about her farm is unbelievably great and hard, but as she likes to say, while she works in her farm she feels healthy and young. Varduhi has 4 children; all of them are married and they live with their families, so Varduhi with her beloved husband with already 25 years of farming experience live alone and do their best to develop their farm. 

Simultaneously with her good farming she does not fall behind in agricultural activities; on her plot of land she cultivates potato, cabbage, tomato, cucumber, beans and greens of great assortment. All the harvest she sells from her house some part to re-sellers the other part to her regular customers. 
 
Varduhi is greatly thankful for her first Kiva loan and she is hopeful to have financial support from Kiva lenders for the second time, as she wants to get ready for coming spring agricultural activities; she will buy potato and plum seedlings, apple trees and also pay some expenses connected with her bee keeping.

loans.use: to buy potato and plum seedlings and apple trees and pay some bee-keeping expenses.

loans.name: Khalel

texts.en:
Khalel is a 23-year-old single man from Gaza city. He lives with his family in a simple, humble house. His father works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income for the family. 

Khalel would like to improve the family living conditions so he took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a water purification machine for his house. This will enable him to provide clean water for his family.

Khalel appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a water purification machine for his house.

loans.name: Salina

texts.en:
Hello, Kiva lenders! Meet Salina, a 55-year-old youthful, very hardworking, honest, and ever-smiling mother. She lives with her husband in a remote village in Kapsowar, in the Rift valley region of Kenya. 

Salina passionately loves farming. She has been farming for the past five years and has always managed to provide for her family. Feeding the large family she has requires a lot of hard work and determination. Her other sources of income are crops and some personal business that she does in order to provide food for her large family. In farming, she enjoys the returns she gets but is challenged to maintain a good standard of living. 

Salina has identified free space on her farm and wants to fully utilize this space by keeping a good quality dairy cow. Dairy farming in Kenya is a very profitable venture and the price of milk in the recent past has been going up, so Salina, being a visionary and entrepreneurial woman, wants to take full advantage of this. She has chosen the breed of cow that she will keep, and she learned that she will not only get milk from the cow but also manure and this will boost the fertility of her farm. Selling the milk will never be a problem because there is a ready market and she will also sell to big dairy processing firms. 

Salina said she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they offer agriculture-based loans and their interest rate is low and on a reducing basis. She underwent training through Juhudi Kilimo and from the training, she learned that saving is a continuous process in many micro-finance institutions. Salina hopes that through the accumulated profit she will be able to start adding value to her milk by starting services such as packaging and the production of other dairy products. This loan will change her life and will secure the future of her school-going children. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy a quality dairy cow.

loans.name: Cavidan

texts.en:
Cavidan is 62 and the mother of three children. She has sold underwear and cosmetics for many years to contribute to the family income. After her children married, Cavidan continued selling. She sells at gatherings she attends at homes. 

With the loan from Maya, she’ll buy products wholesale and increase her profits.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Cavidan Hanım, 62 yaşında ve 3 çocuk annesi.  Uzun yıllar aile ekonomisine katkı sağlamak için çamaşır ve kozmetik ürünler satmış.  Cavidan Hanım Çocuklarını evlendirdikten sonra bile satışlarına devam etmiş.  Bu satışları ev toplantılarına giderek yapıyor.  MAYA’dan aldığı kredi ile toptan ürün alarak karını arttırıyor.

loans.use: to buy products.

loans.name: Rula

texts.en:
Rula is a 45-year-old, married woman. She lives in Salt. Rula is applying for the loan to help her son finish his Bachelor degree in Agriculture; he is in his second year. 

Rula`s husband works as a driver and supports all the family, therefore they are facing a financial problems. Because of that, Rula is applying for a loan to help her son cover the rest of his semester fees.

loans.use: To help her son cover the rest of his semester fees.

loans.name: Tom's Group

texts.en:
Tom's Group is formed by 15 farmers in the Webuye district and is being represented by Tom, who is the group leader pictured above. He is 55 years old, is married, and has four children. Tom has been a farmer for more than 20 years and is often referred to as a very experienced farmer.

Tom isn’t new to One Acre Fund; he actually joined the program in 2013 and has since noticed changes in his life, especially the fact that he has been able to consistently feed his family ever since.

This year, Tom will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of his loan, but he will also purchase a solar light. He is very excited about this addition, since now he will be able to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study.

Using this loan, Tom's Group will purchase a total of 10 solar lights and will use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 7.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve his harvests of maize.

loans.name: Mihriye

texts.en:
Mihriye raised her two daughters on her own. She worked for many years to send her children to school and pay for their weddings.  After retiring, she began knitting as a hobby.

When her pension was insufficient, Mihriye began selling her products. She now earns extra income from handmade baby blankets, vests, and booties.  She’ll use the loan from Maya to buy yarn and thread at wholesale prices to lower her costs. She hopes to start a knitting class one day.

--Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff. The original text appears below: 

Mihriye Hanım 2 kızını tek başına büyütmüş vefakar bir anne.  Uzun yıllar çalışarak kızlarının okumalarını sağlamış ve onları evlendirmiş.  Emekli olduktan sonra hobi olarak örgü örmeye başlamış.  Aldığı emekli maaşı yetmeyince el emeği örgülerini satmaya başlamış.  Mihriye Hanım bebek battaniyesi, yelek ve patikleri örerek kendisine ek gelir sağlıyor. MAYA’dan aldığı kredi ile toptan ip ve yün alarak maliyetini minimuma indiriyor.  Ve gelecekte bir örgü kursu açmayı hedefliyor.

loans.use: to buy yarn and thread

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a carptenter from Vanadzor town in Armenia. For the past 5 years, he has been providing construction services mostly in the Lori region but also in nearby communities.
 
Daniel is now asking for help with purchasing tools needed for construction work, specifically a rotary hammer drill. 

Daniel's loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for tools needed for construction, specifically a rotary hammer drill.

loans.name: Moret

texts.en:
Moret, 51, is a smallholder farmer based in Kapsowar, a small rural town which is situated in the North Rift region of Kenya. She has been doing this work for the last fifteen years to provide for her family. Her primary income sources are milk and crops. 

Moret enjoys farming a lot. Looking after her cattle, however, is quickly becoming a serious challenge. Her cattle stray from time to time from the designated grazing area into other people's farms. The consequences of this can be very severe, leading to disputes which can escalate to violence and hostility. 

Moret is seeking a loan to pay for fencing wire to fence her farmland. The $25 dollar loan you make will enable Moret to have small paddocks created by fencing to make stocking more intensive. The paddocks will also be spelled to build up feed supply, which will also force the stock to graze a wider range of plants, and allow the plants to recover after grazing. The fence will also protect her crops from pests. 

When asked how the loan would benefit her family, she replied, "Improves security in my compound, improves stock management, and keeps my neighbours happy."

loans.use: To fence her farm land.

loans.name: Moses's Group

texts.en:
Moses is 54 years old and is often referred to as a really hardworking individual. As a group leader, he is representing his group in the Webuye district, formed by nine farmers including himself.

Moses has been a farmer for more than 30 years. He has worked with One Acre Fund for a while now, having joined for the first time in 2011 because he wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods.

Not only will he get maize seeds and fertilizer with his loan, but he will also get a solar light in order to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study. He decided that he will use the profits he gains from this year’s harvest to send his children to school.

With this loan, Moses’s Group will receive a total of seven solar lights as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 5.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve his harvests of maize.

loans.name: Orata's Group

texts.en:
Orata is 54 years old and has 7 children. He has been a farmer for more than 20 years and is always said to be a very hardworking individual. Even though Orata is the only one featured in the above picture, he is actually representing his group formed by 13 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya.

Orata started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2010, and decided to do so because he wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Since then, he has seen his life improve; especially in the sense that he has been able to consistently feed his family ever since. This year he decided to represent his group because he wanted to help more farmers.

Orata’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 11 acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 8 solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season.

loans.name: Loice's Group

texts.en:
Loice is 53 years old and has 5 children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 11 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. 

Loice has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2010. This decision was largely a result of her desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods and, although she described her last harvest as excellent, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Loice also decided to purchase two solar lights as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Loice's Group will be able to receive a total of 7 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 6 acres.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Alina

texts.en:
Alina lives in the village of Bargushat in the Syunik region. She was born here, and till today already with her family, she lives in her native village. Alina has vocational medical education. For several years, she worked at her village school as a teacher of biology. Now she is engaged in very different work: she is a postal worker at the local post office. Nevertheless, farming and agriculture are of primary importance for her and her family.

On her farm, she has 20 sheep, so she has a good chance of regularly selling a lot of mutton to the butchers from the city. Alina is a master in agricultural activities; on her plot of land with the help of her husband, she cultivates potato, carrot, beans, greens, tomato and cucumber. Her orchard is perfectly cared for and gives a sweet harvest of apple, plum, peach, pear and mulberry. She sells all of her produce wholesale to several re-sellers, with whom she has been cooperating for a few years already.

Alina has a daughter who is married already and a son who is greatly interested in farming and helps his parents as much as he can manage. Only by way of farming can Alina earn enough to provide for her family’s needs and cover the farm’s expenses, since her salary is very small one. She will be happy to receive this loan as a good start with Kiva's partner, and she will use this loan to develop her agricultural activities. Specifically, she will buy potato seedlings and fertilizer and will also repair the water pipe of her garden.

loans.use: to buy potato seedlings and fertilizer and also to repair the water pipe of her garden

loans.name: Armenak

texts.en:
Armenak lives in Stepanavan city of Lori region with his son and his family. For 20 years, Aremank worked as a veterinary in Stepanavan city and its nearby villages. Now Armenak is in another sphere and 5 years ago he established a farm where he does rabbit breeding. 

He built a barn in the yard of his house and here he keeps 50 rabbits. Once in this farm he stared with swine breeding but now he has great plans with rabbit breeding. Having professional education related to how to work and to care for the animals, he hopes to have success this time. 

He says that he will be happy to have financial support from Kiva lenders in order to put in place his plans in rabbit breeding. This loan will be spent to purchase additional types of rabbits to the ones he already has - rabbits that give good and tasty meat that he can sell. He will also buy fodder for them.

loans.use: to buy additioanl types of rabbits and fodder for them.

loans.name: Naira

texts.en:
This nice lady’s name is Naira and she lives with her daughter in Vanadzor city of Lori region. She graduated from musical college in the department of violoncello, but as she says unfortunately she never worked at her specialty. 

Now Naira is employed in the local dairy-products factory, where she started as a worker and now she is already responsible for quality of products at the same factory. Naira is a widow and since her young age she brought up her son and her daughter alone, trying to do it in a way that the absence of their father caused them as little harm as was possible. Now they are already grown-up; Naira’s son is already married and lives and works with his family in the Russian Federation. From there he cares for his family, trying to lighten his mother’s and sister’s financial needs. 

Naira’s daughter is a student at the Financial Academy and she is in her last year of studying; she is going to get prepared for the graduating state exams and she is also going to write a diploma work. With this loan request, Nari wants to help somehow her daughter in this important and serious period of time. She asks for this loan as she wants to buy a computer for her daughter, which will be greatly helpful during the preparation of her exams and also for her activities writing her diploma.

loans.use: to buy a computer for her daughter.

loans.name: Rat

texts.en:
Rat is a 29-year-old married factory worker with a child, and she lives in the Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. 

Rat has worked in the factory since 2011. Her husband is 36 years old and works as a gypsum maker. She and her husband can make approximately USD 12 per day. 

Now she would like to request a loan to buy farmland to cultivate rice. This loan will help Rat have enough money to buy farmland to cultivate rice. 

In the future, she will help the child to finish high school.

loans.use: to buy farmland to cultivate rice

loans.name: Artem

texts.en:
Artem thanks lenders for his first Kiva loan, which he paid back successfully, and it greatly developed his business: car exterior design and car repairing activities. He has been in this business for 6 years, and already he is famous for his attractive and good work, and thanks to it he gains new customers up through today. 

Artem is 29 years old and he lives in Vanadzor city of Lori region with his parents and his wife; he is happy to mention that he got married and he already has a nice daughter who is a year old. Artem usually buys crashed and damaged cars, and for each one he repairs it, makes some changes, paints it, and sells it, and as he says he always manages to have a buyer for it. 

This loan, in the amount of 300,000 Armenian drams, Artem asks as he wants to buy a new welding machine, as the one he has is very old and out of order.

loans.use: to buy a new welding machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her crop farming

loans.name: Yaqout

texts.en:
Yaqout lives in Al Hashmiya. Her father is employed in Saudi Arabia but his income does not cover all of the family's needs.

She has decided to study political management and seek work in this field. She is tired of the political and security situation in the world these days and wants to help find solutions for it. 

Her family's financial difficulty means they cannot cover all her university fees. Yaqout has applied for a loan to help pay her semester fees and achieve her dreams.

loans.use: To pay semester fees

loans.name: Aigul

texts.ru: Айгул, 21 год, замужем. У нее высшее образование, уже 2 года в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, она занимается животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду, в хозяйстве Айгул на сегодняшний день имеется 1 корова, 12 коз, 6 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет чуть больше 16,000 сом (KGS). В целях увеличения своего бизнеса она обратилась в Банк «Бай–Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Айгул является одним из 3 участников группы "Кыз-Бурак". Доходы от кредита Айгул планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, а также накопить средства на покупку мебели для дома.
texts.en: Aigul is 21, married, and has a college education. She has been raising livestock as the main source of income for her family for two years already. Thanks to her hard work she currently has a cow, 12 goats and 6 sheep. She earns a little over 16,000 som (KGS) per month. In order to expand her business she applied for a loan of 30,000 som (KGS) with Bai-Tushum Bank to buy livestock. Aigul is one of three members of the Kyz-Burak group. She plans to use the profits to invest in additional livestock and to save money to buy furniture for her home.

loans.use: to purchase livestock in order to increase her livestock headcount

loans.name: Mushegh

texts.en:
Mushegh lives in Stepanavan city of Lori region. He is a pedagogue already with 18 years of work experience in this sphere, and he works now at the Stepanavan city school as a teacher of Armenian History, where he is a beloved and respected pedagogue. 

Having a large family and accordingly numerous financial needs, Mushegh simultaneously works at two places; at the local school and at the city sport-school, where he is a chess coach. He mentions he enjoys both his jobs and is happy with the choice of profession that he made long ago. 

Mushegh also has a group of pupils for whom he gives private courses of Armenian History, preparing them for the entrance exams. Like many pedagogues, Mushegh also hopes to be supported by Kiva lenders and Nor Horizon. He is asking for a loan of 600,000 Armenian drams to buy a computer and professional literature, which he needs in all his pedagogical activities particularly during his courses at his house with his pupils. It will also help him to be informed of all the new connected chess competitions and championships that take place in different countries.

loans.use: to buy a computer and professional literature which he needs in all his pedagogical activities

loans.name: Shorouq

texts.en:
Shorouq is a married woman and a 23-year-old. She lives in Mafraq, she is a university student majoring in Office and Information Management.

Shorouq is a mother of two children, her husband cannot cover her university fees, and he is facing financial problem, which make it difficult to complete her education because she cannot pay university fees.

She has a lot of dreams that make her determined to complete her studies. She wants to find a good job to help her husband with the household expenses, which lead her to apply for an educational loan to help her cover the semester fees.

loans.use: To pay her upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Asli

texts.en:
Aslı is married and has one child. She makes cookies, wedding candy and jewelry for birthdays, celebrations and weddings. She began doing this work as a hobby and started receiving orders and people liked her products. She has established a solid customer base. 

This is her third loan from Maya, she will use it to buy goods. Aslı wants to open an event-planning company.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Aslı Hanım evli ve bir çocuk annesi.  Doğum günlerine, özel günlere ve düğünlere şeker hamurundan kurabiyeler, nikâh şekerleri ve ayrıca takılar yapıyor.  Bu işe hobi olarak başlayan Aslı Hanım ürünlerinin beğenilmesiyle sipariş almaya başlamış.  Belirli bir müşteri çevresine sahip olmuş.  MAYA’dan 3’üncü kredisi ile malzeme alacak.  Aslı hanım organizasyon şirketi açmak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy goods.

loans.name: Faten

texts.en: Faten is 25 years old and is studying for a degree in Accounting. She lives in Mafraq with her family of three people, and she is working really hard to get ahead and to grow. Faten dreams of having a good job so that she could help to pay for her daily expenses and give her family the things that they were not able to have. She requested a loan to pay for her educational expenses so that she can continue with her education.

loans.use: To pay for her educational expenses

loans.name: Alice's Group

texts.en:
Alice is 34 years old and has five children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 10 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. 

Alice has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of her desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods and, although she described her last harvest as very good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. 

Alice also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Alice's Group will be able to receive a total of 9 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 5.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Dismas's Group

texts.en:
Dismas is 54 years old and has 6 children. He is a group leader and represents his group made up of 11 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. 

Dismas has been farming with One Acre Fund for some years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2010. This decision was largely a result of his desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. And, although he describes his last harvest as very good, he believes he could have an even better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. 

Dismas also decided to purchase a solar light as part of his loan, which he is very excited about, as it will allow him to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Dismas's Group will be able to receive a total of 13 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 4.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Hector Amilcar

texts.es:
Héctor de 50 años de edad, tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar en la universidad, aunque depende de una familia de bajos ingresos económicos, pero manifestó que su familia fue muy diferente pues se esforzaron para que el pudiese estudiar, ahora él es maestro y se pasó su juventud apoyando económicamente a  sus padres, ahora ha formado un hogar y tiene una hija de 3 años. 

Héctor es maestro, fue la profesión que estudio en la universidad, además está ayudando a su esposa a que pueda concluir sus estudios universitarios.


Él solicita este crédito para cubrir gastos de la universidad de su esposa, ya que debe pagar pasajes, útiles, alimentación, entre otros.


Su sueño es ver crecer a su hija y que su esposa termine la universidad.
texts.en:
Héctor is 50 years old. He had the opportunity to go to college, even though he came from a family with low economic resources. He says that his family was very different, working hard so that he could go to college. He is now a teacher and he spent his youth supporting his parents economically. He now has his own home, and he has a 3-year-old daughter.

Héctor is a teacher, which is the profession he pursued in college. He is also helping his wife finish her college education.

He is requesting this loan to cover his wife's college costs because she needs to pay for transportation, supplies, food, and other things.

His dream is to see his daughter grow up and for his wife to finish her college studies.

loans.use: to cover his wife's college expenses (transportation, supplies, food, etc.)

loans.name: Eliminah's Group

texts.en:
Eliminah has been a farmer for 20 years, and is now proud to lead a group of 14 farmers in Webuye District. She is 51 years old, married, and has five children.

Eliminah likes to think of herself as a very hardworking individual. She has been working with One Acre Fund since 2012 and decided to represent her group to help more farmers. She says that being part of the One Acre Fund community makes her able to consistently feed her family. She plans to use the profits from this coming season to buy a cow.

Eliminah’s Group will use this loan to purchase farm inputs to cultivate 6.5 acres of land. Some group members will also purchase solar lights, a total of ten altogether.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Annarine's Group

texts.en:
Annarine is 62 years old and has 11 children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 11 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. 

Annarine has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2010. This decision was largely a result of her desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods and, although she described her last harvest as very good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Annarine also decided to purchase two solar lights as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Annarine's Group will be able to receive a total of 12 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 6 acres.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Dúo Rosas De San Juan Group

texts.es:
Dúo Rosas de San Juan integrado por la socia Magdalena residente en el centro de San Juan, la cual se dedica al comercio y realización de comida y venta de refacciones.
Doña Magdalena tiene una venta de consumo diario por lo cual últimamente han aumentado sus ventas y necesita invertir para agrandar su negocio, por lo cual se avoco a la institución para solicitar un nuevo crédito y poder comprar una nueva refrigeradora para poder tener variad de bebidas.
texts.en:
Magdalena is a member of Dúo Rosas de San Juan [Roses of San Juan Partnership]. She lives in the center of San Juan and makes a living preparing and selling food and snacks.

Magdalena sells products that people use every day, so recently her sales have increased and she needs to invest in expansion of her business. She turned to this organization to request a new loan so she can buy a new refrigerator to hold a variety of drinks.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator for her store

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy milk, sugar, oil, and rice

loans.name: Girlie

texts.en:
Girlie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her fishing business.

Girlie successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Girlie's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Genelyn

texts.en: Genelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested her second loan from NWTF for 16,000 PHP, which she will use to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her fishing business. She hopes to further build her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Aren

texts.en:
Aren is 29 years old and he lives in Vanadzor City of Lori region. Aren is a contractual military serviceman and simultaneously he is a student at the Vanadzor State University in the faculty of Geography. He studies in the paid division and in order to manage both his work and education, he is a student in the distance learning department.

 Aren is married and he is already a father of two boys. His wife is unemployed and she takes care of their children. Being the only bread-winner in his family, Aren does not manage to cover his education costs, which is really a great hardship for him since the boys are already school-aged and they have a lot of needs.

Aren is asking for this loan as he must pay his tuition fee for the second semester. He thanks lenders beforehand and wishes all the best to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fee for the second semester

loans.name: Erkeaiym

texts.ru: Эркеайым, 35 лет, замужем. Имеет 3 детей. Семья очень дружная и уважаемая в селе. Эркеайым 10 лет занимается животноводством и полеводством. На сегодняшний день она успешный фермер своего небольшого хозяйства, в котором у нее имеется: 3 коровы, 1 овца. Также у Эркеайым есть земельный надел мерою 0,12 ГА, где она ежегодно выращивает картофель для реализации. Всю прибыль от бизнеса она старается вкладывать в его развитие. Эркеайым обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом, в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для откорма и реализации. Эркеайым хочет увеличить поголовье и расширить сарай для скота.
texts.en: Erkeaiym is 35 years old, married and has 3 children. Her family is very friendly and respected in the village. Erkeaiym has been involved in animal husbandry and farming for 10 years. Today she is a successful farmer on her small farm that contains 3 cows and 1 sheep. Erkeaiym also has 0.12 hectares of land, where she annually grows potatoes for sale. She tries to invest all of the profit from the business into its development. Erkeaiym requested a loan in the amount of 80,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy cows for fattening up and resale. Erkeaiym wants to increase her livestock headcount and expand a barn for the livestock.

loans.use: to buy cows for fattening up and resale

loans.name: Eustakia

texts.en:
Eustakia is 39 years old. She is married with 3 children aged between 11 and 15 years. They all go to school. 

She owns a bar and she has been in the business for 14 years. Her husband is a business man. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more items such as beer and soda to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: To buy more items such as beer and soda to sell.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en:
Edgar works and lives in Vanadzor town with his mother, wife and two sons. Edgar is involved in distribution and sales of household supplies in Vanadzor town and its nearby communities. Currently, he uses his own car, which is old, to organize the transportation of products.

This loan will help Edgar to purchase a new car. It has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for car needed for distribution and sales

loans.name: Donatille

texts.en:
Donatille is 41 years old. She is married with two children aged one and twelve years. One of the children goes to school. 

She owns a bar, and she has been in business for seven years. With the loan, she would like to buy more items such as water, beer and soda to sell. 

The profits from the business will be used to increase her savings and to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more items such as water, beer and soda to sell.

loans.name: Wafaa

texts.en:
Wafaa is a 49-year-old married mother of five children. She is a conservative woman and asked her daughter Yasmin to take her place in the photo.
Wafaa has always wanted to provide her children with the best education. Her 20-year-old daughter Yasmin is a university student majoring in child education and she is in her second year. She is seeking to obtain a bachelor's degree and experience work life. But because of the financial problems her family has been facing, Yasmin can't pay her upcoming semester fees. Wafaa wants to help her by applying for this loan to cover her university fees and achieve her dreams.

loans.use: To cover her university fees and achieve her dreams.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her semester fees.

loans.name: Nader

texts.en:
Nader lives in Madaba. He is a married man with one daughter, and he wants to see her live with no problems or difficulties. He is working hard to secure the best future for her.

Nader has a beauty salon for women. He opened this salon 15 years ago. He recently decided to renew his salon, but he did not have enough money. Therefore, he asked for a loan to help him complete the expansion of his salon and to buy new tools.

loans.use: to complete the expansion of his salon and to buy new tools

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase paint for enamel to paint the walls of his house.

loans.name: Peter's Group

texts.en:
Peter is 31 years old and is often described as a very friendly person. He has 4 children and is married. As a group leader, Peter is representing his group of 10 farmers in Webuye in Kenya, and he is very excited to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

The decision to join One Acre Fund was largely a result of Peter's desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Apart from receiving farming inputs, he is also purchasing a solar light as part of his loan, which is very exciting for him as he will now be able to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study. With the profits that he earns from this year’s harvest, he plans to invest in a business.

Peter and his group will receive a total of 10 solar lights as well as input loans of maize and fertilizer to plant a total of 4.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Ekome Feemo 6 Group

texts.en:
These ladies are part of the group called Ekome Feemo 6  with an average age of 40 years. They sell soft drinks, charcoal, sauce, cosmetics and operate a "chop bar.". 
Zelita is 30 years old and sells charcoal and sauce pans from her residence in Teshie. She buys the items from the market at wholesale price and sells to her customers. She has been a member of this group for four years and needs this loan to expand her business. After five successive loans, she has been able to save money and improve her business tremendously. She attended school up to the secondary level but decided to join her friend and learn how to trade. Zelita is standing second from left in the photo.
She needs GHS 900 to be able to purchase more charcoal and sauce pans to sell to her customers.
The group needs a total of GHS 3,400 to expand their businesses and they will hold each other responsible for repaying the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more charcoal and sauce pans to  sell to her customers.

loans.name: Biakoye Group

texts.en:
These ladies are part of the group called Biakoye (Togetherness) and are three in number. They are inspired to have a better and higher quality life, not only for themselves, but for their families. They sell porridge, bread, slippers, and groceries. 

One of the members is Hannah, who is happy to be part of the group. She and her partners take advantage of the opportunity to work and generate their own earnings. Hannah works selling porridge and bread. She is seeking this loan to purchase millet to prepare porridge to sell to customers. 

Hannah and the other members are seeking this loan to increase their stock and they will hold each other responsible for the repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To purchase millet to prepare porridge to sell to customers.

loans.name: Rose's Group

texts.en:
Rose is a 46-year-old proud mother of five children. She is a group leader of 13 farmers in Webuye District, and is often described as a very hard-working individual. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2014, Rose has noticed that she can consistently feed her family.

She described her harvest as excellent last year, but believes she can have a better one by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to buy a solar light, along with fertilizer and maize seeds, because she can then reduce her consumption of paraffin fuel and save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, Rose plans to send her children to school.

Altogether, Rose’s Group will be able to plant a total of 5.75 acres of land and purchase a total of 13 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, hybrid seeds, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Beatrice's Group

texts.en:
Beatrice is 43 years old and has 5 children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 13 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. 

Beatrice has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of her desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods and, although she described her last harvest as excellent, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Beatrice also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Beatrice's Group will be able to receive a total of 10 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 8 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Ruaka Witethie Self Help Group

texts.en:
Nelly, at right in the photo, is a member of Ruaka Witethie Self Help Group which joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013 to benefit from training, especially in enterprise development, to boost their businesses. She is 42 years old, married and blessed with four children, all in school.
Her economic activity is vegetable and dairy farming. She is borrowing from Kiva to buy manure to boost her farming. She looks forward to a bountiful harvest to generate more income that she plans to reinvest to expand her farming.
Nelly is happy and very grateful to Kiva for helping her to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy manure that will boost vegetable productivity and increase income.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
The person in the photograph is Maria. She is 74 years old, married, and blessed with four children.

Her economic activity is poultry and dairy farming. She also farms vegetables like kale and potatoes.  

She is requesting a Kiva loan to buy an additional cow that will help expand the volume of milk supply. This will help her increase her income and thus be in a position to cater to her needs with ease. 

Maria is grateful to Kiva for the support.

loans.use: To buy a cow that will help expand her business and increase the volume of milk supply.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is 44 years old, married, and has five children, two of whom attend school. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013 where she acquired skills on savings, enterprise development, and good financial management.

Naomi is involved with both dairy and vegetable farming. She requested a loan, which she will use to buy manure and dairy feeds to boost both vegetable and dairy farming.  This loan will improve her income and enable her to provide for her family.

loans.use: to purchase manure and dairy feeds

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Margaret; she is 32 years old with two children.

Margaret is a small-scale mixed farmer who farms vegetables such as kale, cabbage and potatoes. She also does dairy farming. She has been able to manage to expand after Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training where she has acquired skills on savings, enterprise development and good financial management.

She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy manure and dairy feed to boost both vegetable and dairy farming. This will improve her income and she will thus be in a position to provide for the family.

Margaret is grateful to Kiva and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy manure and dairy feed to improve vegetable and dairy farming and thus increase her income.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Esther. She is 66 years old, married, and living with her husband and their six children.  

She does kale, dairy, maize, and potato farming. She has applied for a loan to buy dairy feed to help improve on milk productivity. She looks forward to improved income and thus being in a position to cater to her family's needs.

Esther is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for their help and support.

loans.use: To buy animal feed for better productivity and increased family income

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George, 50 years old, is a married father of two children. Hand in Hand Eastern Africa  training has enabled him improve his enterprise management as well as record keeping and financial management.
He does vegetable farming, poultry and dairy keeping. He is borrowing from Kiva to buy poultry and dairy feed to improve productivity. He believes this will help him expand his farming business.
George appreciates Kiva and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy poultry and dairy feed that will boost productivity and increase his income.

loans.name: Cerro Mojarra Group

texts.es:
La localidad donde se ubica el grupo de préstamo Cerro Mojarra está conformada por múltiples islas; la mayoría de los habitantes se dedica a la pesca y venta de mojarra y algunos más a la siembra de caña de azúcar, maíz, limón y hule, principalmente. Los integrantes del grupo y sus actividades son:

Alejandrina – Venta de fruta y siembra de limón
María y Laura - Venta de Mojarra
Agustina - Panadería
Agustín - Maíz, venta de Mojarra y recargas para celular
Eulogia – Venta de pan
Demetria – Elaboración y venta de antojitos
Margarita – Venta de cosméticos

María del Refugio  tiene 66 años de edad es madre de 6 hijos todos ellos mayores de edad. Ella es conocida en su comunidad como "Doña Cuco” aunque sus hermanos también le llaman “Cuquita”. A sus 26 años, y como madre de dos niños decidió dedicarse al negocio familiar y comenzar a vender mojarra que su padre y hermanos pescaban. Con el paso de los años, el número de clientes siguió incrementando pero también los pescadores con experiencia en la misma comunidad. 

Cuarenta años después de iniciar la actividad, Doña Cuco recorre tres veces por semana las calles de diferentes comunidades con dos tanques donde lleva la mojarra en paquetes de 1 kilo. Afortunadamente, dos de sus hijos ya también cuentan con experiencia en la actividad y están a cargo de la cooperativa de mojarra: ellos compran la mojarra a otros pescadores y la revenden por kilo o por pieza dependiendo de cada uno de sus clientes. 

Es así que Doña Cuco necesita un nuevo préstamo para comprar más mojarra, “Cada uno de los prestamos que he recibido desde hace ya 7 años los he invertido para comprar pescado, tendales y dar mantenimiento a mi lancha". Por este apoyo, Cuco se siente muy agradecida pues ha sido una esperanza para mantener vivo su negocio a pesar de la competencia e incluso crecer. 

Las ganancias, además le han permitido iniciar con la venta de pasta de mole, negocio que también quiere ver crecer ahora que sus hijos dedican más tiempo al de la mojarra.

*La fotografía fue tomada en el patio trasero de la casa de Doña Cuco el cual ofrece una vista placentera de la laguna, ella es quien viste blusa blanca y falda negra.
texts.en:
The Cerro Mojarra group is located in an area made up of multiple islands. The majority of inhabitants make a living by fishing for and selling sea bream. Some others grow sugarcane, corn, lemons and rubber. The group members' business activities are as follows:

Alejandrina – Selling fruit and growing lemons
María and Laura – Selling sea bream
Agustina – Bakery
Agustín – Corn, selling sea bream and cell phone credit
Eulogia – Selling bread
Demetria – Making and selling snacks
Margarita – Selling cosmetics

María del Refugio, 66, is a mother of six children, all of whom are adults. She is known in her community as "Doña Cuco" although her siblings also call her "Cuquita". At the age of 26, with two children, she decided to work in the family business and start selling the sea bream which her father and siblings caught. As the years went by, her number of clients increased, but so did the number of fishermen with experience in her community. 

Forty years after she started to work in this business, Doña Cuco goes out on the streets three times per week with two tanks of sea bream in 1-kilo packs. Thankfully, two of her children also have experience with this business activity and are in charge of the sea bream cooperative: they buy sea bream from other fishermen and resell it by kilo or by the piece, depending on the client.

Doña Cuco needs a new loan to buy more sea bream. "I have invested each one of the loans I have received over the past seven years in the purchase of fish, nets, and maintaining my boat." Cuco is very grateful for this loan because she wishes to keep her business alive and even grow despite the competition.

Furthermore, her earnings have allowed her to start selling mole sauce, a business which she also hopes to grow now that her children spend more time on the sea bream business.

*The photograph was taken on Doña Cuco's back porch, which offers a pleasant view of the lagoon. She is wearing a blue shirt and black skirt.

loans.use: to buy sea bream.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro tiene 58 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rústico con su cónyuge y su hijo en el distrito de Pomahuca, provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

La actividad a la que se dedica Pedro es a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de arroz, con una experiencia en el rubro de 14 años. Cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales por parte de los pobladores de su distrito. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en labores agrícolas, aplicaciones e incorporaciones de productos fito sanitarios, fertilizantes y mano de obra para su cosecha. De esta manera lo ayudará a la mejora tanto fisiológica, morfológica y productiva de su cultivo, así como también tener una cosecha oportuna, y por ende tendrá mayor producción con una mejor calidad de producto, por lo cual no tendrá problemas en vender su producto, esto le permitirá incrementar su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Pedro is 58 years old and lives in his own house of rustic material with his wife and son. He lives in the Pomahuca district, Jaén province, Cajamarca region, in the northern mountains of Peru. The district's residents mainly work in agriculture, livestock, and commerce.

Pedro farms for a living, specifically rice cultivation, and he has 14 years of experience in the field. He has very good personal and professional references from his area's residents. He will use this loan to pay for farming work, pesticides, and fertilizers, and to pay for labor at harvest time.

In this way, it will help him improve the physiology, morphology, and productivity of his crops, and he will have a timely harvest. As a result, he will have greater production with a better quality product that he will have no problem selling. This will enable him to increase his income and improve his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to pay for farm tasks, pesticides, and fertilizer, and to pay for labor during the harvest

loans.name: Grigor

texts.en:
Grigor works and lives in Yerevan with his wife and two children. He is a driver who operates his own microbus. He works day and night to provide his family with appropriate living conditions. 

Grigor has requested this loan to purchase a new microbus. He plans to rent it on a daily basis with the hope of earning a good income.

This loan has been approved under a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The program provides business start-up loans with relaxed terms to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to buy a new microbus

loans.name: Nazgul

texts.ru: Назгул 27 лет, замужем, есть ребенок, у Назгул среднее образование, с 2005 года занимается животноводством. Она очень ответственная и трудолюбивая. В хозяйстве Назгул на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 коровы, 4 овцы. Назгул  решила развивать ее бизнес, поэтому она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Назгул является лидером группы "Кыз-Бурак", состоящей всего из 3 человек. Доходы от кредита она хочет вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота, что позволит ей накопить на покупку автомобиля.
texts.en: Nazgul is 27 years old, married and has one child. Nazgul has a secondary education and has been involved in animal husbandry since 2005. She is very responsible and hardworking. Today Nazgul has 2 cows and 4 sheep on her farm. Nazgul decided to develop her business and this is why she requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy livestock. Nazgul is the leader of the "Kyz-Burak" group, consisting of only 3 people. She wants to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing her livestock headcount, which will allow her to save money and buy a car.

loans.use: to purchase livestock in order to invest in her business

loans.name: Kenzhaiym

texts.ru: Кенжайым 45 лет, замужем, есть 2 детей, образование- среднее. Уже несколько лет она ведет свое хозяйство, благодаря упорному труду Кенжайым, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 2 коровы и 25 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 17,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Кенжайым обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 25,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Она является одним из 3 участников группы "Кыз-Бурак". Доходы от бизнеса Кенжайым планирует вкладывать в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины и постройку сарая для скота.
texts.en: Kenzhaiym is 45 years old, married and has 2 children. She has a specialized secondary education. She has been running her own business for several years. Thanks to Kenzhaiym's hard work, today her farm contains 2 cows and 25 sheep. The monthly income amounts to 17,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Kenzhaiym requested a loan in the amount of 25,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy livestock. She is one of the three members of the "Kyz-Burak" group. Kenzhaiym plans to invest the earnings from the business into further increasing her livestock headcount and building a barn for the livestock.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock for fattening and resale

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
The person in the photograph is Jacinta. She is fifty-three years old, married, and has six children. She joined Hand In Hand Eastern Africa in February 2013 and has received trainings on enterprise development and financial planning, which equipped her with skills to effectively manage her enterprise.

She owns a maize mill where she also sells maize and maize flour. Jacinta is borrowing from Kiva in order to purchase maize for resale and for milling.

She trusts this will increase her sales and therefore increase her income. She will therefore be able to improve her family’s living standards, including providing them with quality education.

Jacinta is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to make established payments.

loans.use: to buy maize for resale and for milling; this will boost her income and support her children's education.

loans.name: Malohat

texts.ru: Малохат 30 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей. У Малохат- среднее образование, с 2000 года в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, она занимается животноводством и земледелием. Благодаря упорному труду, в хозяйстве Малохат на сегодняшний день имеется 4 коровы и 0,09 Га земли, где она выращивает картофель для реализации. Малохат обратилась в Банк «Бай–Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойной коровы, семян картофеля и удобрений, чтобы продавать экологически чистую продукцию. Доходы от кредита Малохат планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины и хочет накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Malohat is 30 years old, married and, together with her husband, is raising 2 children. Malohat has a secondary education and, to provide the primary income for her family, she has been involved in animal husbandry and farming since 2000. Thanks to her hard work, today Malohat's farm contains 4 cows and 0.09 hectares of land, where she grows potatoes for sale. Malohat requested a loan in the amount of 30,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy a dairy cow, potato seeds and fertilizers in order to sell ecologically clean products. Malohat plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing livestock quantities and wants to save money to repair her house.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow, potato seeds and fertilizers in order to sell ecologically clean products

loans.name: Taguhi

texts.en:
Taguhi is from Vedi town where she lives with her husband (in the photo), three sons, and daughter-in-law. Taguhi is accustomed to running a farm. It includes livestock: a cow, calves, pig and piglets, and also hens and two turkeys. Taguhi also cultivates tomatoes and owns a small orchard where a large variety of fruit trees are grown (peach, apricot, apple and pear). 

Taguhi's husband and sons sell the gathered agricultural produce in local markets. Farming is the main source of the family's living. To be able to enlarge her farm, Taguhi would like to renovate her vineyard and start growing grapes also. She is asking for this loan of USD 3,000 to purchase  two calves, forage for feeding the livestock, and also supplies for renovation of the vineyard. 
 
She has already taken a loan from a local financial institution before, but unfortunately wasn't able to pay it back. However, thanks to their hard work during  recent times, Taguhi and her family members were able to run their agricultural business in a sustainable way, ensuring that she will now be able to cover the monthly payments. So, she has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.
