loans.use: to pay for two calves, forage for feeding the livestock, and also supplies for renovation of their vineyard

loans.name: Edinah

texts.en:
The lady in the above photo is Edinah. She is twenty-nine years old, married, and a mother of two. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa 2013.

Edinah practices banana and maize farming. She has benefited greatly from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training in enterprise and financial management. The training has enabled her to manage her business well through proper bookkeeping and cash flow management. 

Edinah is borrowing from Kiva's lenders in order to buy quality farm inputs such as hybrid seeds and fertilizer, which will increase both her farm's yield and her income. This will allow her to not only provide food and medical care for her family, but also pay her children's school fees.  

Edinah is grateful to Kiva and their lenders, and she promises to promptly repay her loan.

loans.use: to buy hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve her farm's productivity and thus increase her family's income.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna is a farmer from Tasik village of Syunik region. She lives there with her husband and little daughter. Anna's husband is an army officer and to help him with the family's daily expenses, Anna is involved in farming. She keeps cows and calves and cultivates barley and potatoes. Anna has applied for this loan to purchase barley seeds and fuel and to hire workers for land cultivation. She has to organize all household work by herself so the farm is very difficult for Anna to manage. This is Anna’s first loan approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who do not have access to credit products because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to pay for barley seeds and fuel and to hire workers for land cultivation

loans.name: Lusine

texts.en:
Lusine is a farmer from Haykavan village. She is a mother of three, and together with her husband has been running a family farm for many years. The farm includes livestock and arable land where different vegetables are being cultivated. Lusine's main occupation is in agriculture. She also owns a tractor, and with the help of this, she provides rental cultivation services for her villagers.

To be able to enlarge crop production, Lusine is asking for this loan. She plans to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and fuel for the agro machine needed for organizing cultivation work. She has already taken a loan from a local financial institution before, but unfortunately wasn't able to return it back. However, thanks to the hard work during the recent times, Lusine was able to run her agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that she will be able to cover the monthly payments.

So, she has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for seeds, fertilizer, and fuel for the agro machine needed for organizing cultivation work.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 58 years old, married and blessed with two children.
Her economic activity is poultry and dairy farming. She also does vegetable farming to supplement her income. She is borrowing from Kiva to buy a water tank and pipes to help irrigate her crops. She feels this will improve her farming and result in a bountiful harvest. Lucy looks forward to more profits that will enable her to provide for her family with ease..Lucy is happy for Kiva's great support.

loans.use: To buy a water tank and irrigation pipes for improved farming and better returns

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 47 years old and blessed with five children who are in school. Ruth is a mixed farmer who grows potatoes and cabbage and also does dairy farming She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to learn more about business management, record keeping and financial management.
She is taking out a loan to help boost her business by buying certified seeds to help increase productivity. She hopes this will increase her sales proceeds.
Ruth is grateful to Kiva for itsr help and support.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs such as certified seeds to help boost farming and increase her income.

loans.name: Holida

texts.ru: Холида, 32 года, замужем, есть 4 детей. У Холиды среднее образование. Она по характеру: трудолюбивая, честная, заботливая. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, уже много лет Холида занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес много лет назад. Благодаря упорному труду Холиды, в хозяйстве есть земельный надел мерою 0,9 ГА, на котором он выращивает картофель и кукурузу для реализации. Ее деятельность приносит до 20,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Холида обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 130,000 сом (KGS) на покупку семян и удобрений для обработки почвы. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства и хочет накопить на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Holida is 32 years old, married and has 4 children. Holida has a secondary education. She is hardworking, honest and caring. To provide the primary income for her family, Holida has been involved in animal husbandry and farming for many years. Thanks to Holida's hard work, today she has 0.9 hectares of land, where she grows potatoes and corn for sale. Her business yields about 20,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Holida requested a loan in the amount of 130,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy seeds and fertilizers to treat the soil. She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further growing her business and wants to save money to repair her house.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers to treat the soil and grow organic vegetables

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammed ran behind his dream without getting tired. He did not want to stop without getting one result, which was to at least get a bachelor's degree in civil engineering and start a new journey.

Mohammed, a young man in the prime of life, is 25 years old. He is a student at the university majoring in civil engineering. For a long time his family has wanted to see Mohammad become successful engineer, but financial difficulties faced by his family have been an obstacle to completing his dream. He had to postpone semesters because he could not pay the fees, which led him to the delay completing the program at the university. 

Therefore, Mohammad decided to request a semester loan so that he can pay university fees and thereby achieve his dreams.

loans.use: To pay university fees, opening the way for him to achieve his dreams

loans.name: Hait

texts.ru:
Хаит родился в семье колхозника. Хаит добродушный  мужчина в возрасте 50 лет. Он женат  и имеет четырех детей. Все его дети уже взрослые. Хаит живёт со своей женой в небольшом доме в сельском посёлке. Несмотря на свой возраст, он полон сил и желания работать на благо своей семьи. Хаит  занимается деканством и животноводством. Его жена помогает ему ухаживать и растить скот. 
 Бизнес животноводства приносит хороший доход, поэтому Хаит хочет расширить этот бизнес, увеличив поголовье своего скота. Поэтому он обратился в Арванд, чтобы получить кредит на покупку скота. Хаит заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Hait was born into a family of a farmer. Hait is a kind 50-year-old man. He is married and has four children. All of his children are already grown. Hait lives with his wife in a small house in a village. Despite his age, he is full of strength and desire to work for his family's welfare. Hait is involved in farming and animal husbandry. His wife helps him to care and raise the livestock.

The animal husbandry business yields a good income, and this is why Hait wants to expand this business by increasing his livestock headcount. Therefore, he came to Arvand to obtain a loan to buy livestock. Hait thanks Arvand for the support in advance.

loans.use: to buy livestock in order to grow his business

loans.name: Rafat

texts.en:
Rafat is a 38-year-old married man from the city of Rafah. He lives with his wife and two sons in a simple humble house. 

Rafat works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income for the family. Rafat would like to improve the family's living conditions so he took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a water purification machine for his house, which will enable him to provide clean water for his family.

Rafat appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a water purification machine for his house.

loans.name: Señor Cautivo De Ayabaca Group

texts.es: Vite de 44 años es separada y tiene 05 hijos 3 de ellos dependientes, actualmente es la presidenta del grupo “señor cautivo de ayabaca” conformada por 06 socias trabajadoras que han ido mejorando a través de sus negocios. Con los deseos de brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Vite, es trabajadora domestica. Se siente feliz pues con su perseverancia ha podido cumplir con algunos de sus objetivos. Su último crédito lo destinará para  los estudios de sus hijos. El grupo “señor cautivo de ayabaca” agradece el apoyo brindado y se compromete a seguir trabajando bien.  Vite es la primera del lado izquierdo, viste polo plomo y pantalón negro.
texts.en:
Vite is 44 years old. She is separated and has five children, three of whom still live at home. She is currently the President of her group, Señor Cautivo De Ayabaca, which comprises six hardworking women who have gradually improved their situation through their businesses. In order to give her family a better quality of life, Vite works as a domestic. She is happy because her perseverance has allowed her to meet some of her goals. She will use this loan to pay for her children's education. 

The group Señor Cautivo De Ayabaca appreciates the support they have received and promises to continue working well. Vite is the first member from the left, wearing a grey top and black pants.

loans.use: to pay for her children's education.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw materials to make meals.

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en: Meet Monicah who is 31 years old and a very hard-working, honest and dedicated farmer living in Kipkener, a remote village in Kapsowar. She is happily married and has children. She has been practicing mixed farming for the last five years and has gained much experience. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her children, she has been selling sheep meat, wool, eggs, and a variety of crops from her farmland. To make ends meet and to earn extra cash, Monicah has been engaged in another small personal business. The Kapsowar area is very populated, and the demand for poultry products and eggs is very high. Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable, and she stated that the most enjoyable part about poultry farming is “the increased profits I enjoy.” Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the really high demand. She lacks funds to increase her poultry farming so she is seeking a loan of 10,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy poultry. Being a woman accessing funds is very challenging, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, Monicah feels relieved knowing that her dream will be achieved and she will be able to buy more poultry. As a result of the loan, she will sell eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market. This will translate into an increased profit margin and an improved income level. Being a visionary woman, Monicah intends to accumulate more profits and expand her poultry sales to other markets to increase her income and improve her living conditions. The extra income will be used to fully repay the loan, change her living conditions, and secure the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: To pay for poultry

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Doña Juana se dedica al cultivo de café tiene más de quince años de trabajar en este oficio. Junto a su esposo trabajan para darle lo mejor a sus hijos. en sus pagos ha sido puntual. Solicita el crédito porque necesita abonar su plantación de café. El sueño de doña Juana es darle un buen cuidado a su plantación para poder cosechar un café de calidad, para ayudarse ella y su familia.
texts.en: Juana works growing coffee and has over fifteen years of experience in this trade. She and her husband work in order to provide for their children as best they can. She has made all of her payments on time. She is requesting this loan because she needs to fertilize her coffee plants. Juana's goal is to take good care of her plantation so that she can harvest quality coffee beans and help herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her coffee crops.

loans.name: Together Group

texts.en:
The group “Together” is located in Teshie-Accra, Ghana. It is a group of two very active members who, above all, want to better their quality of life. They are selling firewood and soft drinks.

Peter is 48 years old and married with children who range in age from 15 years to 20 years. He is a member of the group and is very excited to begin a sixth loan cycle with ID-Ghana, Teshie branch. Peter sells firewood. His business income is able only to pay for the costs of maintaining his home. He is requesting a new loan in order to buy more firewood to cover all of his customers’ demands because without more investment capital, he feels that his own income is not sufficient.

Besides the loans, Peter and Matilda benefit from a combination of loans and education (training). The loan officer and the training officer share timely and useful information with the members on a variety of subjects such as health, hygiene, and nutrition, as well as self-esteem and violence against women. The members learn about effective business management practices and customer service, as well as gain essential knowledge about business planning, customer service, marketing, and pricing. All of these subjects help them better their lives both economically and developmentally.

loans.use: to buy more firewood to cover all of his customers' demands.

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia lives in Homa Bay. Homa Bay County is located in southwestern Kenya and borders on Lake Victoria, the second-largest lake in the world. Populations are dense close to the lake, where many individuals make their living from fishing, and a few work in the small but slowly growing tourism industry. A popular tourist attraction in Homa Bay County is Ruma National Park, a game reserve that is home to the rare roan antelope, a shy species distantly related to the reticulated giraffe. Most people in Homa Bay make their living from farming, and the rolling hills of the area are dotted with fields and fruit tree plantations.

Teresia is a widow with seven children. She is a farmer. She has been farming for twenty years now, and she is currently growing maize, millet, sorghum, and sunflowers. Teresia is excited about beekeeping, as it will earn her some income from the sale of honey and provide her with honey for food.

This is Teresia's first loan with Honey Care, and she plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to start a small business. Teresia's hope for the future is to experience a changed life through beekeeping.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Peace Group

texts.en:
The “Peace” group is made up of two enterprising members, dedicated to working for their families' well being. They are into selling underwear, shirts and electrical parts. Daniel is the group representative. He is 39 years old and the father of two children, who have been his inspiration for his success. He sells clothing and started this business seven years ago with the help of a loan he got from his mother. Since then he has maintained his business. He is asking for a loan to buy more underwear and shirts to sell to customers from door to door. One of his goals is to maintain his business.

Irene is another one of the members. She is 36 years old, and has been selling electrical gadgets.

loans.use: to buy more underwear and shirts to sell to customers from door to door.

loans.name: Jocinta

texts.en:
Jocinta lives in Homa Bay. Homa Bay county is located at the southwestern tip of Kenya, and its northern end is dominated by Lake Victoria, the largest lake in the Southern Hemisphere. Lake Victoria extends into three east African countries, allowing cross-border flows of goods and people, and a market day in a lakeside town in Homa Bay county often boasts traders from Uganda, Tanzania and Kenya, all of whom arrive in boats to ply their wares. Although the semi-arid nature of much of Homa Bay county means that poverty rates are quite high, many people in the region hold a strong cultural emphasis on education, and as a result school attendance figures around Homa Bay are above the national average.

Jocinta is married and has six children. She runs a small business selling grains and buns. She is a farmer as well. She has been farming for eight years now and she is currently growing maize, sorghum and beans. Jocinta is excited about beekeeping as it will earn her some income from the sale of honey and provide her with honey for food.

This is Jocinta's first loan with Honey Care and she plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to invest in her business. Jocinta's hope for the future is to invest more in farming and to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a mother from Kapsowar, a remote town in Kenya. She has spent the past seven years of her life farming. She sells eggs, milk, and vegetables produced on her farm. She also engages in a personal business to make ends meet. Christine is a go-getter and has a great desire to succeed in life.

Of all the activities she involves herself in, poultry farming is closest to her heart. She enjoys waking up every morning to go and feed her animals. She is so close with her animals that she has nicknamed one of them. Christine wants to take full advantage of poultry farming as a profitable business venture. She would like to expand her poultry business, but the biggest challenge she faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES, which she will use to buy additional poultry.

With your loan, Christine will be able to expand the poultry section on her farm. This will generate enough income to repay the loan, and she will also be able to save extra money. Christine is very concerned about her children’s education, so profits from farming will go to pay their school fees. Christine dreams of a secure future for her children. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy additional poultry.

loans.name: Shoghik

texts.en:
Shoghik is from Khot village of Syuniq region. Shoghik's husband is a constructor and their son is a doctor. Shoghik herself is involved in cattle breeding. She currently keeps livestock, including six cows, six calves, and hens. By applying for this loan, Shoghik would like to enlarge her livestock by three more calves. 

She has already taken a loan from a local financial institution before, but unfortunately she wasn't able to return it back. However, thanks to the hard work during recent times, Shoghik was able to run her agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that she will be able to cover the monthly payments. 

So, she has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for three calves

loans.name: Hoshim

texts.ru:
Хошим добродушный и жизнерадостный мужчина в возрасте 38 лет. Он женат и имеет троих детей. Поэтому всю свою душу он вкладывает в свою работу. Хошим живёт со своей семьей в небольшом доме в сельском посёлке. Чтобы прокормить свою семью он занимается своим бизнесом. Хошим занимается деканством и животноводством. У него имеется земельная площадь. Из общей площади земли, некоторая часть земли составляет богарные земли, а остальная площадь это поливные земли. На этой земле Хошим занимается выращиванием моркови, картошки и зерновых культур. А его жена помогает ему ухаживать и растить скот. Так как земельная площадь у них большая, они также пасут на ней своих скот. 
Бизнес животноводства приносит хороший доход, поэтому Хошим хочет расширить этот бизнес, увеличив поголовье своего скота. Для этого он обратился в Арванд, чтобы получить кредит на покупку скота. Хошим заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Hoshim is a kind and happy 38-year-old man. He is married and has three children. This is why he invests his whole soul into his work. Hoshim lives with his family in a small house in a village. He is involved in his own business to provide for his family. Hoshim is involved in farming and animal husbandry. He has land, some of which is rainfed land and some is irrigated. Hoshim grows carrots, potatoes and cereal crops on this land. And his wife helps him to care and raise livestock. They also graze livestock on their land because their land area is large.

The animal husbandry business yields a good income, and this is why Hoshim decided to expand this business by increasing his livestock headcount. Thus, he came to Arvand to obtain a loan to buy livestock. Hoshim thanks Arvand for the support in advance.

loans.use: to buy livestock in order to expand his business

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David lives in Homa Bay County. Homa Bay County is located in southwestern Kenya, close to both the Tanzanian border and Lake Victoria, Africa's largest lake. Despite the proximity to the lake, water infrastructure in Homa Bay remains quite undeveloped, and inconsistent rains and occasional droughts make life difficult for farmers in the area. Nonetheless, farmers have adapted to these challenges, particularly by diversifying their crops to include cassava, sunflower, sorghum, bananas, groundnuts and millet, as well as drought-resistant varieties of papaya and mangoes. Although beekeeping has not traditionally been practiced in the region, many individuals have expressed interest in keeping bees and are knowledgeable about their pollination benefits.

David is married and has thirteen children. He is a retired security guard. Both he and his wife are farmers. They have been farming for ten years, and they are currently growing maize, sorghum, beans and sunflowers. David is excited about beekeeping, as it will earn him some income from the sale of honey and provide him with honey for food.

This is David's first loan from Honey Care, and he plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to invest in his farm and to save for the future. David's hope for the future is to improve his housing and to have his children educated.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John lives in Homa Bay. Homa Bay County is located at the southwestern tip of Kenya, and its northern end is dominated by Lake Victoria, the largest lake in the Southern Hemisphere. Lake Victoria extends into three east African countries, allowing cross-border flows of goods and people, and a market day in a lakeside town in Homa Bay County often boasts traders from Ugandan, Tanzania and Kenya, all of whom arrive in boats to ply their wares. Although the semi-arid nature of much of Homa Bay County means that poverty rates are quite high, many people in the region are influenced by a strong cultural emphasis on education, and as a result school attendance figures around Homa Bay are above the national average.

John is married and has four children. He is a retired civil servant. Both he and his wife are farmers. They have been farming for six years, and they are currently growing maize, beans, cow peas and butter nuts. David is excited about beekeeping, as it is a simple project to undertake, and it will earn him some income from the sale of honey.

This is John's first loan from Honey Care, and he plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to invest in poultry farming and to provide for his family's basic needs. John's hope for the future is to impact his community through beekeeping and to have his children educated.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Collins

texts.en:
Collins lives in Homa Bay. Homa Bay County is located in southwestern Kenya and borders on Lake Victoria, the second largest lake in the world. Populations are dense close to the lake, where many individuals make their living from fishing, and a few work in the small but slowly growing tourism industry. A popular tourist attraction in Homa Bay County is Ruma National Park, a game reserve that is home to the rare roan antelope, a shy species distantly related to the reticulated giraffe. Most people in Homa Bay make their living from farming, and the rolling hills of the area are dotted with fields and fruit tree plantations.

Collins is married and has one child. Both he and his wife are farmers. They have been farming for three years, and they are currently growing maize, millet, green grams, ground nuts and bananas. Collins is excited about beekeeping, as it is an easy project to manage.

This is Collins' first loan from Honey Care, and he plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to provide for his family's basic needs. Collins' hope for the future is to impact the health of the people in his community through consumption of honey.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is from Hovtun village, where she lives with her husband, mother-in-law, and four-year-old child. She is a farmer. On the farm, Victoria keeps livestock and organizes cultivation of land from which she harvests wheat and barley. Victoria's husband owns a tractor, which he rents out or uses to provide cultivation work for his fellow villagers.

To enlarge her farm and make it more profitable, Victoria has applied for this loan. As this is Victoria's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who did not have access to credit products before because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to pay for two calves, seeds, fertilizer, and fuel for land cultivation

loans.name: Anzhela

texts.en:
Anzhela lives with her husband and three sons in Stepanavan town.

Her husband is a herdsman in their village. Anzhela herself takes care of their little sons and keeps livestock of three cows and three calves. The family is hardworking and it is very important for them to have a successful and profitable farming business. Anzhela has now applied for this loan of USD 700 to purchase forage for feeding the cattle. As this is her first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who did not have access to credit products before because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to pay for forage for feeding the cattle

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 58 years old, married and blessed with five children. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2011 to benefit from training in enterprise and financial management.
He farms cabbage, carrots and kale. He also does dairy farming to supplement his income .He is borrowing money to buy manure and animal feed.  He hopes this will improve his milk and vegetable production resulting in increased profits. He will use the anticipated profits to meet his family's needs and to purchase school books for his children.
He promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy manure and animal feed to improve farming

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David lives in Homa Bay. Homa Bay County is located in southwestern Kenya, close to both the Tanzanian border and Lake Victoria, Africa's largest lake. Despite the proximity to the lake, water infrastructure in Homa Bay remains quite undeveloped, and irregular rains and occasional droughts make life difficult for farmers in the area. Nonetheless, farmers have adapted to these challenges, particularly by diversifying their crops to include cassava, sunflower, sorghum, bananas, groundnuts and millet, as well as drought-resistant varieties of papaya and mangoes. Although beekeeping has not traditionally been practiced in the region, many individuals have expressed interest in keeping bees and are knowledgeable about their pollination benefits.

David is married and has five children. Both he and his wife are farmers. They have been farming for ten years, and they are currently growing maize, butter nuts, mangoes and citrus fruits. David is excited about beekeeping, as it will earn him some income from the sale of honey and provide him with honey for food.

This is David's first loan from Honey Care, and he plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to pay school fees for his children and to provide for his family's basic needs. David's hope for the future is to improve his housing and to have his children educated.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard lives in Homa Bay. Homa Bay County is located at the southwestern tip of Kenya, and its northern end is dominated by Lake Victoria, the largest lake in the Southern Hemisphere. Lake Victoria extends into three east African countries, allowing cross-border flows of goods and people. A market day in a lakeside town in Homa Bay County often boasts traders from Uganda, Tanzania and Kenya, all of whom arrive in boats to sell their wares. Although the semi-arid nature of much of Homa Bay County means that poverty rates are quite high, many people in the region are influenced by a strong cultural emphasis on education, and as a result school attendance figures around Homa Bay are above the national average.

Richard is married and has two children. Both he and his wife are farmers. They have been farming for ten years, and they are currently growing maize, millet and beans and they also keep livestock. Richard is excited about beekeeping, as it will earn him some income from the sale of honey and provide him with honey for medicine.

This is Richard's first loan from Honey Care, and he plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to pay school fees for his children. Richard's hope for the future is to start a CBO for beekeeping and to have a healthy family.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Angel Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario está integrado por tres mujeres (Fidelia, Bernicia y Waleska Vanessa) de la etnia miskita de Bilwi, municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Son mujeres emprendedoras que trabajan día a día con el empeño de lograr el crecimiento de sus pequeños negocios de: Venta de bastimentos y ropa usada; se organizaron como grupo solidario desde hace 4 meses para obtener préstamo en Pana Pana con garantía solidaria

Bernicia: Es integrante del grupo solidario, es una señora amable de 52 años de edad, casada con  8 hijos: 6 son mayores de edad e independientes, la de 20 años estudia su primer año de carrera universitaria y la menor de 15 años cursa su primer año de secundaria. Con el propósito de contar con su propia fuente de ingresos y aportar con los gastos del hogar y estudios de sus hijas, desde hace 23 años vende pescados, bastimentos y utensilios usados de aluminio y acero inoxidable. Esta solicitando financiamiento para comprar una paca de artículos y utensilios del hogar y venderlos a precios accesibles a su clientela de Bilwi. Ella sueña con tener una tienda donde pueda ofertar ropa nueva y artículos de utensilios plásticos y de vidrios para el hogar.
texts.en:
This solidarity group is comprised of three women (Fidelia, Bernicia and Waleska Vanessa) from the Miskito ethnic group of Bilwi, in Puerto Cabezas. They are entrepreneurial women who work day to day, striving to grow their small businesses where they sell supplies and used clothing. They formed a solidarity group four months ago to obtain a loan from Pana Pana with a joint guarantee.

Bernicia is a member of the solidarity group. She is a friendly woman who is 52 years old, married with eight children. Six are adults and independent, the 20-year-old is studying her first year of university and the youngest is 15 years old and is attending the first year of high school.

With the purpose of having her own source of income to afford the household expenses and schooling for her daughters, Bernicia has been selling fish, supplies, and used aluminum and stainless steel utensils, for the past 23 years. She is requesting financing to buy a number of household articles and utensils to sell at reasonable prices to her customers in Bilwa. She dreams of having a store where she can offer new clothing and plastic and glass household utensils.

loans.use: to buy a number of household articles and utensils.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is married and has six children. He and his wife are farmers, which they have been doing for 10 years. They are currently growing maize, millet, and beans.  

Peter lives in Homa Bay. Homa Bay county is located in southwest Kenya and borders onto Lake Victoria, the second largest lake in the world. Populations are dense close to the lake, where many individuals make their living from fishing, and a few work in the small but slowly growing tourism industry. A popular tourist attraction in Homa Bay is Ruma National Park, a game reserve that is home to the rare roan antelope, a shy species distantly related to the reticulated giraffe. Most people in Homa Bay make their living from farming, and the rolling hills of the area are dotted with fields and fruit tree plantations.

Peter requested his first loan Honey Care, which he will use to purchase beehives and apiary materials for honey production. He is excited about beekeeping as it will earn him extra income from the sale of honey and provide him with honey for food. He plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to pay school fees for his children. Peter's hope for the future is to open a kiosk.

loans.use: to purchase beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothes like pants, blouses, underwear, etc.

loans.name: Sr. De Torrechayoc Ii Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SR. DE TORRECHAYOC II”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Neyda ella es soltera y tiene 34 años y tiene 1 hijo; La socia trabaja en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes y restaurant, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche y galletas, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante, la socia es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azúcar, leche y galletas.
El socio que esta tapado con un circulo su rostro ya no pertenece al banco comunal Sr de Torrechayoc II
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de artesanía, negocio de agricultura, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de animales.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the communal bank Sr. De Torrechayoc II, which is located in the district and province of Urubamba, in the department of Cusco.

Neyda is one of its members. She is 34 years old, single, and has one child. Her business is a grocery store and restaurant, where she works selling basic products like rice, sugar, milk, and cookies. She is a hardworking and enterprising member, and she wants her business to enable her to get ahead. Her goal is to expand her business. She is requesting this loan to buy rice, sugar, milk, and cookies.

neyda  would like to thank everyone who makes this dream possible by making resources available. She promises to comply with all of her payment terms.

The rest of the members work selling crafts, farming, running a grocery store, and selling animals.

The person with a circle over his face used to be a member, but no longer belongs to this communal bank.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk, and cookies.

loans.name: Emprender-73 Group

texts.es:
Clara es una mujer de 35 años de edad, casada, tiene 4 hijos de 15, 12, 10 y 8 años, y su negocio es la venta de productos naturales para la salud.
Ella es buena madre, cariñosa, generosa, responsable y trabajadora. Su actividad la desarrolla de forma ambulante en el barrio ‘plan 3000’; caracterizado por convertirse en un pujante brazo de producción donde microempresarios de todas las áreas, como la costura, el diseño y las artesanías, imitan productos extranjeros que se comercializan en los principales mercados locales, es el barrio más poblado de la ciudad, de clima cálido tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 18-35 grados centigrados.
Clara es de tez trigueña, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado, ojos obscuros, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza (al centro usa falda larga de jean y blusa azul floreada).  Su vida la comparte con su esposo que se dedica al comercio y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Su necesidad de ampliar su negocio para generar mejores ingresos económicos y pagar los gastos de su familia la llevó a liderar una banca de personas con negocios como; taller mecánico, venta de comida, venta de ropa, venta de masitas, confección de tejidos, librería y mantenimiento de computadoras, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus actividades. Su negocio es la venta de productos naturales para la salud, como; nutrición básica, nutrición específica, deportes y vida activa, nutrición externa, etc., labor que realiza de forma ambulante todos los días de la semana y a toda hora. “mi catálogo de productos está pensado para que mis clientes gocen de un estilo de vida saludable y activo…” comenta. Su sueño es tener un puesto de venta fijo para dejar de ambular, ella desea realizar la compra de productos naturales para nutrición por mayor para contar con una mayor oferta. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que viene desarrollando esta actividad de forma independiente. 
Es por esos motivos que Clara solicita un préstamo para la compra de productos nutricionales por mayor para contar con una mayor oferta y aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Clara is a 35-year-old woman. She is married and has 4 children aged 8, 10, 12, and 15, and her business is selling natural health products.

She is a good mother, affectionate, generous, responsible, and hard-working. She works as a street vendor in the “Plan 3000” neighborhood, which is characterized by its becoming a booming production sector where microbusinesspeople in all areas, such as tailoring, design, and handcrafts, imitate foreign products that are sold in the main local markets. It is the most populous neighborhood of the city, with a hot tropical climate with a temperature that varies during the day between 18-35 degrees Centigrade.

Clara has dark skin, long black hair that she ties up, dark eyes, short stature, and a robust physical complexion. Her native language is Guaraní, which she speaks at home. She speaks Spanish due to the general culture and due to the business that she does (in the center, she wears a long jean skirt and a blue shirt with flowers). She shares her life with her husband, who works in business, and with her children who are students at school. They live in their own house built of brick that has potable water, electricity, and a sewage system. Her need to expand her business in order to generate a better income and pay her family’s expenses brought her to lead a communal bank of people with businesses such as a mechanic shop, selling food, selling clothes, selling pastries, selling knitted goods, bookstore, and computer maintenance, in order to ask for a loan and improve their businesses. 

Her business is selling natural health products such as basic nutrition, specific nutrition, sports and active lifestyle, external nutrition, etc. She does this work as a street vendor every day of the week and all the time. “My product catalogue is designed so that my customers will enjoy a healthy and active lifestyle,” she says. Her dream is to have a permanent stall in order to stop walking around. She wants to buy wholesale natural nutrition products in order to have a better selection. This is the 1st loan cycle with the institution in the 2 years she has been doing this work on her own.

It is for these reasons that Clara is asking for a loan to buy wholesale nutritional products in order to have a better selection and increase her sales.

loans.use: to buy wholesale nutritional products in order to have a better selection and increase her sales

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase cinder-blocks, iron, cement and gravel

loans.name: El Esfuerzo (Flat) Group

texts.es:
La comunidad donde viven los integrantes del grupo El Esfuerzo, es una región cañera. La economía del lugar depende en gran parte de la producción de dicho fruto y durante la temporada de corte, cuando las plantaciones pierden su altura, muchas comunidades quedan al descubierto. Los integrantes eligieron el nombre de su grupo al hacer referencia al esfuerzo diario que cada uno realiza para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, ellos son:

Roberto,  Isabel, María Magdalena - Venta de Pollo
Paula, Ana - Venta de antojitos
María Del Carmen – Venta de ropa y cosméticos 
Rosalba – Venta de piñas, hamburguesas y hot-dogs 
María – Venta de dulces 
Patricia –  Venta de mercería 
Elodia - Venta de piña y jugos 

Don Roberto es conocido por todos como Beto, desde hace ya 3 años se ha dedicado a recorrer las calles de diferentes comunidades, cercanas o incluso las más retiradas para vender carne de pollo. El satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes y brindar a su familia mejores oportunidades que las que él mismo vivió de pequeño, son sus objetivos. Beto se levanta todos los días a las 4 am, para comenzar a preparar todo el material y la carne que necesitará durante el día. 

Con sus ganancias y ahorros, Beto logró comprarse una moto, sigue apoyando a su hijo con sus estudios y también invierte en su negocio de pollo además de la compra de refrescos y frituras que también vende para tener un ingreso extra. Para continuar con su actividad, Beto necesita comprar 60 pollos, alimento y bolsas de plástico y para ello ha solicitado un crédito a VisionFund México. 

A corto plazo, a Don Beto le gustaría vender pollos asados, arroz y salsa los fines de semana. Ya ha planeado esta nueva actividad que beneficiará a las personas de su comunidad que actualmente tienen que recorrer una larga distancia para comprar pollo. Acerca de su vida personal y sus logros, Beto comenta “Soy padre soltero, con mi trabajo y esfuerzo he sacado a mis dos hijos adelante, agradezco a cada una de las personas que hacen posible los préstamos".
 
*Don Roberto es el único hombre en el grupo, la fotografía fue tomada en el patio de su casa.
texts.en:
The community where the members of El Esfuerzo live belongs to a sugar cane region. The local economy largely depends on this crop and during the harvest season, when the plantations are trimmed down, many communities become exposed. The members of this group chose the name El Esfuerzo (Spanish for effort), referring to the daily effort each one of them makes in order to improve their families' quality of life.

They all work selling various products, such as chicken (Roberto, Isabel, and María Magdalena); snacks (Paula and Ana); clothing and cosmetics (María Del Carmen); pineapple, hamburgers, and hot dogs (Rosalba); sweets (María); merchandise (Patricia); and pineapple and juice (Elodia).

Everyone knows Roberto as Beto. For the past three years now, he has been working as a street vendor selling chicken. He covers the streets of several nearby communities and also travels to others further away. His goals are to meet his customers' needs and to give his family better opportunities than he had growing up. Beto gets up every day at 4:00 am to start preparing all the meat and everything he needs for the day.

Beto was able to purchase a motorcycle with his earnings and profit. He is still helping his son with his studies and also invests in his business. Aside from chicken, he also buys soft drinks and fried products in order to make some extra income. In order to continue working, Beto needs to buy sixty chickens, feed, and plastic bags, so he has requested a loan from VisionFund Mexico. 

In the short run, Beto would like to start selling roast chickens, rice, and salsa on the weekends. He has already planned this out, and the new business will benefit the people in his community who currently have to travel long distances in order to buy chicken. Regarding his personal life and his achievements, Beto says "I'm a single dad and I have provided for my two kids thanks to my effort and work. I'm grateful to each one of the people who make loans possible."

Roberto is the only man in the group. The picture was taken outside his house.

loans.use: to buy chickens, feed, and plastic bags.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is married and she works hard to support her family.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines, and also earns income from raising livestock and selling rice grains. Fe is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Fe has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is from Qarinj village. He lives with his wife and daughter Manush (in the photo) who is a student at Pedagogical University. Robert's son serves in the army. The family's only occupation is in agriculture. Robert and his wife keep livestock and cultivate potatoes. To be able to cover his daughter Manush's university tuition, Robert has applied for this loan. Lenders' support is very important for this family to give Manush an opportunity to continue her studies in the university.

loans.use: to pay for his daughter Manush's university tuition

loans.name: Luz Edid

texts.es:
Luz, de 25 años, tiene muy claro que es lo que quiere para su vida y está decidida a culminar sus estudios para salir adelante y tener una buena vida.

Ella desea desempeñarse como vendedora de mercancía variada tales como ropa, accesorios como billeteras y algunos cosméticos, entre otros, en el municipio de Apartado.

Esta actividad desea iniciarla con el afán de buscar los recursos necesarios para su sostenimiento y para sus estudios, además de poder contribuir con los gastos en su hogar.
Es una mujer emprendedora y muy disciplinada.

Ella solicita un crédito para comprar un amplio surtido de ropa al por mayor y de este modo aprovechar la oportunidad que le presenta la Corporación Interactuar de ser independiente.

Tiene la esperanza de poder progresar como empresaria y tener unos ingresos más estables y agradece a todas las personas que puedan contribuir con su sueño.
texts.en:
Luz, 25, knows well what she wants in life and she has decided to complete her studies in order to get ahead and have a good life.
She wishes to become a merchant of various kinds of merchandise such as clothing, accessories like wallets, and some cosmetics among other things in the municipality of Apartado.
She wishes to start this activity with the desire to seek resources necessary for her sustenance and for her studies, in addition to being able to contribute to the household expenses.
She is an enterprising and very disciplined woman.
She is requesting a loan in order to buy an ample assortment of clothing wholesale and in this way take advantage of the opportunity that the Interactuar Corporation affords her to be independent.
She has the hope to be able to progress as a businesswoman and to have more stable income.  She thanks all the people who can contribute to her dream.

loans.use: to buy an ample assortment of clothing wholesale.

loans.name: Wil Alfredo

texts.es:
Wil de 31 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, debido a que le tenía que ayudar en el trabajos a sus padres, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los oficios del hogar, tiene  3 hijos de los cuales solo dos van a la escuela. 

Wil se dedica desde hace mucho tiempo a trabajar prestando servicio de transporte con moto-taxi, pues es un trabajo que es rentable en la zona, anteriormente se dedicaba a trabajar con otra persona en una moto-taxi pero luego decidio independizarse.

El crédito lo necesita para hacer reparaciones a su moto-taxi, el cual le es de mucha urgencia pues es su principal fuente de ingresos.



Sus sueños son hacer más grande su casa y apoyar a sus hijos en los estudios.
texts.en:
Wil, 31, has a sixth grade education, because he had to help his parents with work. He is in a common-law relationship and his partner works as a homemaker. He has three children, but only two attend school.

Wil has been working for a long time, offering transportation services with his motorcycle taxi, and it is profitable work in the area. Previously, he worked with another person in a motorcycle taxi business, but he decided to become independent.

He needs the loan to do repairs on his motorcycle taxi, which is very important, because it is his main source of income.

His dreams are to increase the size of his home and to pay for his children to attend school.

loans.use: to do repairs on his motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Gustavo De Jesus

texts.es:
Gustavo, de 32 años, ha optado por montar un negocio de venta de alimentos cerca a su casa ubicada en el municipio de Sabaneta, en este negocio vende frituras, gaseosas, Entre otros.

Gustavo trabaja todos los días desde las 6 de la mañana hasta la 5 de la tarde, es un hombre muy responsable, juicioso y aplicado con su negocio.

Entre sus sueños más latentes esta el poder tener un restaurante en el que ofrezcan distintos tipos de alimentos y puede ofrecer empleos. 

Enfrenta múltiples dificultades como el costo de los insumos, la competencia en el sector y las fuertes lluvias que azotan su puesto de trabajo.

El pide un aliento económico para capitalizar su negocio y comprar surtido de golosinas, frituras y bebidas.

El crédito impactara su vida y su negocio de un modo muy favorable pues podrá cumplir con su sueño y tendrá una mayor variedad de alimentos para ofrecer a sus clientes, además de que de este negocio depende su hijo.
texts.en:
Gustavo, a 32 year old man, has decided to start a business selling food near his hometown of Sabaneta. In his shop, he sells chips, soda, and more. Gustavo works every day from 6 in the morning until 5 at night. He is a very responsible, level-headed, and focused on his business. Among his most latent dreams is being able to have his own restaurant, which offers different types of products and opportunities for employment.

He faces many difficulties in his business, such as the cost of his inputs, competition in the sector, and heavy rains that hit his town. He is asking for a loan to improve his business and buy an assortment of sweets, chips, and drinks. 

The loan will impact his life and his business in a very favorable way; he will be able to fulfill his dreams and to have a greater variety to offer his clients. His son depends on his business.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of sweets, chips, and drinks.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco es un hombre de 49 años de edad tienen una hermosa familia de 9 hijos de las edades de entre 8 y 30 años, vive en una comunidad de sololá.

Francisco  es una persona  muy responsable con su familia, él madruga para trabajar, para el bienestar de su familia. Pues para la generación de sus ingresos Francisco es albañil,  él construye casas, muros, es un trabajo muy entretenido pero cansado, este trabajo él lo aprendió hace 29 años, Francisco tiene mucha experiencia es esta profesión es por eso que él no se da abasto con la gente que lo contrata para construcción porque él es muy reconocido, por su amabilidad y la garantía con que hace el trabajo.
Pero Francisco es un padre de familia generoso que se preocupa por el futuro de sus hijos es por eso que quiere construir su casa, pero con los precio altos que tienen los materiales de construcción con lo que gana Francisco no le alcanza es por eso que el solicita un prestamo que lo utilizara para comprar cemento, bloc, arena y hierro y construir la casa de sus sueños. El deseo de Francisco es hacer que la construcción termine este año para ofrecerle a su familia una mejor vida.
texts.en:
Francisco is 49 year-old man. He lives in Sololá along with his wife and nine children whose ages range from 8 to 30 years old. Francisco is a person who is very responsible with his family. He gets up early to work for their well-being. 

To earn his income, he works as a builder. He constructs houses and walls. It is enjoyable but tiring work. He has been doing it for 29 years. Francisco is very experienced in his profession. He is in high demand with the people who hire him for construction because he is very well known for his good nature and the guaranteed quality of his work.

He is a generous father who is concerned for his children’s future. This is why he wants to build his house, but with the high prices of construction materials, what he earns isn’t enough. He is requesting a loan to buy cement, cement blocks, sand and rebar to build his dream home. He hopes to complete construction this year in order to offer his family a better life.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, lime and rebar.

loans.name: Silvan

texts.en:
Silvan lives in Homa Bay. Homa Bay County is located in southwestern Kenya, close to both the Tanzanian border and Lake Victoria, Africa's largest lake. Despite the proximity to the lake, water infrastructure in Homa Bay remains quite undeveloped, and inconsistent rains and occasional droughts make life difficult for farmers in the area. Nonetheless, farmers have adapted to these challenges, particularly by diversifying their crops to include cassava, sunflowers, sorghum, bananas, groundnuts and millet, as well as drought-resistant varieties of papayas and mangoes. Although beekeeping has not traditionally been practiced in the region, many individuals have expressed interest in keeping bees and are knowledgeable about their pollination benefits.

Silvan is married and has four children. He runs a small business and is a farmer as well. He has been farming for six years now and he is currently growing maize, beans, ground nuts and tomatoes. Silvan is excited about beekeeping as it is an easy project to manage and it will earn him some income from the sale of honey.

This is Silvan's first loan with Honey Care and he plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to invest in business. Silvan's hope for the future is to expand his beekeeping project and increase his honey production.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to train and get an education in graphic desing.

loans.name: Centre Agricole Pour Le Developpement Des Paysans

texts.en:
After 14 years of experience in the agricultural sector, and following the advice of his former professor at the Agricultural Technical School, Benito established a rural organization in the north of Haiti. That organization includes mostly agronomists and agricultural technicians and their main activity is the preparation and marketing of various seedlings. Benito's organization has participated in projects with various institutions and individuals working in the agricultural sector.The committee board is composed as follows: Benito as coordinator, Henry as his Assistant, Fleurise as secretary, René as head of Project and Dejoie as Advisor.

As part of the Project of USAID/AVANSE, his organization was selected to provide seedlings to Northern farmers. Throughout this partnership, his organization will create two new part-time jobs. To do this, a loan is essential for the organization. That's why this organization turned to Zafèn. Trough a partnership with Zafen, PADF has already supported this project up to 25%. Therefore the amount posted on kiva is 75%.

loans.use: To buy 200,000 polyethylene bags to provide seedlings to farmers

borrowers.first_name: Centre Agricole Pour Le Developpement Des Paysans

loans.name: Norma Macrina

texts.en:
Norma is 67 years old; she is married and has six grown, independent sons. 

Norma works with her husband making and selling plastic sheeting that is used for food stalls and events. They have a small workshop inside their house and have been doing this line of work for over 40 years. 

Norma is asking for this loan to make some home repairs in her house, specifically repaire some plumbing issues that her bathrooms are presenting; her goal is to keep working because she enjoys it.

loans.use: To make some home improvements.

loans.name: Kuuga Na Gwika Women Group

texts.en:
Kuuga Na Gwika Women Group joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2014 to benefit from training on enterprise development and management. The group members have embraced the training and have opened small enterprises.

The person raising her hand is Alice. She is 58 years old, married and blessed with two children.

Her main economic activities are vegetable farming, raising poultry and keeping a local dairy cow. She is borrowing a Kiva loan so as to buy manure to boost her farming. She looks forward to a bountiful harvest, and thus a greater income that she plans to plough back into expanding her farming business.

Alice is happy and very grateful to Kiva for assisting her in expanding her business.

loans.use: To buy manure that will help boost farm production and thus generate more income

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
The person in the photograph is Simon. He is 43 years old, married, and blessed with four children. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from training on enterprise management. His economic activity is poultry and dairy farming. He also farms maize, beans, and potatoes.

He is borrowing this Kiva loan to buy animal feeds. He hopes this purchase will help improve his farm's productivity, thus generating more income to cater for his expenses. Simon is grateful to Kiva for the support because it will assist him in improving his business.

loans.use: to buy animal feeds that will improve his milk yield and increase his income

loans.name: Gituamba Abc Women Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand is named Ruth. She is 53 years old, married, and has five children. All of her children have completed schooling.

Ruth is a dairy, poultry, and vegetable farmer. She is borrowing from Kiva to buy poultry feeds and to build a better shed for her chickens. These purchases will help improve her farm's productivity and hence generate a higher yield. This will lead to more income, and thus she will be in a position to cater for basic family needs.

Ruth is grateful to Kiva and all of its lenders for the great help.

loans.use: to buy feeds and to construct a better shed for her poultry, which will improve her income.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en: Margarita is 48 she is married and has three children that are in school. She is dedicated to raising dairy cattle, has two cows that produce milk and 5 steers, her husband  works as a peon farm. In rainy season income goes down, which is why she is requesting a loan to be able to buy a dairy cow fodder to feed their animals and care for them at this time. The Margarita loan will help increase production on his farm, and continue to provide economic security to your home and her children and mother

loans.use: To buy cow's fodder and maintain her farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy rice, beans, meat, chicken, vegetables, fruit and other products

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Sandra works hard to support her family.

She has an internet café business in the Philippines, and earns additional income selling frozen foods. Sandra is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to buy additional computer supplies.

Sandra has been sustaining her business activities through her past 24 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional computer supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase potato seeds and forage for feeding cattle

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Hello lenders! Meet Mary, a very hardworking, energetic young farmer. Although she has only farmed for the past ten years, she is working hard and learning good farming practices. Through the profits she makes, she has been able to take care of her family and provide the basic needs for her parents. 

Mary lives near Kasubwa in the Kapsowar area of Kenya, an area with good weather patterns and favorable weather conditions that support farming. Maize is a very common crop in Kenya and is a staple food for many who regularly eat “ugali,“ or hard porridge cooked from maize. One can usually buy sifted maize flour in the market, but its cost is higher because of the processing. Flour can be less expensive, however, if it is milled directly using a posho mill. 

The Kasubwa area has only one diesel posho mill that serves a great number of people. The main problem here is that the posho mill keeps breaking down so farmers cannot grind their maize. Mary intends to change this by buying another posho mill to serve the area. She will buy an electric, rather than diesel, posho mill, as they are more reliable. Hopefully breakdowns will be few and far between. 

To accomplish this, Mary is applying for a 130,000 KES loan through Juhudi Kilimo to buy a mill. Profits derived from the mill will be used to comfortably repay the loan. In the next two years, Mary sees herself established and running more than one posho mill. She patiently waits for your kindness.

loans.use: To buy an electric posho (cornmeal) mill

loans.name: Hanady

texts.en:
Hanady is a 22-year-old single lady living with her family in Ajloun. She is a university student majoring in accounting, and she is in her last year. Her father is retired with low income. Hanady is aiming to find a job in her field of study after graduating. 

By applying for this loan, Hanady is now asking for your help to pay her upcoming semester fees.

loans.use: To pay her upcoming semester fees

loans.name: María Irma

texts.es:
María tiene 52 años de edad, está casada y tiene 1 hijo, su esposo se dedica a la ganadería, y María solo pudo estudiar educación básica.

María se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pan dulce, ha realizado esta atividad durante 10 años y además colabora con su esposo en el cuido de ganado. Ella comienza a las 3:00 AM a hornear pan para tenerlo listo a las 6:00 AM cuando sus clientes lleguen a comprar.

María necesita el crédito para comprar harina, levadura, manteca, huevos, azúcar y demás insumos para la elaboración de pan, ya que tiene mucha demanda y quiere comprar al por mayor.

Su sueño es tener una panadería formal y tener diversidad de pan para el gusto de los clientes.
texts.en: María is 52 years old, married and with one child. Her husband works in animal husbandry. Maria was only able to study elementary education. Maria works making and selling sweet bread. She has worked in this job for 10 years, and she also helps her husband taking care of the cattle. At 3:00 AM she starts baking bread in order to have it ready by 6:00 AM when her customers arrive. Maria needs a loan to buy flour, yeast, lard, eggs, sugar, and other ingredients to make bread, because she has a lot of demand and she wants to buy at wholesale prices. Her dream is to have a formal bakery and to have a variety of breads in order to please the taste of her customers.

loans.use: to buy flour, yeast, lard, eggs, sugar and other ingredients to make bread.

loans.name: Argelio

texts.es:
Argelio de 53 años de edad, estudió hasta segundo año de educación media, está soltero pero tiene un hijo mayor de edad que vive en USA, Argelio vive junto a su hermana.

Él se dedica a la crianza de ganado, negocio que emprendió por un hermano, además es albañil, Argelio viaja em pick up para dirigirse a su trabajo.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar ganado, criarlo y luego venderlos, esto mejorará su condición de vida puues podrá generar ingresos para el hogar.

Su sueño es tener su propio local de ganadería.
texts.en:
Argelio, 53 years old, studied until the second year of secondary education. He is unmarried but has an adult son who lives in the USA. Argelio lives with his sister. 

He earns his living raising cattle. He undertook this business with his brother. He is also a mason. He travels in a pick-up truck to get to work. 

He needs the loan to buy cattle to breed and sell. This will improve his life conditions because he can generate income for the household. His dream is to have his own stockyard.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to breed and sell

loans.name: Erika Del Rosario

texts.es:
Erika de 35 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, ahora esta acompañada y tiene un hijo de 6 años de edad que estudia en la escuela, su pareja se dedica a lavar autos.

Erika tiene una pequeña tienda se ha dedicado desde hace 10 años a esta actividad, anteriormente se dedicaba a trabajar en un comedor, la tienda que posee esta en su casa y trabaja de 7:00 a 6:00 pm.


Este préstamo lo necesita  para solventar deudas con sus proveedores y comprar mas mercadería para seguir invirtiendo.

A futuro piensa ampliar el negocio y que su hijo se supere estudiando en la universidad.
texts.en:
Erika is 35 years old, and she studied until the eight grade at school. Now, she has a 6 year old son, who is studying at school, and she lives with her partner, who makes a living washing cars. 

Erika has a small shop that she has been running for 10 years. She used to work in a dining room. The shop that she owns is located in her home, and she works from 7am until 6pm. 

She needs this loan to settle some debts with her suppliers and purchase more merchandise in order to continue investing in her business. 

In the future she aims to expand her business, and hopes her son will better himself by studying at university.

loans.use: to settle some debts with her suppliers and purchase more merchandise in order to continue investing in her business.

loans.name: Lidia Cristina

texts.es:
Lidia tiene 70 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de asistir a la escuela, está casada y ha procreado 2 hijos que ya se encuentran casados pero son una familia muy unida y trabajadora.

Lidia se dedica a los oficios domésticos y al cultivo de café aunque por su edad avanzada no puede realizarlos sola y por lo tanto tiene que contratar mozos.


Este crédito lo necesita para comprar pilones de café, también pagara mozos para que le ayuden con la siembra.

Ella sueña con obtener la producción esperada para obtener ganancias.
texts.en:
Lidia is 70 years old. She did not have the opportunity to go to school. She is married and has produced 2 children who are now married, but they are a very united and hard-working family.

Lidia takes care of the household duties and coffee growing, although due to her advanced age she cannot do it alone, and therefore has to hire young people.

She needs this loan in order to buy coffee seedlings, and also to pay the young people for them to help her with the harvest.

She dreams of obtaining the production hoped for in order to earn income.

loans.use: to buy coffee seedlings, and also to pay young people to help her with the harvest

loans.name: Milagro Del Carmen

texts.es:
Milagro de 53 años de edad, estudio el bachillerato, ya no siguió debido a lo economía de su familia, es madre soltera de un hijo por quien trabaja para sacar adelante, ya sea en oficios domésticos o sembrando café.

Ella  necesita este crédito debido a que su hijo ha iniciado sus estudios y le quiere comprar los útiles escolares, zapatos y el uniforme deportivo.

Su sueño más grande es ver a su hijo convertirse en un profesional.
texts.en:
Milagro is 53 years old, she studied for her baccalaureate but she could not continue due to the financial situation of her family. She is a single mother of one child who she works for in order for them to get ahead whether by doing domestic work or planting coffee.

She needs this loan as her child has begun their studies and she wants to buy them school supplies, shoes and sports kit. 

Her biggest dream is to see her child become a professional.

loans.use: to buy school supplies, shoes and sports kit for her child.

loans.name: Maria Nelly

texts.es:
María de 42 años de edad,  no fue a la escuela ya que en el lugar donde vivía no había escuelas cerca, tiene 3 hijos por quienes lucha para darles lo mejor.


María desde pequeña se dedica a los trabajos del hogar y a los trabajos en los cultivos de maíz y frijol.

Este crédito lo necesita para comprar abonos, fertilizante y pagar mozos para la siembra de maíz y frijol. 

Ella sueña con mejorar su casa y que sus hijos sigan estudiando para que no tengan que pasar todo lo que ella vivio por la necesidad de trabajar.
texts.en:
42-year old María never went to school as there were no schools nearby in the area where she used to live. She has three children for whom she works very hard to give them the best she can.

Ever since she was young she has done the household chores as well as growing maize and beans. She needs this loan to buy manure, fertilizer, and to pay workers to plant the crops.

María’s dreams are to make improvements to her house and to see her children educated so they don’t have to go through what she did.

loans.use: buy manure, fertilizer, and to pay workers to plant the crops

loans.name: Jackline's Group

texts.en:
Jackline is a group leader, representing her group of 10 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. She is married and has two children. She is known by her community as a very hardworking individual.

Jackline joined One Acre Fund in 2009 because she wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Since she joined the program, her life has improved, especially because she has learned from farming trainings. With the profits from the coming harvesting season, Jackline plans to send her children to school.

Among the 10 farmers in Jackline's Group, a total of 6.25 acres of land will be planted using the maize seeds and fertilizer received with the loan. Seven of the farmers in the group will be purchasing solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Susy's Group

texts.en:
Susy, pictured above, has six children and is always described as a very experienced farmer, which is why she was selected to become the group leader of her group. Susy is representing her group of 10 farmers in Webuye District and is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

Susy has been a farmer for more than 30 years and, in order to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, she decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season. Her loan will not only include farming inputs but also a solar light, which she is very happy to be getting as that means she will now have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. With the profits from this coming season, Susy is planning to send her children to school.

A total of 4 acres will be planted by Susy's Group, and between them they will receive a total of 7 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Jose Alfonso

texts.es:
José tiene 43 años de edad, esta acompañado y tiene 7 hijos de los cuales los mayores ya formaron sus propios hogares y los menores viven con él en casa y le ayudan en los trabajos agrícolas.

José desde muy pequeño se ha dedicado a la agricultura, el siembra maíz, frijol, maicillo siendo esta actividad su principal fuente de ingresos para mantener a su familia.

Él solicita ayuda a Credicampo para comprar abono, fertilizantes y para pagar el alquiler del terreno donde cultiva. 


Su sueño es tener una mejore casa, más ganado y que sus hijos encuentren un mejor trabajo que les de mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
José is 43 years old, is married and has 7 children. The oldest ones already have their own homes and the younger ones live with him in his house and help him with his farming work.

José has earned a living farming since he was young. He grows corn, beans and millet which is his main source of income for looking after his family.

He is asking for help from Credicampo to buy manure, fertilisers and to pay for the rent for the land where he farms.

His dream is to have a better house, more livestock and that his children find a better job that gives them better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilisers, and to pay the rent for the land where he farms.

loans.name: Encarnación

texts.es:
Encarnación de 44 años de edad, estudio hasta 6º grado, esta casado y su esposa trabaja de empleada en la alcaldía municipal de la comunidad,tiene dos hijos que estudian en la escuela.

Encarnación desde hace quince años tiene una pequeña tienda de productos de primera necesidad,el se deicidio a 
este negocio con el propósito de ayudarle a su esposa a obtener mas ingresos y por lo tanto vende todos los días de lunes a domingo.

Encarnación solicita el préstamo para invertirlo en su negocio, comprara frijoles, papel higiénico, aceite, maíz y otros productos que sus clientes buscan, de esa manera lograra mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
El sueño de Encarnación es que sus hijos sean profesionales y que les ayuden cuando el y su esposa ya no puedan trabajar.
texts.en:
Encarnación, 44 years old, studied through 6th grade. He is married and his spouse works as an employee at the community's municipal hall. He has two children who are students at school.

Encarnación has had a small grocery store selling staple goods for fifteen years. He decided on this business with the goal of helping his wife to have more income, and he is therefore open every day of the week.

Encarnación is asking for the loan in order to invest it in his business. He will buy beans, toilet paper, oil, corn, and other products that his customers are looking for. In this way, he will succeed in improving the quality of life for him and his family.

Encarnación's dream is that his children become professionals and that they help him and his wife when they can no longer work.

loans.use: to buy beans, toilet paper, oil, corn, and other products that his customers are looking for

loans.name: Abdusamad

texts.ru: Абдусамад  мужчина в возрасте 51 лет. Он женат и отец 5-ых  детей. Он очень трудолюбивый человек и любит животных. Он работает около 30 лет преподавателям физики в школе №12 кишлака Ругунд. Ежемесячно получает небольшую заработную плату. У него есть дополнительный доход от животноводства  и пчеловодства. Абдусамад  около 15 лет занимается откорм крупно и мелко рогатого скота, в доме его есть 4 голов коровы и 50 семей пчел. В делах  ему помогает  его семья. Его сын Абдучаббор студент 2-ого курса ХФТУТ. Абдусамад обратился в Арванд для получение кредита. Он хочет приобрести ноутбук. Он заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Abdusamad is 51 and married with five children. He is a very hardworking person who loves animals. He has been working as a physics teacher in school No. 12 of the village Rugund for about 30 years and receives a small monthly salary. He also earns additional income from animal husbandry and beekeeping. For about 15 years, Abdusamad has been fattening large and small livestock. He current has four cows and 50 beehives, which he cares for with the help of his family.

Abdusamad's son Abduchabbor is a second-year student at the Khujand branch of the Technological Institute of Tajikistan. Abdusamad has approached Arvand for a loan so he can buy a laptop computer. He thanks Arvand in advance for the support.

loans.use: to buy a computer

loans.name: Rachel's Group

texts.en:
Rachel is a 54-year-old proud mother of five children. She is a group leader, often described as a very trustworthy person, and is representing her group of 12 farmers in Webuye District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2014, Rachel has noticed that she has learned a lot from farming trainings.

Rachel described her harvest as very good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to have light during the night in order to feel safer. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to buy a cow.

With this loan, Rachel’s Group will be able to plant a total of 4.5 acres of land and purchase a total of 15 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Misericordia Group

texts.en:
The five women of this group live in Santiago, Sacatepéquez, Guatemala. Most of them are Mayan and speak both Kaqchiquel and Spanish, and they wear the traditional dress of their village. They range in age from 37 years to 63 years. One woman is illiterate and the others have 2-4 years of primary school education.  Among the business represented are, a small store, sales of fruits and vegetables, and sales of sewing materials. They are looking forward to working with Namaste because they feel they need the business and money management classes that Namaste provides.  Each woman has a dream and with the help of the classes and a Namaste Business Advisor they will be able to grow their business and achieve their dream.
One hard-working member of this group, Doña Vilma, is a very entrepreneurial woman, and with the help of her husband has opened a small store in the local market. Three times a week she also goes to the big market in Guatemala City where she sells vegetables.  For this she gets up at three in the morning to make the trip and be there on time.  Her husband helps her by looking after the store when she is away at the market. Vilma has worked since she was a very small girl.  Her parents did not have the resources to keep her to school beyond the fourth grade.  For this reason it is very important to her that her three children finish school.
