Two of them are currently in school and a third is still too young. And her continuing dream is to make enough money to give her children a good education.
Currently her monthly net profit from both businesses is 6,050 Guatemalan Quetzales.  By the end of the nine-month loan cycle she expects to increase that amount by 33%. She wants to invest her loan money in more vegetables and products for her little store and sales point at the market.

loans.use: to buy more products and vegetables for her store and sales point at the market

loans.name: Enrique Orlando

texts.en:
Enrique Orlando lives in a community in the Department of Copan Honduras. He is dedicated to agriculture (coffee) since 10 years ago. Age 43 years; he is married and has three children. It is clear that Enrique Orlando works hard to maintain his family and at night, after a hard day of work, the conditions in the house are not very good due to the lack of electricity. He hopes that with the solar energy system, his children will be able to continue studying and improve the living conditions.
Enrique Orlando is requesting a loan to purchase a complete solar electric system from SOLUZ Honduras, that will permit to have a better lighting, charge his cell phones, and saving in traditional energy expenditure.

loans.use: to purchase a solar home system that will allow him to reduce spending in kerosene, candles, and improve the home lighting.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Alice. She is 38 years old with two children. She is a small scale farmer who farms vegetables such as kale, cabbage and potatoes. She also does dairy farming. She has been able to manage and expand after Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training, where she acquired skills on savings, enterprise development and financial management.

Alice is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy manure and dairy animal feed to boost both her vegetable and dairy farming. This will improve her income, thus putting her in a position to provide for the family.

Alice is grateful to Kiva and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy manure and dairy animal feed to help boost her farm production, thus improving her income

loans.name: Emigdia Patricia

texts.en: Patricia is 56 years old, is married and has two sons, one of which still lives with her. In order to generate income to support her family, Patricia sells clothing, cosmetics, and decorative items for homes, according to the season. Coming from a family with low income, her ambition has led her to start this business to get ahead. Her goal is to expand the business into a formal setting in order to attain financial stability and leave a productive legacy. Patricia is asking for a loan of MXN 8,000 to buy more clothes and scarves in larger quantities to increase her profit margin and also to be able to finance the products to customers that can't pay upfront. Patricia has a knee problem, so she maintains an active lifestyle and walks in the park often. She is not afraid of any difficulties she may face along the way to achieve her goals and trusts people so that they also trust her. Patricia's plan for the near future is to learn to use the computer to take her business online. She will be very grateful if lenders support her business in her first loan with Konfío.

loans.use: to buy clothing and cosmetics in bulk to resell.

loans.name: Delma

texts.en:
Delma lives in a community in the Department of Copan Honduras. She is a farmer (coffee) since 8 years ago. Age 26 years; she is married and has two children. It is clear that Delma works hard to maintain her family and at night, after a hard day of work, the conditions in the house are not very good due to the lack of electricity. She hopes that with the solar energy system, her children will be able to continue studying and improve the living conditions.
Delma is requesting a loan to purchase a complete solar electric system from SOLUZ Honduras, that will permit to have a better lighting, charge her cell phones, and saving in traditional energy expenditure.

loans.use: to purchase a solar home system that will allow her to reduce spending in kerosene, candles, and improve the home lighting.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
The person in the photograph is Joseph. He is 40 years old, married, and blessed with four children.

Joseph farms maize, beans, and potatoes. He also does poultry and dairy farming. He is borrowing the Kiva loan to buy a water tank in which to store water for both animal and domestic use. This will ensure a sufficient supply of clean water and thus maintain a steady milk supply. Joseph will be assured of a consistent income to cater for his needs.

He is so happy and very grateful to Kiva for the great help.

loans.use: to buy a water tank to ensure water security that will help maintain a steady milk production and inceased income

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a solar home system that will allow him to reduce spending in kerosene, candles, and improve the home lighting.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.en: Passionate and persevering in business, Rosa María is 50 years old, a widow, and a mother of three sons. She began a degree in architecture and marine biology but did not finish due to her responsibilities as a moher. In 2010, she began a business to manufacture and sell cleaning products. She also manufactures hygiene products for veterinarians, used to clean dogs and cats without damaging their skin if they have a disease like scabies. Her dream is to own her own brand and to become a large company in order to have more recognition and a better quality of life. Rosa performs the entire process: from research, to creating the formulas, to packing and delivering the products to clients. She is requesting a loan of MXN 8,000 to buy the materials she needs, such as chemicals and packaging, to satisfy a large order she has to manufacture. Whenever possible, Rosa likes to learn new things and take online courses of cooking, baking, crafts and reading to improve her culture everyday. She wants her sons to be proud of her for everything she has achieved. As a result of this loan, she will be able to close a large deal and increase her income in order to grow her business and make successful repayments on her first loan with Konfío.

loans.use: to buy containers and chemicals for cleaning products.

loans.name: Samantha Elizabeth

texts.en: Samantha is 27 years old and single, but plans on marrying and starting a family in the near future when she has more financial stability. In order to achieve this goal, she opened a small drugstore 3 years. She also enjoys organizing special events and would like to run a catering business, which would go hand in hand with her additional job organizing events. Her dream is to expand the drugstore in order to have a more stable future and better quality of life for her family. She is requesting a loan of MXN 10,000 to buy over-the-counter pharmaceuticals and personal care products in bulk to stock her store at a better price. Her greatest satisfaction is that her customers' health improves as a result of her products. The increase in income as a result of this loan will allow Samantha to expand her store and to make successful repayments on her first loan with Konfío.

loans.use: to buy pharmaceuticals and personal care products for her small drugstore.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en: Edith is 57 years old, she lives with her partner as unmarried couple. She owns a small tailor shop in which she repairs clothes and sews the best-tailored suits in her town. She started the business 18 years ago and is very comfortable with the expertise she has accumulated along the years. As a complement to her current business, Edith also would like to open a boutique that functions together with the tailor shop in order to take advantage of the business opportunity and to satisfy her customers' needs in one place. She is requesting a loan of MXN 10,000 to repair a few expensive machines that will allow her to increase productivity. The greatest satisfaction for  Edith comes from customers that are very happy with the results. The additional income from having more efficient and well-working machines will allow Edith to expand her customer base, to begin to stock her boutique, and to make successful repayments on her first loan with Konfio.

loans.use: to repair her tailoring machines.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a water storage facility

loans.name: Pedrina

texts.es: Pedrina de 66 años de edad posee una venta de cereales y productos de primera necesidad su negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes, ella vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hija, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar los gastos de su hogar, Pedrina esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de aceites, granos básicos, sopas, margarinas, azúcar, etc. todo por mayor para poder seguir teniendo mejores ganancias y asi una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
66-year old Pedrina runs a stall selling cereals and other daily necessities. Her business is located in her house, and she has many customers. She lives in her own house with her husband and daughter. The money she earns pays for household expenses.

Pedrina is seeking a loan to buy oil, basic grains, soup, margarine, sugar etc, all in bulk. Then she will earn more money and be able to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: buy bulk oil, basic grains, soup, margarine, sugar etc.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es: Lucia de 57 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hija, ella posee desde hace varios años una tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia,  tiene muchos clientes por la variedad de productos que comercializa con las ventas que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas productos como: sopas, granos básicos, café, refrescos, golosinas, etc. y así poder tener mejores ganancias para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Lucia, 57 years old, lives in her own house with her husband and her daughter. For several years, she has had a store located in her house. She has a lot of customers due to the variety of products she sells. With what she sells, she is able to cover some of her household's expenses. She is asking for a loan in order to buy more products such as soups, staple grains, coffee, soft drinks, sweets, etc., and in this way be able to have a better income for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy soups, staple grains, coffee, soft drinks, sweets, etc.

loans.name: Dúo Herencia Del Rey Group

texts.es: Dúo Herencia del Rey, representado ahora por doña Adilia de 43 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos quienes estudian. Doña Adilia se dedica a la venta de calzado para dama, su local esta ubicado en el mercado municipal, en su casa tambien tiene una tienda de consumo diario desde hace mas de seis años. Su inversión ahora será en calzado para hombres, esta feliz porque tiene otro negocio y un punto céntrico,espera que le sigan apoyando con los creditos ya que por medio de ustedes a podido agrandar mas su negocio.
texts.en:
Dúo Herencia del Rey is now represented by Adilia, age 43.  She is married and has two children who go to school.  Adilia sells women’s shoes.  Her place is located at the municipal market.  She has also had a store at her house, selling daily consumption items, for over six years.

Her investment will now be in men’s shoes.  She is happy because she has another business and a central location.  She hopes that lenders continue helping her with the loans.  It is through you that she has been able to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy shoes to sell.

loans.name: Navil

texts.es:
Navil tiene 34 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive con su esposa e hijos en casa propia en una comunidad grande en la zona urbana de Zaña y goza con buenas referencias personales y laborales de parte de sus vecinos. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio. Dicho distrito está ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú.

Navil se dedica a la actividad de crianza de ganado vacuno y venta de leche, desde hace más de 7 años de antigüedad en el negocio, el cual se encuentra ubicado en su propio domicilio. Solicita préstamo para la compra de alimento de engorde balanceado para su ganado, de esta manera el espera hacer crecer más su negocio lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Navil is 34 years old. He is in a common-law marriage. He lives with his wife and children in his own house in a large community in the urban area of Zaña and enjoys good personal and work references from his neighbors. His community is basically dedicated to farming, ranching, and business. This district is located in the province of Chiclayo in the Lambayeque region on the north coast of Peru.

Navil raises cattle and sells milk. He has had this business for more than 7 years, and it is located in his own house. He is asking for the loan in order to buy compound feed for his cattle. In this way, he hopes to make his business grow, which in the short term will allow him to improve his income and increase his profits, thus improving the quality of life for himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy compound animal feed for his cattle

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen is involved in production, sale and distribution of semi-finished products. From his own store in Yerevan town, Armen sells semi-finished products. He also has agreement with some other stores to which he distributes the products. 

To be able to purchase a refrigerator and other materials, and to cover advertising costs, Armen has applied for this loan. It has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

Armen is a father of four children and is the only breadwinner of the family.

loans.use: to pay for a refrigerator and other materials, and to cover advertising costs

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit and her husband (in the photo) live with their only son in Tsaghkaber village, Lori region. 

They are farmers with many years of experience working in that sphere. Anahit's husband Andranik is a village herdsman and she has to take care of their farm alone. The farm currently includes livestock of two cows, calves, 120 sheep, and 25 hens. Anahit also cultivates different crops and vegetables and sells them in local markets. 

To be able to enlarge the number of cattle by ten sheep, Anahit has applied for this loan. She has already taken a loan from a local financial institution before, but unfortunately wasn't able to return it back. However, thanks to the hard work during recent times, Anahit was able to run her agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that she will be able to cover the monthly payments. 

So, she has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for ten sheep

loans.name: Christopher's Group

texts.en:
Christopher is a 59-year-old proud father of nine children. He is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing his group of 10 farmers in Webuye District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2014, Christopher has noticed that he has been able to consistently feed his family.

Christopher described his harvest as good last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to invest in a business.

With this loan, Christopher’s Group will be able to plant a total of 5.5 acres of land and purchase a total of 9 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Alice's Group

texts.en:
Alice is 47 years old and has 7 children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 11 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. 

Alice has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2010. This decision was largely a result of her desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods and, although she described her last harvest as very good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Alice also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Alice's Group will be able to receive a total of 10 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 6.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Zulma Karolina

texts.es:
Zulma de 29 años de edad, vive junto  a su madre y sus dos hijos, ella estudio hasta noveno grado y no continuo por la situación económica de su familia.

Zulma ya tiene mas de cinco años de dedicarse a la venta de tamales y comida ya que es de donde ella puede sacar sus ingresos para salir adelante junto a su hijos.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar mesas para atender a sus clientes cuando lleguen a comprar.


Ella sueña con tener su negocio mas amplio y tener mas clientela para aumentar ingresos y de esa manera ayudar a sus dos hijos con el estudio.
texts.en:
Zulma, 29, lives with her mother and her two children.  She has a 9th grade education; she was not able to complete her education because of her family's financial situation.

Zulma has now had more than 5 years of experience working selling tamales and food. This is how she obtains the income she needs to provide for her children.

Zulma needs this loan to buy tables where she can serve her customers when they come to her business.

Zulma dreams of having a bigger business and having more customers so that she could increase her income and thereby help her two children with their education.

loans.use: to buy tables for her business

loans.name: Maryannah's Group

texts.en:
Maryannah is 54 years old and has eight children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 10 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. 

Maryannah has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2009. This decision was largely a result of her desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods and, although she described her last harvest as very good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. 

Maryannah also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Maryannah's Group will be able to receive a total of 12 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 6 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Nazirjon

texts.ru:
Назирчон трудолюбивый  мужчина в возрасте 42 лет. Женат и имеет четырех детей. Он занимается куплей продажей пчелиного меда. Другой доход от выращивания сельхозкультур. Назирчон хороший и добрый человек. 
Назирчон обратился в Арванд за кредитом. Он хочет получить кредит для оплаты договора обучение своего племянника. Его племянник учится в Худжандском государственном Университете.  Назирчон заранее благодарит за поддержку.
texts.en:
Nazirjon is a hardworking man who is 42 years old.  He's married and has four children.  He buys and sells bee honey for a living.  His other source of income comes from growing crops.  Nazirjon is a good and kind man.

Nazirjon has requested a loan from Arvand.  He wants to take out a loan to pay for his nephew's tuition.  His nephew is studying at Khujand State University.  Nazirjon thanks you in advance for your support.

loans.use: pay for his nephew's education

loans.name: Nancy's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Nancy, who, as a group leader, is representing her group formed by 12 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. She is married and is a mother to four children, known in her community as a very hardworking individual.

Initially, Nancy joined One Acre Fund in 2010 because she wanted to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds. Since she joined the program she says that her life has improved, especially because she has been able to consistently feed her family. With the profits from the coming harvesting season, Nancy plans to buy a goat.

Between the 12 farmers in Nancy's Group, a total of seven acres of land will be planted using the maize seeds and fertilizer received with the loan. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of seven solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Lucy's Group

texts.en:
Lucy, featured in the above picture, is representing her farming group formed by 12 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. She is 50 years old and a married mother of five children, often described as a very resourceful person. 

Although Lucy has been a farmer for 20 years, she is new to One Acre Fund and decided to join this year because she really wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Even though she is new to the program, Lucy wanted to represent her group because she wanted to be more active in her community. With the profits earned from this season’s harvest, Lucy hopes to be able to buy a cow.

With this loan, the group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of seven acres of land. They will also receive a total of seven solar lights, as, even though Lucy decided not to, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light as part of their loan package.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Patrick's Group

texts.en:
Patrick is 51 years old and has five children. He is a group leader and is representing his group of 10 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. 

Patrick has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2010. This decision was largely a result of his desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods and, although he described his last harvest as very good, he believes he could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Patrick also decided to purchase a solar light as part of his loan, which he is very excited about, as it will allow him to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Patrick's Group will be able to receive a total of nine solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 6.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase construction materials to resell them.

loans.name: Antehwe Group

texts.en:
This "Antehwe" group is on its ninth loan cycle and consists of women who are very active in trade in diverse ways. They all come from the same neighborhood and get along well. Their main activity is small business: cosmetics, banku and stew, gari (cassava couscous), kid's wear, diapers, napkins, smoked fish, fruit and other foodstuffs. 

Felicia is the representative of this group. She is 37 years old, single, and the mother of one child. She operates a food stall where she sells banku (cooked corn and cassava dough) and stew. She also sells cosmetics. She will use this loan to buy more corn and cassava dough, and also ingredients to prepare banku and stew to sell to customers. She has good experience in this business from engaging in it for over 19 years. After sales and deducting transport costs, the net profit will help her increase her savings, reinvestment, and take care of her family. 

They will hold each other responsible for the repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To buy more corn and cassava dough, as well as ingredients to prepare banku and stew to sell to customers.

loans.name: Luis

texts.en:
Luis lives in a community in the Department of Atlántida Honduras. He is dedicated to the business of a local store. Age 19 years; he is Unmarried. It is clear that Luis works hard to maintain his family and at night, after a hard day of work, the conditions in the house are not very good due to the lack of electricity. He hopes that with the solar energy system, improve the living conditions.
Luis is requesting a loan to purchase a complete solar electric system from SOLUZ Honduras, that will permit to have a better lighting, charge his cell phones, and saving in traditional energy expenditure.

loans.use: to purchase a solar home system that will allow him to reduce spending in kerosene, candles, and improve the home lighting.

loans.name: Marisol

texts.en: Marisol is 39 years old, is married, and has 4 children. For five years, she has run a business of candies and snacks from her home to generate income and provide for her family. At home, she packs the candies to resell in stores and plans on starting a business making desserts soon. Marisol wants to grow the business and one day open a factory in which she will produce her own products. She is a very enthusiastic  and ambitious woman, and her dream is to improve the quality of life for her family and to gain financial stability. In her spare time she likes to make scented candles and sells them to friends and family. She is requesting a loan of MXN 10,000 to buy more shelves and products such as chocolates, gummies, truffles and snacks. This is Marisol’s first loan with Konfío and is confident in her financial planning in order to make successful repayments.

loans.use: to buy chocolates, gummies, truffles, and snacks in bulk to resell.

loans.name: Adelmo

texts.en:
Adelmo lives in a community in the Department of Atlántida Honduras. He is dedicated to agriculture (Coffee). Age 53 years; he is married and has six children. It is clear that Adelmo works hard to maintain his family and at night, after a hard day of work, the conditions in the house are not very good due to the lack of electricity. He hopes that with the solar energy system, improve the living conditions.
Adelmo is requesting a loan to purchase a complete solar electric system from SOLUZ Honduras, that will permit to have a better lighting, charge his cell phones, and saving in traditional energy expenditure.

loans.use: to purchase a solar home system that will allow him to reduce spending in kerosene, candles, and improve the home lighting.

loans.name: Mwihangiri Self Help Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Rosemary. She is a member of Mwingari Self Help Group. The group members came together in order to grow socially and economically through agriculture.

Rosemary is 43 years old and married, with three children who all go to school. She has been a member of the group for four years now.

With her loan, Beatrice envisions acquiring hybrid seeds and fertilizers for growing ½ acre of maize and ¼ acre each of sorghum and millet. She hopes this will result in her having a good harvest that will ensure food security for her household. She will also sell the surplus and spend the money on paying school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve on crop yield, increasing income for her family

loans.name: Maria Ernestina

texts.en:
Maria Ernestina lives in a community in the Department of Atlántida Honduras. She is dedicated to Agriculture and breeding of pigs. Age 38 years; she is married and has seven children. It is clear that Maria Ernestina works hard to maintain her family and at night, after a hard day of work, the conditions in the house are not very good due to the lack of electricity. She hopes that with the solar energy system, her children will be able to continue studying and improve the living conditions.
Maria Ernestina is requesting a loan to purchase a complete solar electric system from SOLUZ Honduras, that will permit to have a better lighting, charge her cell phones, and saving in traditional energy expenditure.

loans.use: to purchase a solar home system that will allow her to reduce spending in kerosene, candles, and improve the home lighting.

loans.name: Marisol

texts.en: A very enthusiastic woman, Marisol is 32 years old, is married, and became a mother for the second time just five months ago. She strives to improve the living conditions of her family and to provide for them along with her husband. For that reason, she began a business five years ago selling children’s clothing she imports from the U.S. and she would like to start selling adult clothing. She is asking for a loan of MXN 12,000 to buy clothes like jackets, t-shirts, shirts, pants and dresses in bulk in order increase her profit margin and be able to rent a larger space and expand her store. Her biggest dream is to see her children develop personally and professionally to escape the financial limitations she and her husband have had. Marisol is investing in her business to generate more income for her family in order to provide a better education and a better quality of life as well as making successful repayments on her second of many loans with Konfío.

loans.use: to buy clothes in bulk to resell.

loans.name: Angel

texts.en:
Angel lives in a community in the Department of Atlántida Honduras. He is dedicated to agriculture and Livestock (milkman). Age 23 years; he is married. It is clear that Angel works hard to maintain his family and at night, after a hard day of work, the conditions in the house are not very good due to the lack of electricity. He hopes that with the solar energy system, improve the living conditions.
Angel is requesting a loan to purchase a complete solar electric system from SOLUZ Honduras, that will permit to have a better lighting, charge his cell phones, and saving in traditional energy expenditure.

loans.use: to purchase a solar home system that will allow him to reduce spending in kerosene, candles, and improve the home lighting.

loans.name: Noemi Victoria

texts.es:
Noemi es una mujer de 39 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene un hijo varón de 2 meses de edad, y su negocio es la producción y venta de chicharrones de soya.
Ella es buena madre, optimista, comprometida con su trabajo, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla de forma ambulante en la zona de ‘chasquipampa’ donde hasta hace no mucho estaba el área rural, el sitio para hacer excursiones. Los vecinos se han ido asentando a medida que la urbe ha ido extendiendo sus tentáculos, de clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 4-18 grados centígrados.
Noemi es de tez morena, cabello negro largo lo usa trenzado, ojos negros, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica al mismo negocio y con su bebé que aún es muy pequeño, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la elaboración y venta de chicharrones de soya que es una opción más sana y nutritiva que el chicharrón de harina tradicional, para su preparación se mezclan harina de trigo y harina de soya, esta combinación proporciona un alimento más fortificado y con menos grasa. Una vez elaborado el producto lo empaqueta y se dedica a la venta de forma ambulante en diferentes tiendas de barrio y comercios, actividad que realiza todos los días de la semana, su negocio cuenta con clientes fijos y le realizan pedidos. “inicie como vendedora ambulante, aunque mi trabajo continua siendo ambulante ya cuento con clientes fijos y pedidos semanales…” comenta. Su sueño es tener un ambiente grande y cómodo para trabajar de mejor manera, ella desea realizar la compra de variedad de harinas por quintal para contar con material de trabajo constante. Esta es 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que viene desarrollando esta actividad de forma continua.
Es por esos motivos que Noemi solicita un préstamo para la compra de variedad de harinas para la fabricación de chicharrones de soya.
texts.en:
Noemi is a 39 year old woman, lives with her partner, has one 2 month old son, and her business is the production and sale of soy chicharrones. She is a good mother, optimistic, committed to her work, responsible, and hardworking. Her business is developed by making rounds in the area of 'Chasquipampa', which until very recently was a rural area. The neighbors have settled as the city has spread it's tentacles, the climate is cold and dry with a temperature that varies during the day from 4-18 degrees Celsius.

Noemi has dark complexion, long black braided hair, dark eyes, short stature, and thin physique. Her mother tongue is Aymará that she speaks with her family and she also speaks Spanish for general culture and to use in her business. Her life is shared with her partner who also works in the same business and also with her baby who is still very small. They live in their own home built of bricks with a corrugated iron roof that has potable water, electricity, and sewage.

Her business is the development and sale of soy chicharrones, which is a healthier and more nutritious option than traditional. For her preparation, she mixes wheat flour and soy flour. This combination provide a more fortified and less fat food. Once the product is made and packaged, she sells on rounds in various local shops and businesses, an activity she does every day of the week. Her business has regular customers and they place orders. "I started as a street vender, but with my work being itinerant I already have regular customers and weekly orders...", she says.

Her dream is to have a large and comfortable environment to work better. She wants to make the purchase of a variety of flours in large quantities to have constant work materials. This is her first loan with the institution in the 2 years the she has been continuously developing this activity. It is for these reasons that Noemi is asking for a loan to buy a variety of flours to make soy chicharrones.

loans.use: to buy a variety of flours to make soy chicharrones.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy firewood to sell.

loans.name: Patron Santiago-Lamay Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “PATRON SANTIAGO-LAMAY”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Lamay, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maria Matilde ella es conviviente y tiene 31 años y tiene 1 hijo; La socia trabaja en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azucar, leche y galletas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azucar, leche y galletas.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de agricultura, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the Communal Bank named “Patron Santiago-Lamay”. This bank is located in the District of Lamay in Calca Province, Department of Cusco.

Sra. Maria Matilde is 31 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has one child. She works at her grocery business where she sells basic necessities such as rice, sugar, milk, and cookies. Maria Matilde works from 8:00 A.M. to 7:00 P.M. She has been in this business for eight years and is doing very well. Her dream is to expand her grocery store. Maria Matilde is requesting a loan in order to buy rice, sugar, milk, and cookies.

The other members engage in businesses such as selling animals, agriculture, managing a grocery store, and operating a restaurant.

Maria Matilde is grateful to those who have helped her to fulfill her dream in this manner, so she promises to complete her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk, and cookies.

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es: Maria tiene 52 años de edad y vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida, ella posee desde hace 15 años una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios y la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Maria is 52 years old and lives in her own house with her life companion. For the last 15 years she has had a small store located at her house. She has a lot of clients due to her good prices and friendliness when it comes to sell. With what she makes from her sales she manages to pay some of the household expenses. She is requesting a loan to be able to buy more soup, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, sweets, pastries, etc. to be able to have more income for a better quality of living.

loans.use: to buy more soup, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, sweets, pastries, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a water storage facility

loans.name: Kadzo

texts.en: Kadzo is a married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from 18 to 25 years old. She describes herself to be sincere. She operates a dairy farm. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the dry season, which affects milk production. She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to pay school fees for her children. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of vegetables

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a Kiva borrower. She has 6 children. She describes herself as good. 

She operates a farm where she keeps livestock and grows maize to sell. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge as climate changes. 

She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of maize. She hopes that, in the future, she will have improved standards of living. 

This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy timber and other carpentry materials.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is a married woman. She has five children with ages ranging from 5 to 22 years old. She operates a farm where she grows crops. She describes her family challenge to be the shortage of water storage facilities. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy a water storage facility. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her living standards. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a water storage facility

loans.name: Luz Dary

texts.es:
Luz Dary es una campesina muy trabajadora, criada con las buenas costumbres de la sociedad rural, honesta y agradecida, ella es madre de 3 hijos los cuales crio y levanto junto con la ayuda de su esposo, ella a pesar de vivir en el campo no quiere ese futuro para sus hijos, los quiere ver convertidos en unos universitarios, que elijan una carrera y cambie su futuro, es mejor que tengan un libro en la mano que no una herramienta para trabajar la tierra por tal razón se esfuerza mucho pro impulsar su negocio y hacerlo sobresaliente.
Luz Dary es una persona noble ella busca en un futuro poder empelar personas del sector que tanto necesitan un trabajo, incrementar ganancias y clientes.
Luz Dary solicita un préstamo y justifica el monto, comprara 2 cerdas de cría $1’600.000, 10 lechones 1’200.00, concentrado que es su alimento por 2’200.000, para un total de 5 millones el monto solicitado.
texts.en:
Luz Dary is a very hard-working farmer.  She was raised with the good morals of rural society, honesty and gratefulness.  She has three children whom she took care of and raised with her husband’s help.  In spite of living in the country, she does not want this future for her children.  She wants to see them become university students, choose a career, and change their future.  It is better for them to have a book in hand than a tool to work the land.  It is for this reason that she puts forth great effort to drive her business and make it successful.

Luz Dary is a kind person.  She is looking to, in the future, be able to employ people in her area that really need work and to increase her earnings and her customers.

Luz Dary is requesting a loan to buy two breeding sows for 1,600,000 COP, ten sucking pigs for 1,200,000 COP, and 2, 200,000 COP for balanced feed.  The total is five million, the requested amount.

loans.use: to buy two breeding sows for 1,600,000 COP, ten sucking pigs for 1,200,000 COP, and 2, 200,000 for balanced feed.

loans.name: Elba Maria

texts.es:
Elba es una mujer casera, domestica, entregada al trabaja y a su familia, su mayor orgullo es su hija de 20 años de edad quien se encuentra en la universidad capacitándose para tener un mejor futuro.
Ella genera los recursos gracias a su negocio de cría y levante de cerdos un negocio que aprendió y ejerce desde el año 2008.
Elba solicita un préstamo y se los pide muy encarecidamente para comprar lechones, la razón es que necesita generar más recursos para seguir apoyando la educación de su hija.
texts.en:
Elba is a stay-at-home housewife, devoted to her work and her family. Her greatest pride is her 20 year old daughter who is attending university training for a better future.

She generates resources thanks to her business of raising pigs, a business she learned and has done since 2008. Elba is requesting a loan in the most earnest fashion to buy piglets. The reason is that she needs to generate more resources to continue to support her daughter's education.

loans.use: buy 12 piglets to stock her pens.

loans.name: Elsa Liliana

texts.es: A sus 28 años de edad Liliana es madre soltera, su hijo tiene 3 años, Liliana se dedica a la crianza de  chanchos y son 10 años que se dedica a trabajar al jornal de trabajos de agricultura, Liliana necesita el crédito para comprar chanchos ya que los cría en  chancheras que tiene en la casa de su madre, la aspiración de Liliana es de mejorar su negocio y por medio de sus ingresos lograra una mejor calidad de vida de su hijo.
texts.en:
Liliana is a single mother who is 28 years of age. Her son is three years old. Liliana raises pigs and has been dedicated to agricultural work for 10 years.

Liliana needs a loan in order to buy pigs that she will raise in the pens that she has set up at her mother’s house. Her aspiration is to improve her business so that she can use the earnings to achieve a better quality of life for her son.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Ann's Group

texts.en:
Ann is 22 years old and is often described as a very hardworking individual. She has two children and is married. As a group leader, Ann is representing her group of 14 farmers in Webuye District in Kenya, and is very excited to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

The decision to join One Acre Fund was largely a result of Ann's desire to earn enough to feed her family. Apart from receiving farming inputs, she is also purchasing a solar light as part of her loan, which is very exciting to her, as she will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits that she gains from this year’s harvest, she plans to invest in a business.

Ann and her group will receive a total of 12 solar lights as well as input loans of maize and fertilizer to plant a total of 7.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Evans's Group

texts.en:
Evans's Group is formed by 10 farmers in Webuye District and is being represented by Evans, who is the group leader pictured above. He is 39 years old, married and has two children. Evans has been a farmer for more than 20 years and is often referred to as a very hardworking individual.

Evans isn’t new to One Acre Fund. He actually joined the program in 2014 and has since noticed his life has changed; especially in the sense that he has learnt a lot from farming trainings ever since. This year, Evans will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of his loan, but will also purchase two solar lights. He is very excited about this addition since now he will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Using this loan, Evans's Group will purchase a total of 11 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of six acres.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve his maize  harvest

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more stock for her clothing business and to add new items to the menu of her little restaurant

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To renew her chicken pens

loans.name: John's Group

texts.en:
John is 31 years old and is often described as a very friendly person. He has four children and is married. As a group leader, John is representing his group of 13 farmers in Webuye District in Kenya, and is very excited to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

The decision to join One Acre Fund was largely a result of John's desire to earn enough to feed his family. Apart from receiving farming inputs, he is also purchasing a solar light as part of his loan, which is very exciting to him as he will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits that he gains from this year’s harvest, he plans to invest in a business.

John and his group will receive a total of 12 solar lights as well as input loans of maize and fertilizer to plant a total of five acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: La Alegria Group

texts.es:
El comité se denomina La alegría es un grupo nuevo con 18 integrantes, pero en este ciclo solo 16 piden este préstamo, todas con la esperanza de mejorar sus vidas y sus ingresos. 
La mayoría de las integrantes tiene actividades de producción ya que son mujeres de zonas rurales por lo tanto tienen las condiciones para criar animales  y trabajar en la agricultura.
Una de las integrantes que se caracteriza por ser  muy emprendedora es la Sra. Domitila, quien se dedica a la Huerta, y  vende sus cultivos por la zona. Es una persona muy trabajadora que se esfuerza día a día para poder mejorar su vida y la de su familia.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder comprar semillas y abonos para su huerta, de manera a poder seguir con su siembra. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir con su pequeño emprendimiento.
texts.en:
The committee named “La Alegría” (The Joy) is a new group with 18 members, but only 16 of them are requesting a loan. All of them are hopeful of improving their lives and their incomes.

The majority of the members have productive business activities. These women live in rural areas that have suitable conditions for raising animals and working in agriculture.

One of the members who is known for her entrepreneurship is Sra. Domitila. She has a vegetable garden and sells her crops in the area. Domitila is a hardworking individual who strives each day to improve her life and that of her family.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy seeds and compost for her vegetable garden. This will allow her to continue planting. She appreciates the opportunity she has received so that she can continue with her small enterprise.

loans.use: to buy seeds and compost for her vegetable garden.

loans.name: Bashar

texts.en:
Bashar is a 19-year-old single man. He has been working since 2010 in a money transfer company to make sure he can afford to pay for college. He was very young when he started working, and he is working hard to develop himself. He is an energetic man, full of future dreams which he is working hard to make come true. 

Bashar is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay for his college tuition fees to make sure he can benefit from a brighter future. He hopes that in the future he can establish his own business and develop his living.

loans.use: To pay for his college tuition fees

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
Alaa is a 41-year-old married man from Gaza city. He is a father of two sons and one daughter. Alaa works as an employee in the public sector. He gets a very low income. Alaa's home has been destroyed in the last violence in Gaza. He moved with his family to live in another rental apartment for now. Alaa took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to rebuild his home and move back with his family to live in it. 

Alaa appears in the photo.

loans.use: to rebuild his home and move back with his family to live in it.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is a married man. He has five children. He describes himself to be focused. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for eight years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are individuals. He will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy another motorcycle. He hopes that in the future, he will be successful. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle

loans.name: Saed

texts.en:
Saed is a 34-year-old married man from Rafah city. He is a father of one daughter. Saed works as an employee in the public sector. He earns a very low income. Saed's home has been destroyed in the last violence in Gaza. He moved with his family to live in another rental apartment.

Saed took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to rebuild his home and move back with his family to live in it. Saed appears in the photo

loans.use: to rebuild his home that was destroyed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy balanced feed to fatten her animals and to make repairs and provide maintenance to the place where she keeps the pigs.

loans.name: Pedro Alexander

texts.es: Pedro de 50 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, su hija y su nieto, el se dedica a la compra y venta de productos reciclables desde hace varios años, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Pedro está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas productos reciclables como: plástico, cobre, hierro, papel, etc. y así poder seguir con su trabajo para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Pedro is 50 years old, lives in his own house with his wife, daughter, and grandson. He has made a living buying and selling recyclable products for several years. His business is located in his home, and with the income he obtains in sales he is able to cover some of the household expenses.

Pedro is asking for a loan to buy more recyclable products such as plastic, copper, iron, paper, etc. so he can continue with his work and increase income.

loans.use: to buy more recyclable products such as plastic, copper, iron, paper, etc.

loans.name: Hani

texts.en:
Hani, a 41-year-old married man from Gaza city, is a father of three sons and  one daughter. He has a barn for raising sheep, and he earns a good income but it is not stable. Hani's home was destroyed in the last violence on Gaza, so he and his family currently live in a rental apartment.

Hani requested a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN to help him to rebuild his home and move back with his family to live in it. 

Hani appears in the photo

loans.use: to rebuild his home and move back with his family to live in it

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 1 year to 7 years. She describes herself to be good.

She operates a retail business where she sells vegetables. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a stable place, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be storage.

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of vegetables.

Her business goal is to be the main supplier of vegetables and cereals within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will own a major grocery. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of vegetables.

loans.name: Everlyne's Group

texts.en:
Everlyne is 49 years old and has seven children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by thirteen farmers in Webuye District, Kenya.

Everlyne has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2010. This decision was largely a result of her desire to earn enough to feed her family and, although she described her last harvest as good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund.

Everlyne also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Everlyne's Group will be able to receive a total of nine solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 6.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Paula Andrea

texts.es:
Paula es una mujer casada, de 34 años edad que sueña junto con su esposo formar una familia con dos hijos proyectos a futuro en el cual trabaja diariamente aportando ingresos al hogar gracias a una tienda del peluquero que tiene, donde oferta básicamente productos recomendados de peluquería, como lo son shampos, productos capilares, tinturas, planchas para el cabello, secadores, cremas, todo lo relacionado con un salón de belleza.
Ella es muy cuidadosa y antes de iniciar con dicho negocio se capacito para asegurar de alguna  otra manera el éxito y la buena administración.
Paula es madre de un hijo, quiere brindarle educación, techo, comida, tener sostenibilidad de su negocio, ser más competitiva en el mercado, aumentar sus clientes, buscando en la inversión un éxito, quiere comprar mercancía como lo es tintas y shampos, que son los productos de mayor rotación en su negocio, y tratar de introducir algunos equipos de salón de belleza para darle un nuevo aire a su negocio.
texts.en:
Paula is a married woman who is 34 years of age. She and her husband dreamed of starting a family and having two children. To prepare for the future, Paula works each day at her beauty products store in order to contribute to the household income. She offers products that are recommended by salons such as shampoos, hair products, dyes, curling irons, hair dryers, crèmes, and everything else that is found at a beauty salon.

Paula is very cautious, so prior to starting this business, she received training so that she could guarantee some level of success and practice good management.

Paula is the mother of one child, so she has to provide for expenses such as education, housing, food, and the sustainability of her business. She also wants to become more competitive in the marketplace, increase her clientele, and look for a successful investment. Paula wants to buy merchandise, such as dyes and shampoos, which are products that have higher turnover in her business. She will also try to introduce some beauty salon equipment, which will inject new life into her business.

loans.use: to buy dyes, shampoos, and general hair products.

loans.name: Layla

texts.en:
Layla, is a 65-year-old widowed mother of five children. In 2006 she opened her convenience store business to make her living and cover her expenses. She is a woman with a very good reputation in her area, and she is a borrower in good standing with Kiva partner Al Majmoua.

Layla is requesting her sixth loan. She will use her loan funds to increase her business merchandise with special-offer spring and summer products, and to diversify her products in order to satisfy the requirements of her customers, thus increasing her income.

She will also use part of the loan for visiting Holy religious places, which she is looking forward to do at this age.

Her previous loans helped her a lot in expanding her inventory, allowing her to add several new products. She is investing much hope in this current loan, and is hopeful that it will fulfill her customers' needs.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with special-offer spring and summer products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase diverse products

loans.name: Elijah

texts.en:
Elijah is a married man. He has three children. He describes himself to be ambitious. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his bicycle. He has been involved in this business for ten years. His business is located in a good area, and his primary customers are regular.

He will use the KES 15,000 loan to buy stock of vegetables to enable him to open a grocery store for his wife.

His business goal is to own a motorcycle within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have a financially stable family. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy stock of vegetables to open a grocery store for his wife.

loans.name: Daniel's Group

texts.en:
Daniel's Group was formed by nine farmers in Webuye District and is being represented by Daniel, who is the group leader pictured above. He is 34 years old, is married and has three children. Daniel has been a farmer for fourteen years and is often referred to as a very hardworking individual.

Daniel isn’t new to One Acre Fund. He actually joined the program in 2012 and has since noticed his life has changed, especially in the sense that he has learnt a lot from farming trainings ever since.

This year, Daniel will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of his loan, but will also purchase a solar light. He is very excited about this addition, since now he will be able to have light during the night and have somewhere to charge his phone.

Using this loan, Daniel's Group will purchase a total of nine solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 3.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Marvin Esau

texts.es:
Marvin es un joven de 19 años, estudio hasta 6° grado, esta soltero y en la casa solo vive con sus padres y una hermana . 

Marvin trabaja fuera de su casa en el oficio de estructuras metálicas, se desplaza a diferentes lugares donde lo requieran, y en su tiempo libre trabaja la agricultura en una parcela  cerca de su casa, cultivando granos básicos para el consumo del hogar. 

El crédito lo necesita para comprar material y poder  terminar de construir la casa  de adobe, ya que en la que vive es de baharaque y esta en malas condiciones.

El sueño de el joven Marvin es poder mejorar su vivienda y así ofrecer a sus padres mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Marvin is a young man of nineteen years.  He studied through the sixth grade.  He is single and lives in a house with his parents and a sister.  

Marvin works outside the home in the trade of metal structures.  He is sent to different sites where they need him.  In his free time he works in agriculture in a plot near the house.  He grows basic grains for home consumption.  

He needs the loan in order to purchase material and be able to finish building the adobe house.  The house they live in is made of sticks and is in poor condition.  

Marvin's dream is to be able to improve their home and in that way offer his parents better living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase materials and be able to finish construction on the adobe house.

loans.name: Faraja Group

texts.fr: Madame Furaha est une femme courageuse, ambitieuse et presidente du groupe de credit Faraja.  Agée de 42 ans, elle est mariée à vendeur et mère de 12 enfants tous scolarisés. Elle s’occupe de la vente des sacs au dos depuis 2008 suite au premier fonds reçu de Hekima. Elle vient de demander un crédit qui lui permettra d’acquérir 8 sacs au dos. Dans l’avenir, elle compte devenir grossiste. A cet effet, lle remercie HEKIMA pour son soutien.
texts.en: Mrs Furaha is a courageous, ambitious woman who is president of the lending group Faraja. At 42 years old she is married to a vendor and the mother of 12 children, all of whom attend school. She has been involved in the sale of backpacks since 2008, thanks to the first financing received from Hekima. She recently asked for a loan that would allow her to purchase 8 backpacks. In the future, she hopes to become a wholesaler. She is thanksful to Hekima for its support.

loans.use: purchase 8 backpacks

loans.name: Dúo Unión De Fe Group

texts.es: Dúo Unión de Fe Paola de 33 años de edad esta casada tiene 2 hijos, se dedica a ser estilista en un salon cerca de su domicilio, ella necesita un credito para invertir en su negocio ya que se acerca el dia del cariño y quiere comprar productos nuevos para tener mas demanda en las ventas como cosmeticos, inicio en su negocio hace 10 años actualmente tambien se dedica a la venta de comida,gracias a Dios poco a poco ha ido creciendo solicita su ayuda con el credito solicitado desde ya les agrade por su atencion.
texts.en: A member of Dúo Unión de Fe, Paola is 33 years old, is married and has two children.  She works as a stylist in a salon near her home.  She needs a loan to invest in her business because Valentine's Day is close and she wants to purchase new products in order to create more demand in cosmetic sales.  She began her business ten years ago.  Presently she also works in the sale of food.  Thanks to God, little by little her business has grown.  She is asking for this assistance with the loan and thanks you for your attention.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics for a beauty salon.

loans.name: Jairo Jose

texts.es:
Jorge es un tierno, entregado y dedicado hombre de 56 años de edad, que quizás en el transcurso de su vida tubo muchos tropiezos pero siempre con buena disposición y una gran sonrisa sacaba sus problemas adelante.
A Este hombre le gusta superarse no dejarse vencer por la edad, se encuentra estudiando ya que cree que nunca es tarde y sueña con un mejor futuro.
De momento tiene un negocio de cría y levante de cerdos y pollos, pero no se conformara con este negocio, trabajara y estudiara pues quiere tener una mejor empresa, ser exitoso y vivir muy feliz con su pareja.
Con la ayuda de un préstamo quiere invertir en la compra de una cerda de cría, pollos, y alimento para los animales.
texts.en:
Jorge is a kind, committed and dedicated man of 56 years.  During his life he has had many setbacks but he always had a good disposition and a big smile to overcome his problems.  

This man likes to improve himself, never being defeated by age.  He finds himself studying because he believes it is never too late and he dreams of a better future.

At the moment he has a business of raising pigs and chickens, but he won't settle for this business.  He will work and he will study because he wants to have a better business, be successful and live happily with his partner.  

With the help of a loan he will invest in the purchase of a young pig, chickens and food for the animals.

loans.use: a marvelous man who, at the age of 56, wants to study and have a great successful company.  He wants to purchase pigs, chicks and food.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy detergents and other dry cleaning items

loans.name: Katuku

texts.en:
Katuku is a divorced woman. She has six children with ages ranging from 12 years to 24 years. She describes herself to be social. She operates a retail business where she sells fruits and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her primary customers are loyal. 

She will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables. She hopes that in the future, she will open a supermarket. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Custodio Ramon

texts.es:
El señor Custodio es un hombre tranquilo, sereno y pasivo, tiene una familia conformada por tres hijos y su pareja, con la cual vive y los alimenta gracias a su negocio de cría y levante de cerdos y pollos, en unas cocheras que tiene ubicadas en la comodidad de su casa, su actividad inicia desde que sale el sol, alimento y limpie las cocheras de sus animales, les tiene un buen resguardo para protegerlos de este loco clima.
Custodio aprendió la actividad gracias a su madre y padre quienes ejercieron esta actividad hasta que su salud se los permitió.
Como Empresario independiente Custodio quiere lo mejor para su negocio, producir mas dinero, tener mejores condiciones de vida, carro, vivienda, lujos, que su familia no pase necesidades.  
Custodio solicita un préstamo para la compra de cerdos, pollos y alimento, la razón es que necesita llenar sus cocheras pues tuvo buenas ventas en diciembre, con este crédito podrá abastecer su negocio e ir pagando en cómodas cuotas sin descuidar el mantenimiento de su hogar y familia.
texts.en:
Senor Custodio is a tranquil, serene and peaceful man.  He has a family made up of three children and his partner with whom he lives.  He is able to support them thanks to his business of breeding and raising pigs and chickens in some animal sheds that he has located by his house.  His work starts when the sun comes up; he feeds the animals and cleans the animal sheds.  He gives them good shelter to protect them from this crazy climate.

Custodio learned this occupation thanks to his mother and father who did this for as long as their health permitted.

As an independent businessman, Custodio wants the best for his business, to produce more money, to have better living conditions, car, house, comfort, that his family is not lacking in necessities.

Custodio is asking for a loan to buy pigs, chickens and food.  The reason is that he needs to fill his animal sheds since he had good sales in December.  With this loan he will be able to supply his business and to pay in comfortable payments without neglecting the maintenance of his home and family.

loans.use: to buy pigs, chickens and food to give a significant boost to his business.

loans.name: Doris's Group

texts.en:
Doris, pictured above, has six children and is always described as a very trustworthy person, which is why she was selected to become the leader of her group. Doris is representing her group of nine farmers in Webuye District and is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

Doris has been a farmer for more than 20 years, and in order to earn enough to feed her family, she decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season. Her loan will not only include farming inputs but also two solar lights, which she is very happy to be getting as that means she will now reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this coming season, Doris is planning to send her children to school.

A total of 3.75 acres will be planted by Doris's Group, and between them they will receive a total of 11 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as two solar lights.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Meet Agnes. She is a smallholder farmer with extremely humble beginnings. She is based in Cherangany village in the North Rift region of Kenya. Her upbringing was difficult. She never managed to finish her primary education, but she is very determined to give the best life to her children. 

Fifteen years ago, Agnes started farming on her husband's 1-acre farm. She did it mostly for subsistence until recently. She keeps a dairy cow that gives her 10 liters of milk every day for sale. She also grows vegetables that she uses to prepare food and to also sell. 

Agnes is seeking a loan to purchase a dairy cow. The cow will produce additional milk for sale. This investment will not only double the income that Agnes is making from milk, but will also mitigate risks associated with having just one productive cow. The additional income will enable her to comfortably handle food and education costs, which happen to be her highest expenses. Consider lending to Agnes to help her improve her economic activity.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Samwel is a married man. He has three children. He describes himself to be strong. He operates a transport business where he transport customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a conducive area, and his primary customers are regular. 

He will use the 30,000 KES loan to buy motorcycle spare parts. His business goal is to own two more motorcycles within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be rich. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle spare parts

loans.name: Chengo

texts.en:
Chengo is a married man. He has five children with ages ranging from 12 years to 33 years. He describes himself to be competent and persistent. He operates a retail business where he sells flour, salt, sugar, bread and other items. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a trading center and his primary customers are locals. 

He will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, flour, salt, washing soap and other items. He hopes that in the future, he will have a wholesale business and create job opportunities. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. The previous  loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, flour, salt, washing soap and other items.

loans.name: Patrick's Group

texts.en:
Patrick, featured in the picture above, is representing his group of seven farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. He is best known in his community for being a very hardworking individual and is very excited to be joining One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

Patrick’s decision to join the program was largely due to the fact that he wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. In addition, he was keen on purchasing a solar light that he could afford, as he says that by doing so, he would be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money, which he is very excited about. With the profits he earns from the coming harvesting season, Patrick plans to send his children to school.

Between the seven farmers in Patrick’s Group, a total of 4.75 acres of land will be planted using the farming inputs received with this loan. The group will also receive a total of eight solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tea and clear land for farming.

loans.name: Edwin's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Edwin, often described as an extremely friendly person. He is 25 years old and, as a group leader, he is representing his group of 12 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya.

Edwin is returning this season to work with One Acre Fund again as this means that he is able to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, which is why he decided to join in the first place. Edwin says that he is happy to have made that decision because, since he first joined in 2014, he has been able to save more money, which has improved his day-to-day life significantly. Edwin will use the profits from this season to invest in a business.

The group will use this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer to plant a total of 6.5 acres. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 9 solar lights.

loans.use: to gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation

loans.name: Janet's Group

texts.en:
Janet's Group is formed by 11 farmers in Webuye District, and is being represented by Janet, who is the group leader pictured above. She is 28 years old, is married and has three children. Janet has been a farmer for 16 years, and is often referred to as a very resourceful person.

Janet isn’t new to One Acre Fund.  She actually joined the program in 2014, and has since noticed her life has changed, especially in the sense that she has learned a lot from farming training ever since. 

This year, Janet will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase two solar lights. She is very excited about this addition, since now she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Using this loan, Janet's Group will purchase a total of 11 solar lights, and will use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 5 acres."

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Melap's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Melap, who, as a group leader, is representing her group formed by 10 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. She is married and is a mother to four children. She is known by her community as a very friendly person.

Initially, Melap joined One Acre Fund in 2009 because she wanted to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds. Since she joined the program she says that her life has improved, especially because she has learned a lot from farming trainings. With the profits from the coming harvesting season, Melap plans to send her children to school.

Between the 10 farmers in Melap's Group, a total of 4.5 acres of land will be planted using the maize seeds and fertilizer received with the loan. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of eight solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve the maize harvest

loans.name: Judith's Group

texts.en:
Judith is 49 years old and has seven children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 16 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. 

Judith has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2010. This decision was largely a result of her desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, and although she described her last harvest as very good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Judith also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Judith's Group will be able to receive a total of 14 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 9.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Mary's Group

texts.en:
"Mary is 51 years old and has 10 children. She has been a farmer for more than 40 years, and is always said to be a very experienced farmer. Even though Mary is the only one featured in the above picture, she is actually representing her group, formed by nine farmers in Webuye District, Kenya.

Mary started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2010, and decided to do so because she wanted to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds. Since then, she has seen her life improve, especially in the sense that she has learned a lot from farming training ever since. This year she decided to represent her group because she wanted to gain leadership skills.

Mary’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of six acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing  solar lights so that, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 4 solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en: Sonia is 41 years old and lives in her parents' house. Sonia is a seamstress and makes blankets. As a child, she was trained to sew by her mother. Sonia is married but her husband is unemployed right now.  Sonia is the mother of two children who are going to school. Sonia needs a loan to buy a machine that will help her to make more blankets. Sonia would like to have her own house in the future

loans.use: to buy a machine that will help her to make more blanquets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy equipment for his business

loans.name: Lutgarda

texts.en: Lutgarda sells potatoes and corn to make money. She is married and her husband is a mason.  Ludgarda is the mother of two men, but they are adults and have their own expenses. She works hard and she has her own house. She needs a loan to buy more potatoes and corn. The work is very hard for Lutgarda since she has to do everything by herself. Her husband travels a lot to work, so she is in trouble when she has to handle the potatoes and the corn, but she needs to work and she hopes you can help her.

loans.use: to buy more potatoes and corn.

loans.name: Bomson

texts.en: Bomson is 51 years old and married with 5 children, and all attend school in Hoima Uganda. He deals a retail shop selling soap, salt, and sugar among other items; this is supplemented by income from farming. He hopes to expand his business as well as educate his children. He will use the loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Beatrace
