texts.en: Beatrice lives in Hoima Uganda. She is aged 43 and a single mother of 4 children, and all attend school. She used the previous loan to start up a retail shop mainly selling general merchandise, salt, and sugar among other items. She supplements her business by farming. However, her main challenge is stiff competition. She desires to develop and grow her business. She will use the loan money to buy more salt, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.use: to buy more stock like salt, sugar and cooking oil

loans.name: Juan

texts.en: Juan is living with a good woman and they have been together for eight years. Juan has three little children and has his own house where his family lives comfortably. Juan sells milk and his girlfriend helps him with the business. He needs a loan to buy a dairy cow. Juan wants to have more cattle to sell more milk and he also wants his children to study at school. Sometimes they have to help him with the dairy business but Juan wants them to focus on education.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Irma

texts.en: Irma is a hardworking woman who sells potatoes. She is married and her husband is a taxi driver. Irma has three children. She needs a loan to buy potatoes She would like to have her own farm to produce them, but that is not possible right now. Irma and her family have their own house and she will do anything to improve the quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy potatoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a house.

loans.name: Inga

texts.en:
Inga is a 48-year-old widow woman, from Zugdidi district. She has a school-aged daughter and son and on her own works to make financial stability for her children. Inga was unable to get high school education and can't find any stable job, so in order to lead the family she started a trading business with fruits and vegetables. She works at the local market and generates a small income.

Inga has great desire to increase the turnover and expand her trading business. The start up program, a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, gave her the chance to realize her purpose and expand her business. With the received funds Inga plans to purchase stock of clothing at wholesale prices and sell in her community at increased prices. This will give her an additional source of income and make her work more productive.

Inga and her children rely on the good will of lenders and greatly appreciate your help, as their poor living condition will be made better.

loans.use: To start trading business with clothing and increase turnover

loans.name: Ana Milena

texts.es:
Milena es una sonriente, trabajadora, amorosa madre, sus 3 hijos de 13, 10 y 6 años de edad representan para ella toda su vida, le sirven como motivación para salir adelante, para superarse, para poner empelo en cada actividad pues quiere que tengan lo mejor y sean personas de bien para la sociedad. 
Milena se dedica a la venta de alimentos la cual desarrolla en la cocina de su casa, vendiendo almuerzos, desayunos y fritos. 
Esta actividad también la adopto por una razón y es que ella está imposibilitada para ciertos trabajos debido a una incapacidad que no nombra para no despertar lastima. 
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de utensilios de cocina, comprar arroz, pastas, panela, frutas, carne, salsas entre otros ingredientes para realizar sus ricos alimentos.
texts.en:
Milena is a smiling, hardworking, loving mother.  Her 3 children, who are 13, 10 and 6 years old, mean everything to her.  They are her motivation to get ahead, to better herself, to put effort into each activity as she wants them to have the best and be good members of society.

Milena makes a living selling food which she makes in the kitchen of her house.  She sells lunches, breakfasts and fried foods.  She also took on this activity for the reason that she is unable to do certain jobs due to a disability that she doesn’t name so as not to be pitied.
 
She is requesting a loan for the purchase of kitchen utensils, rice, pasta, panela (raw cane sugar), fruits, meat and sauces, among other ingredients, to make her delicious food.

loans.use: to buy rice, pasta, panela (raw cane sugar), fruits, meat, sauces and utensils to make her delicious food.

loans.name: Dali

texts.en:
Dali is 42 years old and a married woman, from Senaki district. She lives with her husband and two children and the family members have persecuted pension for their involuntary movement. Because of this, Dali started working at the local bakery, as the family income was hardly enough to cover even basic needs. However, she doesn't generate significant income there and wants to start her own business. 

Because of the above situation, Dali lacks the access to capital markets and financial institutions to obtain credit for starting a business, as the creditors didn't find enough family income to be sufficient to approve the loan.  The Start Up program created by Kiva and Credo enabled her to get a loan of 3,300 GEL and start a trading business.  She will purchase a stock of household goods, especially utensils, and will sell them in her community at increased prices. 

Dali thinks that the business will be profitable, as she will work on low price mark-ups. The family will have a stable income, which will enable them to cover everyday costs as well as expand the business in the future.  With support of the Start Up program, Dali will get an opportunity to be involved in her own business and tackle the financial difficulties.

loans.use: to start her own business and trade with utensils.

loans.name: John's Group

texts.en:
John is a 58-year-old proud father of 9 children. He is a group leader, often described as a very reliable person, and is representing his group of 15 farmers in Webuye District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2014, John has noticed that he has had more profits from each harvest.

John described his harvest as very good last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to invest in a business.

With this loan, John’s Group will be able to plant a total of 6.25 acres of land and purchase a total of 15 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Yesu-Mo Group

texts.en: Living in Accra, six people formed the Yesu-Mo Group. They want to transform their lives through empowerment, small loans and education. They have a vision of raising their standard of living and creating a more prosperous future for themselves and their families. Diana is an unmarried member of this group. She is a 42 years old and sells plates and bowls. Diana wants to continue to support her child's education. She buys plates and bowls at wholesale prices and sells to customers. Diana is requesting a loan to buy more plates and bowls. She always learns something new and useful through ID-Ghana's program which enhances members' lives and businesses. Members of this group have benefited from educational training sessions essential to their success as caretakers of their families and businesses. The training is given in the indigenous language of the women, often with pictures, and covers a variety of subjects including effective business management practices, nutritional and health tools, and self-esteem.

loans.use: To buy plates and bowls at wholesale prices to sell to customers..

loans.name: Marta Dalila

texts.es:
Marta tiene 35 años de edad,  estudio hasta 6° en la escuela de la comunidad, vivía con sus padres y tenía que trabajar por la mañana y estudiar por las tardes, es madre soltera de 4 hijos los cuales estudian actualmente nivel básico.

Desde muy pequeña, Marta iba a vender a la ciudad verduras y frutas, actualmente tiene crianza de gallinas ponedoras, proyecto que emprendió por iniciativa propia desde hace 3 años, también vende pescados y antojitos como enchiladas, pasteles, panes con pollo, refrescos entre otros, además vende pan dos días por semana y su hijo mayor la espera en el pueblo donde recibe las clases y se vienen caminando y vendiendo el pan por las comunidades.
Ella está solicitando este crédito para comprar concentrado para las gallinas y también para realizar una fosa en la vivienda.
Su sueño es mejorar la vivienda ya que es de adobe, quiere darle una mayor seguridad a su familia en cuanto al hogar y poder ayudar a que sus hijos terminen los estudios.
texts.en:
Marta, 35, studied up until the 6th grade at the neighborhood school. She lived with her parents and had to work in the mornings and study in the afternoons. She is a single mother of four children, who are in primary school.

From a young age, Marta went out to sell fruit and vegetables in the city. She is currently raising laying hens. She started this project on her own initiative three years ago. She also sells fish and snacks, such as enchiladas, pastries, bread with chicken, and soft drinks, among others. She also sells bread two days per week. Her oldest son meets her in the town where he goes to school and they walk around to sell bread in the communities. 

She is applying for a loan to buy feed for the chickens, as well as to build a pit in her home. 

Her dream is to improve her home, which is made of adobe. She wants to give her family greater security in their home and to help her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed and to build a pit in her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, soft drinks, rice, sweets, and daily consumer goods.

loans.name: Las Agricultoras Group

texts.en:
The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Las Agricultoras” is applying for their first Kiva funded loan to support and expand their various established small businesses. The eight women who form “Las Agricultoras” are from a small rural community outside of the departmental capital, Santa Cruz el Quiche in the western highlands of Guatemala. The majority of the women in the group have very little formal education and primarily speak K’iche, one of the many languages of Guatemala’s large indigenous Maya population. Friendship Bridge loan officers provide monthly educational trainings on topics including women’s empowerment, financial literacy, and health that are essential to the Microcredit Plus product, in the women’s native language of K’iche. These trainings allow the women to have access to education in their primary language, which helps them improve the probability of their businesses and quality of their home life.

Magdalena is one of the most experienced members of “Las Agricultoras,” having worked with Friendship Bridge for over three years. A 46-year-old mother of six children, Magdalena, continues to support her four youngest children in their education. Magdalena is applying for a loan to maintain and grow the “tortilleria” (tortilla store) she has owned for over six years. The “tortilleria” employs her two married daughters who live in the capital city of Guatemala. Together the two daughters work from six in the morning until eight at night cooking and selling tortillas to local clients who buy freshly made tortillas for every meal. Magdalena operates the store from her small community in el Quiche, visiting the capital every other week to monitor the business.  

With the small loan, Magdalena plans to invest in a second stove, corn, gas and various cooking supplies, to increase the production of her toritlleria. According to Magdalena, the neighborhood where she operates her “tortilleria,” has not been overwhelmed by competition. In fact, she hopes to continue building capital for a potential expansion into another store in the neighborhood. With additional production capability in the original store, and the possibility of expanding, Magdalena hopes to reach a wider range of customers. 

With the support of Kiva investors, Magdalena and the rest of the Trust Bank “Las Argricultoras,” will have the opportunity to realize their business goals. Thank you, Kiva investors, for believing in the ability of entrepreneurial women to improve their lives and the futures of their families through small businesses.

loans.use: to invest in a second stove, corn, gas and various cooking supplies, to increase the production of her toritlleria.

location.town: Santa Cruz del Quiche, El Quiche

loans.name: Muungano Group

texts.fr: Madame Mulangala est âgée de 39 ans, mariée à un homme sans emploie, mère de 6 enfants tous étudiants et trésorière de l’association d’affaire Muungano. Elle s’occupe de la vente des  habits  depuis 2008 suite à l’initiative de son mari. Elle vient de solliciter un nouveau prêt afin d’acheter 1 douzaine de pantalon Jeans, 1 douzaine des robes et des jupes pour enfant ainsi des vestes pour homme. Son objectif est  de devenir grossiste et posséder un grand dépôt commercial. Ainsi, elle tient à remercier HEKIMA pour le soutien qu’elle ne cesse d’apporter aux femmes à faible revenu.
texts.en:
Mulangala, age 39, is the treasurer of the business group Muungano. She has six children who all go to school, and her husband is unemployed. She has been selling clothing since 2008 following a suggestion by her husband.  

She is seeking this new loan to buy 1 dozen pairs of jeans, 1 dozen dresses and skirts for children, and men’s vests. 

Her goals are to become a wholesaler and to own a large warehouse. 

She thanks Hekima for its consistent support of low-income women.

loans.use: to buy 1 dozen pairs of jeans, 1 dozen dresses and skirts for children, and men’s vests.

loans.name: Dorcas Group

texts.fr: Madame Nambula  est vice-présidente du groupe Dorcas, âgée de 54 ans, mariée à un commerçant et mère de 9 enfants tous étudiants. Elle vient de demander un nouveau credit pour acheter 23 sacs de ciment et son transport. Son objectif pour l’avenir est de prospérer dans ses affaires. Au finish, elle remercie de tout cœur HEKIMA.
texts.en:
Nambula, age 54, is the vice-president of the group Dorcas. She is married to a merchant and they have nine children who all go to school. 

She is seeking this new loan to buy 23 sacks of cement and pay for delivery. 

Her long-term goal is to run a profitable business. 

She sincerely thanks Hekima.

loans.use: to buy 23 sacks of cement and pay for delivery.

loans.name: Jhonatan Ramiro

texts.es:
Jhonatan es un joven inquieto, curioso, preocupado pero sobre todo muy protector y trabajar, tan solo tiene 18 años pero con sus habilidades para la venta y ante todo sus deseos de salir adelante monto un negocio donde ofrece dulces, snack, chocolates y café.
Inicio esta actividad por necesidad económica, él quiere estudiar, sacar su familia adelante, salir de la pobreza, comer mejor, mejores condiciones de vida y que mejor que tener un negocio para trabajarlo y crecer junto a este.
Jhonatan de manera muy encarecida quiere le apoyen para crecer y lo piensa hacer solicitando un préstamo para la compra de surtido de frituras, chocolates y una vitrina para exhibir más productos.
Una buena opción para apoyar el día de hoy es Jhonatan que usa su juventud para ayudar incondicionalmente a su familia y pagar sus estudios
texts.en:
Jhonatan is a restless, curious, anxious young man but above all he is very protective and hardworking.  He is only 18 years old but with his skills for selling and above all his desires to get ahead he has set up a business where he offers sweets, snacks, chocolates and coffee.

He started this activity because of financial need.  He wants to go to school, help his family get ahead, get out of poverty, eat better and have better living conditions; what better way to do these things than to work in and grow alongside his business.
 
Jhonatan earnestly wants support in order to grow and he is thinking to request a loan for the purchase of a stock of fried foods, chocolates and a display case to display more products. 

Jhonatan is a good choice for supporting today as he uses his youth to unconditionally help his family and pay for his education.

loans.use: to buy sweets, snacks, fried foods, to pay for his studies and to help out at home.

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
Francisco un hombre de 32 años muy recursivo y creativo que con unas tablas y mucho ingenio construyo un negocio de tienda de abarrotes el cual adopto por necesidad económica ante la falta de oportunidades para emplearse en alguna empresa.
Francisco es un hombre soltero pero tiene un pequeño de 6 años, por el cual responde y le manda dinero cada 15 días para su alimentación, educación, vestimenta. 
Aprendió del negocio de las tiendas gracias a su madre quien tiene una  y en su juventud se lo llevaba para que trabajara. 
Francisco tiene una meta muy clara la cual es mantener su tienda en el tiempo, pues le ha tocado ver como varias tiendas cierran porque la económica no les da para mantenerla, busca ser más competitivo, incrementar su inventario y clientes.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de arroz, azúcar, aceite, café y productos enlatados productos de mayor rotación en su tienda.
Con tu ayuda este hombre abastecerá su negocio permitiendo seguir desempeñando su actividad y ser competitivo en el mercado.
texts.en:
Francisco is a very resourceful and creative 32 year old man who with a few boards and a lot of ingeniousness constructed a grocery store business which he took on for economic necessity, given the lack of opportunity to find employment with a company. Francisco is single but has a young 6 year old son who he takes responsiblity for and sends money every 15 days for his food, education and clothing.

He learned his grocery business thanks to his mother who had a store when he was young and she took him with her to work. Francisco has a very clear goal which is to keep the store up with the times. He has happened to see stores that closed because the economy wouldn't support them. He is looking to be more competitive and increase his inventory and clientele.

He is requesting a loan to buy rice, sugar, oil, coffee and canned products as these are the products with the quickest turn-over in his store. With your help this man can stock his business which will allow him to continue with his business and be competitive in the market.

loans.use: to stock his business with rice, sugar, oil, coffee and canned goods as these are the products with highest turn-over.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay rent on the land where he will plant crops and to buy wire to fence in his property.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy the necessary materials to create traditional textiles, including threads and dyes.

loans.name: Mchungaji Group

texts.fr: Madame Bisimwa est secrétaire de l’association de crédit Muchungaji  à l’âge de 37 ans. Elle est mariée à un vendeur des divers articles et mère de 2 enfants tous scolarisés. Vendeuse de friperie au marché central de la place depuis 2002, elle sollicite un nouveau prêt  pour acheter 1 ballot de friperie. Son objectif pour l’avenir est de construire une maison, prospérer dans ses affaires et devenir grossiste.
texts.en:
Bisimwa, age 37, is the secretary of the group Mchungaji. She is married to a man who sells various goods, and they have two children who both go to school.

Bisimwa has been selling second-hand clothing at the local market since 2002. She is seeking a new loan to buy one bale of second-hand clothing. 

Her long-term goals are to build a house, run a profitable business and become a wholesaler.

loans.use: to buy one bale of second-hand clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cereals and ground nuts.

loans.name: Tuchukuliane Group

texts.fr: La cliente  Luhinzo est une femme dynamique de l’association d’affaire Tuchukuliane. Mariée à un agent de la fonction publique, elle est âgée de 43 ans et mère de 8 enfants qui vont tous à l’école.Elle débuta  les affaires de vente des souliers en 2012 avec le soutien de son mari.Elle sollicite un nouveau prêt pour acheter 20 paires des souliers usagés afin de renforcer son Stock. Elle a comme objectif de payer les études des enfants et devenir une grande Commerçante.
texts.en: Luhinzo is an energetic member of Tuchukuliane Group. She is 43 years old, married to a civil servant, and the mother of eight children who all attend school. Luhinzo began selling shoes in 2012 with the support of her husband. She is seeking a new loan to purchase 20 pairs of secondhand shoes in order to increase her stock. Luhinzo's goal is to pay for her children's education and become a major shopkeeper.

loans.use: To purchase 20 pairs of secondhand shoes.

loans.name: Ufundi Group

texts.fr: La cliente Munyerenkana est mariée à un fonctionnaire de l’Etat. Présidente de l’association de crédit Ufundi, elle est mère de 10 enfants tous allant à l’école à l’âge de 52 ans. Elle est vendeuse des souliers usagers depuis plus de 5 ans au marché central ; c’est ainsi qu’elle sollicite un nouveau prêt pour renforcer son stock avec 10 paires des souliers. Son objectif est de scolariser ses enfants jusqu’au niveau universitaire et devenir grossiste. Au final, elle remercie de tout cœur HEKIMA pour son soutien.
texts.en:
Munyerenkana is married to a government employee. The president of Ufundi Group, she is 52 years old and the mother of 10 children, all of whom attend school. Munyerenkana has been selling secondhand shoes at the central market for five years; this is why she is seeking a new loan to increase her stock by 10 pairs of shoes. 

Munyerenkana's goal is to be able to send her children to school up to university and to become a wholesaler. She would like to end by thanking Hekima with all her heart for their support.

loans.use: To increase her stock by [purchasing] 10 pairs of shoes.

loans.name: Nyashadzamwari Group

texts.en:
Orphaned at an early age, Memory and her siblings learned the value of hard work. They grew up taking care of themselves and also trying to earn extra income by renting out their late parent's house. Memory is the chairlady of Nyashadzamwari (translated God’s grace) Group. She is younger than the other group members but her determination and vision led to her selection by the others. 

Nyashadzamwari Group is in their 4th loan cycle with Thrive Microfinance. Memory joined Thrive with the hope of growing her small chicken business. She used her previous loans to add variety to her business and extend her fowl run to accommodate more than 300 and has wire cages as well. Memory has grown her chicken business to sell different types of chickens. Memory now sells the normal broiler chickens, mother broiler chickens and off layer chickens. She now has the capacity to have more than 500 chickens at different stages at once. Memory also has an employee who sells chickens for her at their busy shopping centre. With income generated from her business, Memory has managed to refurbish her parent’s house, buy and build a 2 roomed cottage as well as cater for the daily needs of their family. With her current loan Memory wants to further grow her business and add layers to her chicken project and also sell eggs.

loans.use: To expand her poultry business into selling eggs as well as broilers.

loans.name: Jorge Enrique

texts.es:
Jorge es un hombre soltero de 32 años de edad, en busca del amor, de una pareja con la cual pueda conformar una familia, se dedica a la cría  de ganado porcino y de aves, actividad que aprendió solo y con la cual genera su propio sustento, trabaja diariamente en sus corrales el tiempo que sea necesario, se levanta a asearlos, darles de comer y mantenerlos en óptimas condiciones.
Jorge no es conformista él quiere mejorar sus condiciones de vida, incrementar su utilidad, tener más clientes, ya que le ha tocado ver como muchos de sus vecinos quiebran y no quiere eso para su negocio por eso es activo y busca siempre alternativas de inversión  de expansión de su negocio.
Jorge solicita un préstamo para la compra de cerdos, pollos y alimento, necesita el crédito con urgencia pues uno de sus vecinos le está dejando a un extraordinario precio estos insumos y quiere aprovechar esta oferta.
texts.en:
Jorge is a single, 32-year-old man who is searching for love, for a partner with whom he can form a family.  He makes a living raising pigs and poultry, an activity that he learned by himself and with which he generates his own livelihood.  He works every day for as long as is necessary in his corrals.  He gets up to clean them, feed them and maintain them in optimal conditions. 

Jorge isn’t satisfied.  He wants to improve his living conditions, increase his profits, have more customers as he has seen how many of his neighbors have gone bankrupt and he doesn’t want that for his business.  For that reason he is active and he is always looking for alternative investments to expand his business.

Jorge is requesting a loan for the purchase of pigs, chickens and feed.  He urgently needs the loan as one of his neighbors is letting him have an extraordinary price on these supplies and he wants to take advantage of this offer.

loans.use: to make a deal with a neighbor who will let him have some chickens and pigs at a low price.

loans.name: Sarah Group

texts.en:
Forget is a member of Sarah Group. She is married and a mother to a young baby. The group is based in Kuwadzana High density suburb in Harare. As a young wife and mother Forget saw it paramount to help her husband in meeting the daily needs of the family and started a business. When Sarah and her group members came to Thrive she was a vendor with a small market stall selling eggs, airtime and ice cream. 

Forget and her group members benefited immensely from the business training they got from Thrive Microfinance. They received lessons in record keeping, budgeting and growing their businesses. With her first loan from Thrive, Forget managed to change her line of business to that of being a mobile money transfer agent. She also sells sim cards and other related products from her ecocash mobile money transfer booth. With her second loan Forget is planning to open another money transfer booth thereby increasing her commission levels. Forget is aspiring to build her own house some day and also buy herself a car.

loans.use: to open a second booth selling airtime and related accessories.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is from Oroquieta. She is 38-years-old and is married. Jean owns and operates a retail store business, operating a specialized retail store selling school and office supplies in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

Jean joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Jean is requesting a new loan of 49,900 PHP which will be used to purchase additional supply inventory and use as working capital. This loan will be her third loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional supply inventory and use as working capital

loans.name: Ma. Serelina

texts.en:
Ma. Serelina has a lot of experience in farming. She has mastered farming activities from growing to harvesting to earning an income as well. She has supported her husband doing this type of work.

Ma. Serelina has nurtured her membership with PMPC and maintained a good repayment record. She knows she can always turn to the cooperative for her financial needs. Recently, she requested a loan to purchase rice seeds that will produce healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings. Someday, Ma. Serelina hopes to purchase more land to cultivate and increase her income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds.

loans.name: Maris

texts.en: Maris is 24 years old and lives in Maular, Aloran, in the Philippines. She is married and has two school-age children. Maris and her husband manage a shop that sells motor spare parts and accessories. This is her way of earning a living to raise her family. She has had this business for more than a year and earns approximately 7,000 PHP each month. Maris has requested a loan to purchase additional inventory to be able to meet her customers' demand. Maris has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Maris hopes to own a wide and comfortable space where she can relocate her shop to expand and improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase inventory of spare parts and accessories

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita requested a PHP 10,000 loan through PMPC to buy fertilizer and seedlings of flowers she sells.  She has been in this business for 10 years now.
Pacita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seedlings

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester is 60-years-old, married and a resident of Aloran, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Her husband is a carpenter and a farmer. They have five children, one of whom is in college now. Starting with capital of 4,000 PHP, she opened a sari-sari (small grocery) store and was able to expand it with the help of Paglaum Cooperative. Aside from financial assistance, she was able to generate savings and enjoys the benefit given by the co-op. She became a member in July 2011 and has taken out three loans. 

Now she is applying for 10,000 PHP to buy additional stock for her sari-sari store, particularly basic commodities. In the future, she wants to own a mini-mart some day, and will be fully satisfied if she can renovate and expand her house.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for her sari-sari store, particularly basic commodities

loans.name: Jory

texts.en:
Ricster is 18-years-old and is first of the five children in the family. His mother Jory, a member of NWTF, supports the family through her business raising livestock in the Philippines.

Ricster is studying Bachelor in Science in Secondary Education and is currently in the 2nd of this 4-year course.

Jory is borrowing PHP 5,750 to pay for tuition fees of her son Ricster for the second semester of the school year 2014-2015.

Ricster plans to graduate and be gainfully employed.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
Eufemia is 44 years old and has two children. Eufemia is married, and her two children are in school.

Eufemia is in the agricultural business of farming rice in the Philippines. Eufemia requested a 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Eufemia has been in this business for five years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Eufemia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 61 years old and has eight children. Mary is married, and five of her children are in school.

Mary is in the agricultural business of farming flowers in the Philippines. Mary requested an 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Mary has been in this business for 15 years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Mary would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia is 57 years old and married with four children. Antonia works very hard to provide for them.

Antonia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy shampoo, cigarettes, groceries, etc.

Antonia has been in this business for two years now. 

In the future, Antonia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, cigarettes, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Sholie is 18 years old and is fifth of the six children in the family. Her father Samuel supports the family through his driver business in the Philippines.

Sholie is studying Bachelor of Science in Criminology and is currently in the second year of this four-year course.

Samuel is borrowing PHP 8,500 to pay for tuition fees of his daughter Sholie for the second semester of the school year 2014-2015.

Sholie plans to graduate and be gainfully employed.

loans.use: to to pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a married woman with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Grace is 43 years old, and her child is in school.

Grace has a buying and selling of bananas business in the Philippines. Grace requested a 15,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase more bananas to sell to her customers.

Grace has been in this business for 20 years. Grace would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas to sell to her customers

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 44 years old and married with four children. With one child in school, Vilma works very hard to provide for them.

Vilma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 7,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, beverages, groceries, etc.

Vilma has been in this business for three years now. 

In the future, Vilma would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, beverages, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Boboniyoz

texts.ru: Бобониез жизнерадостный мужчина в возрасте 47 лет. Он женат и имеет четверо детей. У него очень дружная семья. Живут они в сельской местности. Чтобы иметь доход в семье, все члены семьи пытаются как-то зарабатывать деньги. Каждый трудится как может. Основным и стабильным бизнесом Бобониеза является животноводство. Он разводит и продаёт скот. В этом деле ему помогает жена. Она ухаживает за скотом, а также продаёт полученное от скота молоко. Бизнес животноводства приносит Бобониезу хороший и стабильный доход. Поэтому он желает расширить этот бизнес. Ему необходимо купить ещё несколько голов скота для выращивания и дальнейшей продажи. Для этого Бобониез обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку скота. Он надеется, что этот бизнес будет успешно расширяться и приносить больше прибыли, чтобы качественно удовлетворять нужды семьи. Бобониез заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en: Boboniyoz is a happy 47-year-old man. He is married and has four children. He has a very friendly family. They live in a rural area. All of the family members try to earn money somehow to provide income for the family. Everyone works as they can. Animal husbandry is Boboniyoz's primary and stable business. He fattens up and sells livestock. His wife helps him with this business. She cares for the livestock and also sells milk obtained from the livestock. The animal husbandry business yields Boboniyoz a good and stable income. This is why he wants to expand this business. He needs to buy several more heads of livestock for fattening up and subsequent resale. For this purpose, Boboniyoz came to Arvand and wants to obtain a loan to buy livestock. He hopes that this business will successfully grow and yield more profit in order to satisfactorily meet the family's needs. Boboniyoz thanks Arvand in advance for the support.

loans.use: to buy livestock in order to expand his business

loans.name: Baraka Group

texts.fr: La cliente Neema est trésorière du groupe Baraka. Agée de 51 ans, elle est mariée à un commerçant et ensemble ils ont 10 enfants qui étudient. Elle vend des matériels de construction et plomberie depuis plus de 5 ans dans un kiosque au bord de la rue. Elle sollicite un prêt pour lui permettre d’acquérir 10 rouleaux de fil électrique, 5 carton de vanne de robinet et autres matériels divers.  Son perspective d’avenir est  d’agrandir son entreprise et de payer les frais scolaires de ses enfants. Elle remercie HEKIMA pour le soutien indéfectible qu’elle apporte aux femmes à faibles revenus.
texts.en:
Neema is Baraka Group's treasurer. She is 51 years old and married to a shopkeeper; together, they have 10 children who are in school. Neema has been selling construction and plumbing materials for more than five years in a street-side kiosk. She is seeking a loan to allow her to purchase 10 rolls of electric wire, five boxes of faucet valves, and various other goods.

Neema's future goals are to grow her business and to pay the school fees of her children. She thanks Hekima for their unflagging support of low-income women.

loans.use: To purchase 10 rolls of electric wire, five boxes of faucet valves, and various other goods.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
In the year 2009, Elizabeth became a full-fledged member of Paglaum MPC. She received financial assistance as a farmer in Mahayag. She tried her luck and borrowed a loan to start for her rice production. To this day, Elizabeth feels she owes her good fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used for her business. 

Recently, she availed herself of a loan to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer for the next cropping season. Elizabeth wishes to sustain her business and be able to supply rice to the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita makes good earnings from her farming activities in Molave. This is how she supports her family and is able to send her children to school. 

She wants to increase her farm yield, especially now that she has a high cost of living when her children entered college. Rosita approached Paglaum to borrow an amount to purchase a knapsack sprayer for insecticides. She has high hopes that she will have good produce this cropping season.

loans.use: to purchase a knapsack sprayer for insecticides

loans.name: Lilina

texts.en:
Lilina is 63 years old and is very responsible with her household obligations, since she has always been known to provide the best for her family. She currently lives with her husband and five children. She is a farmer who plants corn and beans.

Lilina wants to increase sales. Consequently, she has requested a loan that will enable her to purchase seeds, compost and fertilizer, among other items, so that she can continue to put bread on the table in her home.

loans.use: to pay for seeds, compost and fertilizer

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda finds pleasure in doing her gardening activities. Not only that she is doing her hobby, she earns an income as well. At the age of 50 and married, she busies herself to sufficiently provide for the family. She grabbed the opportunity to become a full pledge member of PMPC. She credits to the cooperative her capital in supporting her gardening activities. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase gardening tools and fertilizers. In the future, Erlinda wishes to become the supplier of flowers in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase gardening tools and fertilizers

loans.name: Nerie

texts.en:
Nerissa is 18 years old and is the first and only child in the family. Her mother, Nerie, is a member of NWTF and supports the family through her pig-fattening business in the Philippines.

Nerissa is studying to be a medical dental nursing assistant and is currently in the second year of this two-year course.

Nerie is borrowing 7,600 PHP to pay for tuition fees of her daughter, Nerissa, for the second semester of the school year 2014-2015.

Nerissa plans to graduate and be gainfully employed.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Anghelita

texts.en:
Anghelita is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Anghelita is 48 years old, and two of her children are in school.

Anghelita has a nipa (palm) roofing business in the Philippines. Anghelita requested an 8,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy more nipa leaves and bamboo sticks to use in her business.

Anghelita has been in this business for five years. In the future, Anghelita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more nipa (palm) leaves and bamboo sticks to use in her business

loans.name: Telena

texts.en:
Telena is 55-years-old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Telena is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her livestock.

Telena has been raising livestock for 3 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling rice.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her livestock

loans.name: Marife

texts.en: Marife landed at a right place for her needed capital when she joined PMPC. She knew this would be her last chance to get back on her feet when she went broke after her first business went bad. PMPC to Marife came as a rescue for lending her money when she needed it the most. Now, she availed another loan for the next cropping season. She will use the loaned amount for land and seedbed preparation.  Marife perseveres and always believes to reach her goals to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparation

loans.name: Fidel Rosalio

texts.es: Fidel de 53 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hijo, el posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace varios años, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios y la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, el está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida junto con su familia.
texts.en: Fidel is 53 years old and lives with his wife and son in a house that he owns.  For many years, he has run a small store out of his home.  He has many customers due to his fair pricers and his great customer service.  He is seeking this loan to purchase more soups, eggs, basic grains, beverages, snacks, sweet bread, etc., so that he can improve his earnings and improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: purchase more soups, eggs, basic grains, beverages, snacks, sweet bread, etc.

loans.name: Donna Fete

texts.en: Donna Fete is 35-years-old and lives in San Vicente Alto, Ozamiz City. She is married and has three children. For a living, Donna Fete owns and operates a business providing transport to the local community. She has been doing this for three years. Donna Fete has purchased another motorcycle unit in an installment basis, she plans to acquire a cab for her motorcycle, of which she has requested a loan of PHP 14,000. Donna Fete is a new member of PMPC. In the future, she hopes to provide her children a good education and renovate her house.

loans.use: to purchase a cab for her motorcycle transport business

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.en:
Eugenia is 62-years-old, married and a resident of Manla, Sapang Dalaga, Philippines. Her husband is a Village Leader. They have 3 children who are all married.  Starting with capital of 1,000 PHP, she opened a sari-sari (general store) and was able to expand it with the help of Paglaum Cooperative. Aside from financial assistance, she was able to generate savings and enjoys the benefit given by the co-op. She became a member as of this year. 

Now she is applying for 3,000 PHP to buy additional stock for her sari-sari store, particularly basic commodities.  In the future, she wants to own a mini-mart someday, and will be fully satisfied if she can save for an emergency.

loans.use: to buy stock for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Emelynda

texts.en:
Emelynda is 52 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Emelynda is borrowing PHP 19000 through NWTF to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Emelynda has been farming rice for 17 years and also earns additional income from raising livestock.

She successfully paid back her previous loans and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Dena

texts.en:
Dena is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Dena is 50-years-old and has one child in school.

Dena has a business buying and selling jewelry in the Philippines. Dena requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more jewelry to sell.

Dena has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Dena would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more jewelry to sell

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is 52-years-old and married with four children. With one child still in school, Joy works very hard to provide for them.

Joy runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, soft-drinks, noodles, detergent soap, shampoo, candies, etc. to sell.

Joy has been in this business for 25 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soft-drinks, noodles, detergent soap, shampoo, candies, etc. 

In the future, Joy would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, soft-drinks, noodles, detergent soap, shampoo, candies, etc. to sell

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
Lucena is 58-years-old and married with four children.

Lucena works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Lucena has borrowed and paid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from raising livestock.

Lucena aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 43-years-old and married with two children. With two children in school, Gina works very hard to provide for them.

Gina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like cigarettes, canned goods, shampoo, groceries, etc..

Gina has been in this business for 28 years now. 

In the future, Gina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like cigarettes, canned goods, shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell in her general store.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 8 years. She earns more income from raising livestock.

Jocelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Merigyn

texts.en: Merigyn makes a living through her junk shop business. She runs a junk shop in El Paraiso, Sapang Dalaga and earns a promising income to support her family. She has signed up her membership with Paglaum MPC to gain access to capital.She availed a loan to buy junk like metalcraft, bottles and broken plastics for resale. Merigyn hopes to sustain her business and dreams to send all her children to school.

loans.use: to buy junk like metalcraft, bottles and broken plastics for resale

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is from Mobod, Oroquieta city. She is married with five adult-aged children. 
In 2004, Teresita applied for a membership with PMPC.  Hearing all the benefits, she never hesitated to become a member. Since then, she had maintained her status in good standing and continued to repay her obligations in a timely manner. 

Recently, Teresita is asking for a financial assistance of 14,900 PHP to purchase additional store inventories for her grocery store business. Through this loan, she hopes to increase her income and be able to save for the expansion of her business in the future. 

She finds assistance for her financial needs through Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and she is very thankful with all her heart.

loans.use: to purchase additional store inventories

loans.name: Angel

texts.en:
From Oroquieta, Philippines,.Angel is 21 years old and married. Her husband is a construction worker involved in carpentry activities, while Angel has had a snack vending business for the past year, selling rice cakes and earning approximately PHP 3,000 each month. 

Angel wants to provide a simple yet comfortable living space for her family. She has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase nails, additional sticks and plywood for her house. Angel recently became an active member of PMPC, and now she is on her way to building her house.

loans.use: to purchase nails, additional sticks and plywood for her house

loans.name: Maria Ofelia

texts.es: Maria de 45 años de edad es viuda vive en casa propia con su hijo quien trabaja y le ayuda económicamente, ella se dedica desde hace varios años a la venta de pupusas, su negocio está ubicado cerca de su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas y la ayuda de su hijo, logran solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de chicharrón, quesillo, frijoles, harina, maíz y todo los ingredientes necesarios, para poder tener mejores ganancias y asi una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria is 45 years old and is widowed.  She lives in a house that she owns with her son who works and helps out financially.  For many years, she has worked selling pupusas.  Her business is located near her home.  With her earnings and her son's help, she is able to cover some of her household expenses.

She is seeking a loan to purchase pork rinds, cheese, beans, flour, corn and other necessary ingredients.  This will allow her to improve her earnings and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: purchase pork rinds, cheese, beans, flour, corn and other necessary ingredients.

loans.name: Neria

texts.en:
Neria is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Neria is 62 years old now.

Neria has a nipa-roofing business in the Philippines. Neria requested a PHP 8000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more nipa leaves to use in her business.

Neria has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Neria would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more nipa leaves to use in her business.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 54 years old and married with three children. She earns a living by farming ornamental plants in the Philippines. Sarah is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Sarah has been in this business for 10 years and also earns additional income from pot making. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion, a 60-year-old widow, is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For five years she has operated a personal products business in the Philippines.

Salvacion has requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of personal products to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of personal products to sell.

loans.name: Emigdio De Jesus

texts.es:
Emigdio tiene 44 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo grado,  es acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos, es padre de cinco hijos de los cuales 3 se encuentran trabajando y los otros dos estudian.


Emigdio se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos, (maíz y frijol), aprendió esta actividad de sus padres y sus abuelos ya que ellos hacían lo mismo cuando él era joven, fue así como poco a poco agarro  más conocimientos, el lugar donde trabaja le queda a 20 minutos de su casa y se va a pie, con el trabajan sus hermanos y generalmente lo hacen de 6:00 am a 12  del mediodía.

El necesita este crédito para comprar 3 vigas, pilares, cuartones, vara de tusa y 6 libras de clavos, para terminar de construir su casa.


Su sueño es ver terminada su vivienda en la cual tenga mayor comodidad y seguridad para su familia.
texts.en:
Emigido is 44 years old and has a second grade education.  He is married and his homemaker.  He is a father of five children, three of whom work and two who are in school.  Emigdio works growing basic grains (corn and beans).  He learned this trade from his parents and grandparents since they did this work when he was a young boy.  Little by little, he learned how to farm.  The place where he works is 20 minutes away from his house and he walks there.  He works with his siblings and they usually work from 6am to noon.

He is in need of this loan to purchase three beams, pillars, scantling, corn husk rods, and six pounds of nails to finish building his home.  His dream is to finish building his home so that his family can be more comfortable and more secure.

loans.use: purchase three beams, pillars, scantling, corn husk rods, and six pounds of nails to finish building his home.

loans.name: Ciriaco

texts.en:
Ciriaco is 77 years old and lives in Rizal, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is married with two children now at their adult age. Ciriaco is a retired government employee and presently enjoying his monthly pension of not less than PHP 7,000 and been receiving this for more than 10 years already.  He is also receiving income from their agricultural land, particularly coco land. 

He has requested a loan to be used in purchasing commercial fertilizers and sprays for his rice production business. Ciriaco has been a member of PMPC for five years.  In the future, Ciriaco hopes to expand his rice production business activity.

loans.use: to purchase commercial fertilizers and sprays.

loans.name: Ellen Grace

texts.en:
Ellen Grace has mastered her skills of making bread. She has her own unique bread recipe and she is known for her homemade, sweet bread. This has kept her business going for more than two years now. 

Recently, Ellen Grace requested a loan to buy more kilos of flour, sugar and margarine for bread production. She hopes to expand her business by displaying in more store outlets.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of flour, sugar and other ingredients.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en: Vilma is 46 years old and lives in Tamban, Baliangao, Philippines. She is married with seven children. She sells rice to earn a living and has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan to purchase more rice to sell. Vilma has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, she hopes to save for emergencies.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice for retail

loans.name: Lee Jean

texts.en:
Lee Jean is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 34 years old and has four children who are currently in school. Lee Jean has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She has requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers. Lee Jean has been in this business for seven years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Jessia

texts.en:
Jessia is 42 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Jessia is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Jessia has been in this business for two years and also earns additional income from raising cattle.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elger is 20 years old and the eldest of five children in the family. His mother, Elena, a member of NWTF, supports the family by raising livestock in the Philippines.

Elger, studying for a Bachelor of Science in Criminology, is currently in the fourth year of this four-year course. Elena is borrowing PHP 7500 to help pay for his second semester tuition fees.

Elger plans to graduate and be gainfully employed.

loans.use: to pay for her son's tuition fees

loans.name: Adeluisa

texts.en:
Adeluisa is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Adeluisa is 45 years old and has one child in school. She has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

Adeluisa has requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. She has been in this business for five years. In the future, Adeluisa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Ritchelina

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Ritchelina works hard to support her family. She has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from frozen foods and raising livestock businesses. 

Ritchelina is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy more dried fish to sell. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Dúo Margarita De San Pedro Group

texts.es: Dúo Margarita de San Pedro, este grupo esta conformado por la señora Vilma de 23 años de edad, ella se ha dedicado a la confeccion de camisas desde hace varios años, en esta oportunidad ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de materia prima para la confeccion de camisas para vender, espera que le puedan ayudar con el credito solicitado.
texts.en:
The group "Dúo Margarita de San Pedro" was formed by Señora Vilma, who is 23 years old. She has been working in shirt-making for a number of years. At this time she is applying for this loan to purchase basic supplies to make shirts to sell.

She hopes that you can help her with the loan she has applied for.

loans.use: to buy basic supplies to make articles of clothing

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en: Francisca has a collection of ornamental garden plants. She finds pleasure in doing her gardening activities and earns for her family as well. As a microfinance member of PMPC, she has sought financial help to purchase a variety of ornamental plants that she can grow and sell. In the future, Francisca wishes to become the supplier of flowers in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of ornamental plants that she can grow and sell.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en: Francisco is a farmer focusing on rice farming activities and he is also engaged in livestock raising. Francisco became a full-fledged member of PMPC and enjoys the benefits of insurance and financial assistance. Recently, he applied for a loan to purchase bags of cement and floor tiles. Now, Francisco is on his way to finishing his house. He wishes to live comfortably with his family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cement and floor tiles

location.town: Oroquieta-San Vicente Bajo, Oroquieta City Misamis

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.en:
Rodolfo is 65 years old and lives in Molave, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. He is married with four adult-aged children. 

Rodolfo has been doing his farming activity for 20 years since his parents were alive. 

Rodolfo requested a loan to purchase farm inputs and pesticides for his field to produce more rice. 

He has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Rodolfo hopes to have his own rice milling machine.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and pesticides

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
Lucila tiene 48 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijos en el distrito de Pucará, una comunidad de clima caluroso, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, se encuentra ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, costa norte del Perú.

Ella brinda servicio de transporte público en su propia mototaxi, también realiza movilidad escolar trasladando a estudiantes a los colegios de su distrito, su esposo brinda servicio como jornalero agrícola. Cuenta con experiencia en el sector y con buenas referencias personales y laborales en su distrito. Ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de materiales como cemento y arena para realizar reparaciones y arreglos a su domicilio, con esto Lucila espera vivir más cómodamente lo que mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Lucila is 48 years old. She lives with her husband and children in the district of Pucará, a community with a hot climate. Its population works in agriculture, commerce, and livestock-raising. It is located in the province of Jaén, which belongs to the Cajamarca region on the northern coast of Peru.

She offers public transportation services in her own mototaxi. She also does school transport, carrying students to the schools of her district. Her husband offers services as an agricultural day-worker. She has experience in this area and has good personal and work references in her district. She has applied for a loan to purchase materials such as cement and sand in order to make repairs and arrangements in her home. With this, Lucila hopes to live more comfortably, which will improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to purchase materials such as cement and sand to make repairs and adjustments to her home

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 53 years old and married.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 40000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Elizabeth has borrowed and repaid twelve loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from farming rice and a tricycle passenger business.

Elizabeth aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Teojerma

texts.en:
Gervie is 21 years old and is first of three children in the family. Her mother, Teojerma, is a member of NWTF and supports the family through her general store business in the Philippines.

Gervie is studying for a Bachelor in Science in Agriculture and is currently in the 2nd of this 4-year course. Teojerma is borrowing PHP 8,000 to pay for tuition fees of her daughter, Gervie, for the second semester of the school year 2014-2015. Gervie plans to graduate and be gainfully employed.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees for her daughter.

loans.name: Salima

texts.ru: Это Салима. Она 47 летняя жительница района Шахритус. У нее не большая семья. Муж, сын и дочери. Старший сын женат. Муж находится на заработках в Российской Федерации, по причине что он не нашел себе подходящую работу в стране. Салима очень ответственная и трудолюбивая женщина. Она и муж стараются, чтобы зарабатывать и обеспечить семью.  Салима 5 лет назад начала заниматься выращиванием скота. Она ухаживает о животных у себя во дворе. Салима решила принимать кредит и за счет кредита она планирует купить скота для продвижение бизнеса. Она покупает скота и откармливает их несколько месяцев, потом вывозит перепродажу на скотном рынке. Животноводства является источником дохода, и доход от  этого бизнеса  обеспечивает семью. Она не хочет потерять источник дохода. По этой причине она обратилась за кредитом. Салима заранее выражает свою благодарность за Вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Meet Salima, a 47-year-old resident of the Shahrituz district of Tajikistan.  Salima's family is quite small, consisting of herself, her husband, a son and a daughter.  Her son, the eldest of her children, is married.  Her husband is currently working in Russia because he couldn't find a good job in Tajikistan.  Salima is a very responsible and hardworking woman.  She and her husband do everything they can to earn a living and provide for the family.  Five years ago, Salima got involved in animal husbandry and started to take care of animals at home.  

Salima has now decided to apply for a loan and to use it to buy additional cattle to expand her business.  She typically buys cattle, fattens her animals for a few months, and then resells them at the cattle market.  Animal husbandry is her source of income and, with the earnings from this business, she is able to provide for her family.  Salima doesn't want to lose her source of income, which is the reason for this loan.  She thanks you in advance for your support.

loans.use: to buy some cattle and keep her source of income.

loans.name: Mavjuda

texts.ru: Мавжуда 38 лет. Она проживает в районе Шахритус. У нее прекрасная семья. Муж и двое детей. Муж работает строительным мастером домов. Мавжуда 2 года своей жизни ведет торговую деятельность. Она решила заняться этой деятельностью, потому что ее брат тоже занимался именно  этим видом бизнеса. Брат научил ее правильно общаться с клиентами и вести данный бизнес. Мавжуда занимается продажей женской обуви.  Она решила расширить деятельность и увеличить товар. Мавжуда надеется с увеличением товара, она может привлечь себе больше клиентов. Из-за нехватки денежных средств она обратилась за кредитом. Это кредит поможет ей достичь своих целей.
texts.en: Mavjuda is 38 years old and she lives in the Shahrituz district of Tajikistan.  She has a beautiful family: a husband and two children.  Her husband works as a construction foreman.  Mavjuda herself has been involved in retail for the past two years of her life.  She chose this activity because her brother is in the same business.  He was able to teach her how to interact with customers and how to run this type of business.  Mavjuda now sells women's shoes.  She has now decided to expand her activity and increase her turnover.  She hopes that, by increasing her inventory, she will be able to attract more customers.  Since she doesn't have enough personal funds, she is taking a loan.  This loan will help her to achieve her goals.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of shoes in order to increase her turnover.

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en: Perlita is 48 years old and lives in Molave, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married with two school-age children. She loves doing her farming activity with her husband and has had this business for 19 years. She requested a loan to buy five sacks of fertilizers for a healthier yield. She has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Perlita wants to engage in another business for more income.

loans.use: to buy five sacks of fertilizers

loans.name: Norberta

texts.en: Norberta always has enthusiasm for farming. She has cultivated their rice land in Molave and has yielded good earnings doing this type of work. Recently, she applied for a loan to pay for land and seedbed preparations. This will ensure that the rice field is ready for planting. Norberta knows that she has to get things right to yield more income for this cropping season. In the future, Norberta hopes to buy a hauling truck for easy transport of produce.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparations

loans.name: Sweetheart

texts.en: Sweetheart is 24 years old and lives in Molave, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married with one infant son. She and her husband cultivate the rice field of her parents and have had this business for one year. She requested a loan to buy pesticides and two sacks of fertilizers. She is a new member of PMPC. In the future, Sweetheart hopes to provide the needs of her family, especially those of her son.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and two sacks of fertilizers

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma, a widow, makes a good living with every crop on her coconut farm in Aloran, Philippines. This is her means of supporting her family. 

Vilma was able to provide her children with a good education until they graduated and secured stable jobs. 

Vilma pawned her 2-hectare coconut farm land when her children entered college. Now, she wishes to pay for the reacquisition of her pawned coconut farm, for which she applied for an amount from PMPC. 

Vilma has high hopes that she will have a high yield on her farm next quarter.

loans.use: to pay for the reacquisition of her pawned coconut farmland

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy iron, metal, tools, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy basic grains, soft drinks, beverages, candies, etc., to stock her store

loans.name: Melca

texts.en:
Melca is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase more fruit to sell in her fruit stand for her fruit vending business.

Melca has been in this business for four years. Melca earns more income from food vending and pig fattening.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more fruit to sell at her fruit stand

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 42 years old and has six children. She is married and has three children who are currently in school.

Elizabeth is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Elizabeth has been in pig fattening for 20 years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Elizabeth would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 43 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Gina is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Gina has been farming sugarcane for six years and earns additional income from raising livestock.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Gankhuyag

texts.en:
Mr. Gankhuyag, who is 31 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 

Gankhuyag has been rendering a taxi service to local people since 2011. His wife is currently unemployed and stays at home, looking after their children. 

His family lives in a traditional Mongolian ger (a portable felt dwelling), which requires the constant burning of coal in order to stay warm. So, he is requesting a loan of $3,000 (USD) to buy building materials such as planks, cement, bricks and steel in order to build a house. 

During this period of time, the price of building materials is cheaper and storing them is a reasonable choice. 

The borrower is a very hardworking individual who cares deeply for his family.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as planks, cement, bricks and steel in order to start building a house

loans.name: Dúo Martina De San Pedro Group

texts.es: Dúo Martina de San Pedro Doña Martina es la encargada de este grupo, es vendedora de juguetes típicos en diferentes puntos del pueblo y mercados desde hace 25 años.  Los dos con su esposo iniciaron el negocio hace muchísimos años, y la gran satisfacción de ellos es que les han inculcado el mismo trabajo a sus hijos y han visto muy buenos resultados.  Son vendedores ambulantes por muchos años y están muy contentos por los proveedores que tienen.  Su sueño es seguir teniendo más compradores y hacer grandes entregas.  La fiesta del carnaval se acerca y tienen varios pedidos que entregar en diferentes mercados, el dinero que tienen no les alcanza y por tal motivo necesita un préstamo para comprar el material que les falta y no quedarles mal a sus compradores.
texts.en:
Doña Martina is in charge of the Dúo Martina de San Pedro group. She has been a seller of traditional toys at various places in the town and in the markets for 25 years. She and her husband began the business many years ago, and their great satisfaction is that they have taught the same work to their children and they have seen good results. They have been street vendors for many years and they are very happy because of the providers that they have.

Her dream is to continue having more customers and to make big deliveries. The carnival celebration is approaching, and they have various orders to deliver to different markets. The money that they have is not enough for them, and for that reason she needs a loan to purchase the material that they are lacking and to stay on good terms with their buyers.

loans.use: to buy materials to make traditional toys

loans.name: Enna Vilma

texts.es: Enna de 48 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus tres hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de cocos, su negocio está ubicado cerca de su lugar de residencia en una zona muy transitada, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas cocos por mayor para seguir con sus ventas y tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Enna, who is 48 years old, lives in her own house with her husband and their three children. She sells coconuts. Her business is located near her place of residence in a zone with a lot of traffic. With the earnings that she obtains from her sales, she manages to pay some of the household expenses. She is applying for a loan to purchase more coconuts wholesale in order to continue with her sales and have better earnings.

loans.use: to buy  more coconuts wholesale

loans.name: Jose Armando

texts.es: Jose de 52 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su nieto, el se dedica a la venta de artículos para el hogar de manera ambulante por las diferentes colonias y mercados tiene muchos clientes por la calidad de los productos, con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Jose está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas productos como: lámparas, rayadores, cuchillos, tostadores, etc. todo por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas y así tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en: 52 year-old Jose lives in his own house with his wife and grand-child. He makes a living selling household items as a street vendor in different neighbourhoods and markets. He has many customers because of the quality of his products, which is how he makes a profit and manages to cover some of his household costs. Jose is asking for a loan to bulk-buy more products such as: lamps, graters, knives, toasters, etc, in order to keep selling and thus make more of a profit.

loans.use: to bulk-buy more products, such as: lamps, graters, knives, toasters, etc.

loans.name: Maria Lidia

texts.es: Maria de 52 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de  tamales, vende de manera ambulante por las diferentes colonias y ya tiene muchos clientes, con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias logra salir adelante, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz, verduras, pollos, tomates entre otros ingredientes todos por mayor para poder continuar con su trabajo y así poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Maria, who is 52 years old, lives in her own house with her family group. She makes and sells tamales. She sells as a street vendor in the various neighborhoods, and she already has many customers. With what she obtains from her earnings, she manages to get ahead. 

She is applying for a loan for the purchase of corn, vegetables, chickens, and tomatoes, among other ingredients, all at wholesale, in order to be able to continue with her wok and be able to have better income.

loans.use: to buy corn, vegetables, chickens, and tomatoes, among other ingredients, all at wholesale

loans.name: Nigora

texts.ru: Это молодая девушка Нигора. Ей 25 лет. У нее трое детей. Дети еще маленькие. Она развелась с мужем. Детям 6 и 4 лет, младшей 6 месяцев. Нигора дома ведет домашнее хозяйство и одна воспитывает детей. Она занимается выращиванием скота. 3 года назад она начала заняться этой деятельностью, потому, что ее отец занимался животноводством. Нигора одна вседет животноводческую деятельность. Она хочет увеличить поголовье скота и дальше продвигаться.  Животноводческая деятельность является основной источником дохода, потому что доход от этого бизнеса обеспечивает детей.  Нигора просит кредит для купли скота. Запрашиваемый кредит поможет ей сохранит источник дохода и обеспечить детей. Нигоре очень нужно Ваша поддержка. Поддержите ее.
texts.en: This young woman's name is Nigora.  She is 25 years old and the mother of three young children.  She and her husband are divorced.  Her two older children are 6 and 4, the youngest is just 6 months old.  Nigora takes care of the household and raises her children alone.  She is also involved in animal husbandry, an activity she chose three years ago because her father is in the same business.  Nigora takes care of her farm animals by herself.  She currently wants to increase her livestock headcount and expand her activity because it is her main source of income and it allows her to provide for her children.  Nigora has requested a loan to buy livestock.  This loan will help her to keep her source of income and to support her children.  She really needs your help. Please support her.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Dorys

texts.es:
Dorys tiene 47 años de edad, es madre soltera, vive en casa familiar con su hija de 14 años en la parte rural del distrito de Pucará que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. La vida en este distrito se desarrolla tranquilamente y sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, crianza de animales y comercio.

La actividad que realiza es la elaboracion de tortas heladas, queques, entre otros postres, la elaboración la realiza en su domicilio y la venta por pedidos. Cuenta con experiencia en este negocio y con clientes fijos quienes dan muy buenas referencias de ella. El destino del crédito será para la compra de insumos para la elaboración de sus postres así como la compra de materiales de cocina para implementar su negocio. Con esto Dorys espera brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes lo que le va a permitir incrementar su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Dorys is 47 years old, and she is a single mother.
