She lives in a family home with her 14 year-old daughter in the rural part of the Pucará district that is located in the Jaén province of the Cajamarca region in the northern mountain range of Peru. Life in this district progresses calmly and its inhabitants work in agriculture, raising animals, and trade.

The occupation in which she works is the making of torta helada [gelatin dessert with cake filling], cakes, and other pastries. She makes these items in her home and sells them by order. She has experience in this business, and regular customers that give very good references for her. The use of the loan will be to buy ingredients to make her pastries as well as kitchen materials to carry out her business. With the loan, Dorys hopes to provide better service to her customers, which will allow her to increase her income level and ultimately will improve her quality of life, and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make her pastries as well as kitchen materials to carry out her business.

loans.name: Helaria

texts.en: Helaria has considerable preparations for the post-harvest operations of her palay in Dumingag. She wants to ensure that she will have ample time for the threshing, drying, storage and processing of her harvest to make way for another cropping season. She presented her proposal to Paglaum MPC and made a loan. Helaria hopes to see all of her children finish their degree and have stable careers.

loans.use: to pay for post-harvest operations

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en: Leonida is 56 years old and lives in Dumingag, Molave, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married with one adult-age child. She has enthusiasm for doing her farming activity and earning as well. She requested a loan to buy bags of fertilizers for more produce. She has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, Leonida wants to engage in selling clothes for another source of income.

loans.use: to buy bags of fertilizers

loans.name: Elvita

texts.en: Elvita is a flower vendor.  She is 57 years old and blessed with six children.  Her husband is a farmer who plants corn for their consumption.  Elvita has been engaged in selling flowers for six years doing this type of work with a monthly income of 3,000 PHP.  Elvita wants to engage in another type of business to add to her existing income.  She applied for a loan from Paglaum PMC of 4,000 PHP to buy one piglet and one sack of feed, as her starting capital for hog raising. Elvita dreams that someday she can supply the nearest flower shop in the village and at the same time, own a piggery.

loans.use: to buy one piglet and one sack of feed

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Gina is 42 years old and widowed with four beautiful children. She has a retailing business, buying and selling assorted kitchen and plastic wares. She has been in this business for five years. From this long experience of selling, she already has great knowledge in dealing with this kind of business. Even though there are many competitors in the town, Gina still gets more customers than the rest due to her good salesmanship and characteristic effort. Over the years, she has been successful and she manages to save more money for her family. Now, Gina is planning to manage a new business for additional income in the near future: a piggery. To fund this project, she needs additional capital to purchase additional bags of cement, hollow blocks, loads of sand and gravel for her piggery, so she has requested a loan from Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC).

loans.use: to purchase additional bags of cement, hollow blocks, loads of sand and gravel for her piggery

loans.name: Cheril

texts.en:
Cheril is 28 years old, married, and lives at Manla, Sapang Dalaga, Philippines. Part of their source of income comes from their “sari-sari” (mini-grocery) store. Her husband is a tricycle driver. 

Cheril joined Paglaum MPC just this year because of the benefits given to members. She has applied for 3,000 PHP to buy additional grocery items such as basic commodities to sell. 

Cheril looks forward to her sari-sari becoming a grocery store with a restaurant and video bar someday.

loans.use: to buy stock for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 42 years old and married with 11 children. With five children in school, Aida works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, groceries, etc.

Aida has been in this business for two years now. 

In the future, Aida would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, and groceries

loans.name: Louella

texts.en:
Louella is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell fruit business in the Philippines. 

Louella has been in this business for four years. Louella earns more income from pig fattening.

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy more fruit to sell for her buy and sell fruit business.

Louella has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. Her dream is to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase grains

loans.name: Parvina

texts.ru: Парвина жительница района Шахритус. Ей 33 лет. Она замужем мать троих детей. Детям 12, 4 и 3 лет. Парвина как многие жители района занимается сельскохозяйственной деятельностью. Этим видом деятельность она занятее более 4 лет. В работе на земле в основном помогает муж. Парвина имеет не большую часть земли, где она выращивает сельскохозяйственные культуры.  Она готовиться к посеву нового урожая и по этой причине она обратилась за кредитом. Сейчас главная ее цель купить минеральные удобрения и семян арбуза. Парвина надеется на Вашу помощь, и считает, что с Вашей помощью она сможет закончить посев.
texts.en: Parvina is a resident of the Shahrituz district of Tajikistan.  She is 33 years old, married, and the mother of three children.  Her children are 12, 4 and 3 years old.  Like many residents of her district, Parvina works in agriculture.  She got involved in this activity over four years ago.  Her husband is her main source of help on the farm.  Parvina owns a small plot of land on which she grows crops.  She is getting ready for the planting season, and for this reason, she has applied for a loan.  Her main goal, at the moment, is to buy mineral fertilizers and watermelon seeds.  She is hoping to receive your support and she believes that, thanks to your help, she will be able to sow her land, as planned.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers and watermelon seeds.

loans.name: Dúo Rosa De San Pedro Group

texts.es: Dúo Rosa de San Pedro La encargada de este grupo es la señora Rosa quien tiene una venta de ropa típica desde hace 5 años.  Es vendedora ambulante de diferentes lugares, cuenta con el apoyo incondicional de su esposo y el amor de sus hijos.  Su sueño es salir a delante y que cada dia el negocio siga creciendo, tener en el mercado central del país una venta de ropa típica variada como blusas, fajas, cortes, chalinas, güipiles hechos bolsos,  en diferentes precios y calidad y tener muchos clientes del extranjero. Tiene muchos pedidos de cortes, blusas y güipiles pero le hace falta dinero para comprar todo eso, por tal razón necesita un crédito para no quedarle mal a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Señora Rosa is in charge of the Duo Rosa de San Pedro group. She has had a business of selling traditional clothing for 5 years. She is a street vendor in various places. She has the unconditional support of her husband and the love of her children. Her dream is to get ahead and to have the business continue growing every day, and to have a sales stand for typical clothing in the central market of the country, with a variety [of items] such as blouses, sashes, lengths of fabric, shawls, huipiles [traditional blouses], and bags, of different prices and qualities, and to have many foreign customers. 

She has many orders for fabrics, blouses, and huipiles, but she doesn't have enough money to buy all these. For this reason, she needs a loan to stay on good terms with her customers.

loans.use: to buy traditional clothing to sell

loans.name: Julia Ynes

texts.es:
Julia tiene 43 años de edad, es madre soltera, vive en casa propia con su hijo en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Las actividades principales que se desarrollan en este distrito son la agricultura y comercio.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral como gallinas, patos, pavos, entre otros, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en la parte posteior a su domicilio. Realiza esta actividad desde hace 06 años y sus clientes dan muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de ella. Solicita préstamo para la compra de cerdos, cuyes, patos, gallinas, entre otros animales, para incrementar el stock de su negocio, el prestamo le ayudará a contar con mayor variedad de animales y de esta manera satifacer las necesidades de sus clientes lo que le generará mayores ingresos y por ende va a mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Julia is 43 years old, she is a single woman, and she lives in her own house with her son in a rural area in the Oyotún district, which is located in the Chiclayo province, in the Lambayeque region on the Northern coast of Peru. The main sources of business in this district are agriculture and trade.

She makes a living breeding and selling poultry, such as chickens, ducks, and turkeys, among others. Her business is located in the back of her home. She has been working for the last 6 years and her customers give her very good personal and professional references. She is asking for a loan to buy pigs, guinea-pigs, ducks, and chickens, among other animals, to increase her business' stock. The loan will help her to have a greater variety of animals, which will satisfy her customers' needs, and in turn will generate higher income; ultimately, it will improve her quality of life, and her family's.

loans.use: to buy pigs, guinea-pigs, ducks, and chickens, among other animals, to increase the stock in her business.

loans.name: Karla Maria

texts.es: Karla de 31 años de edad vive en casa propia con su madre, ella se dedica a la venta de detergentes y papel higiénico, su pequeño negocio lo tiene ubicado en el mercado municipal y tiene muchos clientes, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra salir adelante, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la  compra de mas productos por mayor y asi continuar con sus ventas para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: 31-year-old Karla lives in her own house with her mother. She makes a living by selling detergents and toilet paper. Her small business is located in the town market and she has many clients. She manages to get ahead in life with what she obtains from her sales. She is requesting a loan in order to buy more wholesale products and continue with her sales so she can have a better income.

loans.use: to buy detergents and toilet paper

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es: Ana de 35 años vive con su esposo, ella posee una panadería ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 6  años, tiene muchos clientes por la calidad con que elabora el pan, con las ganancias que obtiene logra salir adelante con las gastos del hogar, Ana está solicitando un crédito para la compra de harina, azúcar, jaleas de sabores, moldes, etc. Para poder seguir con su trabajo y así tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: 35 year-old Ana lives with her husband. She has owned a bakery located in her home for the last 6 years. She has many customers because of the quality involved in her bread-baking. She has been able to make ends meet with the household costs thanks to the money she makes. Ana is asking for a loan to buy flour, sugar, flavoured jellies, moulds, etc, in order to keep working and thus obtain better income for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, flavoured jellies, moulds, etc.

loans.name: Salima

texts.ru: Салиме 52 лет. Она замужем. У нее 6 детей. 3 сыновей и 3 дочери. Старший сын женат. Салима вместе с семьей проживает в районе Шахритус. Муж и сыновья занимаются животноводством. Салима работает медсестрой в больнице. Она свободное время занимается земледелием. Салима хорошо справляется обеими деятельностями. Земледелием она занята уже 8 лет. Ей в работе помогает старший сын и невестка. У нее дружная семья. Они помогают друг другу в работе. Салима каждый год сажает овощи. В этом году она хочет сажать картофель и собрать богатый урожай, по этой причине она обратилась за кредитом, чтобы  купить качественные семена картофеля. В дальнейшем Салима планирует расширить деятельность.
texts.en: Salima is 52 years old, married, and she has had six children (three sons and three daughters).  Her oldest son is married.  Salima and her family live in the Shahrituz district.  Her husband and sons raise livestock.  Salima herself works as a nurse in a hospital.  In her spare time, she also grows crops. Salima has no difficulty being involved in two activities: she got involved in agriculture eight years ago already.  Salima's family is very friendly; everyone helps everyone else.  Salima plants potatoes every year.  This year again she will be planting potatoes and she wants to get a good harvest.  For this reason, she is taking a loan which will help her to buy high-quality potato seeds.  In the future, she would like to expand her activity.

loans.use: to buy high quality potato seeds.

loans.name: Umoja Group

texts.fr: Maman Vumilia est  âgée de 46 ans, mariée, mère de 10 enfants tous scolarisés et presidente de l’association de crédit Umoja. Elle est vendeuse des divers articles de consommation  grâce au fonds de roulement obtenu de son mari. Elle vient solliciter un nouveau crédit qui lui permettra d’acquérir 60 sachets des différentes sorte de jus, 40 cartons d’eau vive et sachets de mayonnaise. Le fruit de cette activité sera orienté au  payement des frais scolaires des enfants et au renforcement du chiffre d’affaire. Elle remercie Hekima pour son appui.
texts.en:
Maman Vumilia is 46 years old and a married mother of ten children, all provided with schooling. She is the president of the loan association Umoja and a vendor of various consumer goods, thanks to the working capital from her husband. 

She is here to request a new loan enabling her to acquire 60 pouches of different types of juice drinks, 40 boxes of fresh water, and pouches of mayonnaise. The results from this business will be for paying the children’s school fees and for improving her turnover. She thanks Hekima for its support.

loans.use: to acquire 60 pouches of different types of juice drinks, 40 boxes of fresh water, and pouches of mayonnaise

loans.name: Buyunvikane Group

texts.fr: Madame Bahati  est  présidente du groupe de credit Buyunvikane. Elle est âgée de 45 ans, mariée à un travailleur de l’Etat Congolais et  ensemble ils  ont  12 enfants  qui étudient tous. Commerçante depuis 2009 au marché central de la ville, elle vend les draps de lit de seconde main.  Le nouveau prêt sollicité va lui permettre d’acheter  2 ballots de draps.  Son objectif majeur dans la vie est de prospérer dans ses affaires pour ainsi offrir une très bonne vie à sa progéniture. Ainsi, elle remercie et encourage Hekima dans son initiative de booster les activités commerciales des femmes à faible revenu.
texts.en:
Ms. Bahati is the president of the loan group Buyunvikane. She is 45 years old and married to a worker in the Congolese government. Together they have twelve children, who are all students. A merchant since 2009 at the town’s central market, Ms. Bahati sells secondhand bed sheets. The new loan requested is going to enable her to purchase 2 bales of bed sheets. 

Her main goal in life is to prosper in business and thus offer a very good life to her children. So, she thanks and encourages Hekima in its initiative to boost the commercial businesses of low-income women.

loans.use: to purchase 2 bales of bed sheets

loans.name: Dúo El Campo De Alotenango Group

texts.es: Dúo el Campo de Alotenango está integrado por doña Raquel de 26 años y tiene 2 hijos uno de 11 y de 5 años posee una línea de moto taxi hace mas de 8 años ella solicita su crédito para la compra de mototaxi y para la reparación de su moto taxi ya que necesita darle reparación pero no cuenta con suficiente efectivo para invertir ya que es importante para ella dar seguridad a sus clientes a la hora de trasportarlos su mayor anhelo es poder tener una gran línea de servicios de taxis ya que es de gran ayuda para ella y su familia.
texts.en: Dúo el Campo de Alotenango is composed of Raquel, 26. She has 2 children, ages 11 and 5. She has had a motorcycle taxi line for more than 8 years. She is requesting a loan to buy a motorcycle taxi and to repair her motorcycle taxi since it needs repairs but she doesn't have sufficient cash for it. It is important to her to provide security to her customers when transporting them. Her greatest wish is to be able to have a great taxi service line since it is of great help to her and her family.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Dúo Marta De San Pedro Group

texts.es: Dúo Marta de San Pedro La encargada de este grupo es la señora Marta quien se dedica a la venta de ropa típica desde hace 10 años, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo y tiene dos hijas aun pequeñas.  Es vendedora ambulante y le gustan mucho las ventas.  Su sueño es llegar a tener un puesto en el mercado del pueblo con mucha ropa típica como güipiles, cortes, blusas, perrajes, fajas todas típicas a los mejores precios para ya no ser vendedora ambulante.  Nos cuenta que se aproxima la fiesta del carnaval en el pueblo y es cuando ella aprovecha en ponerse en el mercado del pueblo porque les dan permiso a muchas vendedoras, pero le hacen falta algunos cortes típicos valorados en Q. 900.00 c/u y el dinero que tiene no le alcanza por tal motivo necesita hacer un préstamo.
texts.en:
The leader of this group is Marta, who has worked in the sale of traditional clothing for 10 years. She has the support of her husband, and she has 2 daughters that are still little. She is a traveling salesman, and she really likes sales. Her dream is to come to have her own stall in the city market with lots of traditional clothing like woven blouses and skirts, shirts, shawls and belts; all traditional, and at the best prices in order to no longer be a traveling salesman.

She mentions that the celebration of Carnival is approaching in the city, and this is when she takes advantage of the opportunity to be in the city market because they give permission to many salesman. She is lacking some traditional skirts that are valued at GTQ 900.00 each, and she does not have enough money. For this reason she is requesting a loan.

loans.use: to buy traditional clothing to sell.

loans.name: Analie

texts.en:
Analie is 36 years old and lives in Mahayag, Molave, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married with two school-age children. She is a farmer who wants start raising pigs.

Analie has requested a loan to buy five piglets, feed, and build a concrete pen to start the business. She has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, she wants to raise healthy pigs to earn money for her family.

loans.use: to buy piglets, feed, and build a pig pen.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy food to prepare lunches.

loans.name: Jorgia

texts.en:
Jorgia is from Ozamiz City, Philippines. She is a widow and has four adult-age children. 

In 2010, Jorgia joined PMPC. She appreciates the programs and services of the Coop. The Coop supported her by providing the capital to start her sari-sari (small grocery) business, helping the family survive. Fortunately, her store is located in a populous neighborhood, so she makes promising sales every day. Jorgia keeps on running the business well, even though there is increased competition from other stores. She believes that with the support of her family, they will keep going and beat the competition. 

Jorgia wishes to have a safe and comfortable life, with a house of durable ceilings and walls. She has applied for a loan of 21,000 PHP to buy construction materials for the renovation of her house. 

Jorgia wants nothing more than to live a happy and healthy life with her family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for the renovation of her house.

loans.name: Aksanti Group

texts.fr: La cliente Feza est une femme ambitieuse et dirigeante du groupe Aksanti. Agée de 59ans, elle est mariée à un homme sans emploie et mère de 6 enfants qui étudient tous. Elle débuta ses activités depuis 1975 avec l’appui de son époux. Aujourd’hui, elle sollicite un prêt pour  lui permettre d’acheter 10 bassins en plastic, 5 jeux d’assiette en porcelaine et 4 douzaines de gobelet en plastic.  Son objectif  est celui d’étendre ses activités  et appuyer financièrement la scolarité de ses enfants jusqu’au niveau universitaire. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour la promotion des  femmes à faible revenu
texts.en:
This client, Feza, is an ambitious woman and the director of the group Aksanti. She is 59 years old and married to an unemployed man, and she is the mother of six children, who are all students. She began her business in 1975 with support from her husband. 

Today, she is requesting a loan enabling her to purchase 10 plastic tubs, 5 sets of porcelain plates, and 4 dozen plastic cups. Her goal is to expand her business and financially support her children’s schooling through the university level. So, she thanks Hekima for promoting low-income women.

loans.use: to purchase 10 plastic tubs, 5 sets of porcelain plates, and 4 dozen plastic cups

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa tiene 39 años de edad, es soltera, vive con su familia en el distrito de Oyotún en una zona rural que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. La vida en la comunidad es tranquila, los pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Ella se dedica a brindar los servicios de crianza y venta de animales como cerdos, gallinas, patos, entre otros, se dedica a esta actividad desde hace más de 3 años y cuenta con buenas referencias por parte de sus vecinos. El crédito será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales así como para realizar reparaciones y mantenimiento del lugar donde los cría. Con esto Teresa espera ofrecer una mayor variedad de animales a sus clientes lo que le va a generar mayores ingresos y por ende va a mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Teresa is 39 years old. She is single and lives with her family in the district of Oyotún, which is a rural area located in the province of Chiclayo in the region of Lambayeque on the north coast of Peru. Life in the community is peaceful; the people make a living from agriculture, raising livestock, and trade.

Teresa makes a living by raising and selling animals, such as pigs, hens, and ducks. She has been doing this work for more than three years and she has good references from her neighbours. The loan will be used to buy more animals, as well as to make repairs to, and maintain, the place where she raises her animals. Teresa hopes to offer a greater variety of animals to her clients, which will generate greater earnings for her and result in her family’s quality of life being improved.

loans.use: to buy more animals, as well as to repair and maintain the place where she raises her animals

loans.name: Jiong

texts.en:
Jiong finds pleasure in doing her gardening activities. Not only is she doing her hobby, she earns an income as well. At the age of 37 and married, she busies herself to sufficiently provide for the family. 

She grabbed the opportunity to become a full pledge member of PMPC. She gives credit to the cooperative for supporting her gardening activities. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase gardening tools and fertilizers. 

In the future, Jiong wishes to become the supplier of flowers in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase gardening tools and fertilizers.

loans.name: Eltrudes

texts.en:
Eltrudes is juggling a business and supervising the renovation of her home. With the aid of her 13,000 PHP loan,  Eltrudes hopes to live comfortably in a house with a good roof. 

She hopes to maintain her membership in good standing with a good repayment record. It matters that Eltrudes has been given a priority as a Microfinance member of PMPC. This is what she is thankful for as all her financing needs for her retailing business where supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to buy materials for her home renovation.

loans.name: Noneta

texts.en:
Noneta is a 34-year old married woman with two children, one of whom is currently in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur with a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years. 

Noneta requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase a fishing net, fish containers, gasoline, and other supplies for her business. She would like to expand her business and help secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase materials and supplies.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina, 39, is a married woman with four children who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Cristina has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 12 years. Cristina requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

In the future, Cristina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Byambadonid

texts.en:
Mr. Byambadonid, 24 years old, lives with his mother, two brothers and an uncle in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 

He has been working as an electrician at a power plant since 2012. His mother began running a grocery store in 2013. His uncle works as an accountant at a private firm. 

Byambadonid is requesting a loan of 2,000 USD to buy food items in large quantities in order to increase the working capital of his mother's business. The income from the grocery store greatly contributes to his family's well being and he wants to support his mother's business.

loans.use: to buy food items in large quantity.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en: Alicia has a collection of ornamental garden plants. She finds pleasure in gardening activities and earning money for her family. As a member of PMPC, she is seeking financial help to buy a variety of ornamental plants she can grow and sell. In the future, Alicia hopes to become a supplier of flowers to neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase ornamental plants to grow and sell.

loans.name: Ana Riza

texts.en:
Ana Riza is 28 years old, married, and has three children who attend school. She works very hard to provide for them, running a general store. She has been in this business for two years. 

Ana has requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy stock items to sell, such as candies, canned goods, groceries, and more. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is 64 years old, married, and has seven children. She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines, which she has been doing for five years. She earns additional income from a general store.

Valentina has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream, to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other supplies.

loans.name: Jeanalyn

texts.en:
Jeanalyn works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Jeanalyn is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase spare parts and gasoline for her motorcycle transport business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. Jeanalyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and gasoline for her motorcycle.

loans.name: Michael Group

texts.fr: Shamavu est commerçante, présidente de la banque communautaire «Michael», âgée de 32 ans, mariée à un commerçant, mère de 6 enfants dont 4 étudient et 2 sont gosses. Elle est vendeuse du carburant sur la route principale du centre ville depuis 8 ans et après elle sollicita un prêt à l’IMF Hekima. Elle va acheter 200 litres d’essence pour accroitre son activité. Elle commença avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite continuer à scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux petits entrepreneurs non bancables. Il sied de signaler que certaines clientes portent leurs bébés.
texts.en:
Shamavu is a merchant and the president of the community bank “Michael”. She is 32 years old, married to a merchant, and the mother of six children (4 students and 2 young ones). She has been selling fuels on the main road downtown for eight years. She has requested a loan from the microfinance institution Hekima. She is going to purchase 200 liters of gasoline to grow her business. She began with funds from her husband. 

For the future, she would like to continue to provide schooling and food for her children. So, she thanks Hekima for its support for unbanked small-scale entrepreneurs. It should be noted that certain clients are carrying their babies.

loans.use: to purchase 200 liters of gasoline

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 61 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Edna has been farming rice for 30 years and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Edna is borrowing 5,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Jibu Group

texts.fr: La cliente Kitumaini est présidente du groupe Jibu à l'âgée de 49 ans. Elle est mariée à un enseignant  et  mère de 8 enfants  tous scolarisés. Expérimentée dans  la  vente d’arachide, elle sollicite un nouveau prêt pour acheter ½ sac d’arachide. Son objectif  est de réhabiliter Sa maison et prospérer dans ses affaires. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima  de soutenir les femmes exclues du système bancaire classique.
texts.en: This client, Kitumaini, is the president of the group Jibu. She is 49 years old and married to a teacher, and she is the mother of eight children, all provided with schooling. Experienced at selling peanuts, she is requesting a new loan to purchase a half-sack of peanuts. Her goal is to renovate her house and to prosper in her business. In conclusion, she thanks Hekima for supporting women excluded from the classic banking system.

loans.use: to purchase ½ sack of peanuts

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is 46 years old and lives in Dumingag, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is separated with 2 school age children. She is a hardworking mother and loves farming. 

In order to support the studies of her children, she requested to buy 2 sacks of fertilizers and farming tools like a rutter to give her farming activity a big boost. She has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. 

In the future, Rosa wants to be successful in her business so she can always provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy 2 sacks of fertilizers and farming tools.

loans.name: Agnès

texts.fr: Agnès est une femme mariée de 34 ans et très entreprenante. Agnès vit à Sagbado avec son enfant. Agnès travaille activement pour la bonne éducation. Pour cela elle vend des produits de beauté dans son quartier pour trouver le revenu leur permettant de couvrir les charges quotidiennes. Agnès s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au grand marché de Lomé. Pour commander des produits répondant mieux à la volonté de ses clients, Agnès demande ce crédit pour financer son activité et réaliser plus de profits pour élever ses enfants.
texts.en: Agnès is a married woman, 34 years old, and very entrepreneurial. She lives in Sagbado with her child and actively works for the right education. To do so, she sells beauty products in her district to earn the revenues enabling them to cover day-to-day expenses. Agnès gets her supplies twice a month at the big market of Lomé. To order the products that better respond to her customers’ wishes, she is asking for this loan to finance her business and to make more profit for raising her children.

loans.use: to purchase 7 dozen of ointments

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a widow. She is known in her neighborhood area as being a hard working mother. 

She has a sari-sari (small grocery) store business. She became a member of PMPC and is actively participating in the various programs and services that the Coop offers. She hopes to live comfortably, with a decent house and has applied for a loan of 32,000 PHP to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks. 

She hopes to maintain her membership in good-standing, with a good repayment record. It matters that she has been given priority as a regular member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). This is what she is thankful for, when all her financing needs are supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks to repair her house.

loans.name: Eya

texts.fr: Agée de 34 ans, Eya est une femme veuve qui vit avec ses quatre enfants à Sagbado. Pour avoir un niveau de vie favorable et couvrir au minimum les charges de ses enfants, Eya vend des pommades de beauté et de lotions. Cette activité lui génère un bénéfice qui est loin de palier à sa situation de précarité. Eya s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au grand marché de Lomé pour. Eya demande ce prêt pour acheter de nouvelles pommades à vendre aux femmes particulièrement pour s’embellir et réaliser plus de bénéfice.
texts.en: Eya, aged 34, is a widow who lives with her four children in Sagbado. For better living conditions and to cover the children’s expenses at the least, Eya sells beauty ointments and lotions. This business generates for her a profit which is far from alleviating her precarious situation. Eya gets her supplies twice a month at the big market of Lomé. She is asking for this loan to purchase new ointments to sell to women in particular for beauty purposes and for making more profit.

loans.use: to purchase 18 boxes of  ointments

loans.name: Nerwaya Group

texts.fr: Le groupe Nerwaya travaille avec ACFIME depuis 2011 et regroupe des femmes consciencieuses qui se battent pour le bien être de leurs familles. En effet, Haoua est la responsable de ce groupe, elle est mariée et mère de 7 enfants dont 4 sont scolarisés, 1 travaille et 1 est commerçant. Cette brave dame fait le commerce des pagnes et elle a besoin de ce crédit pour acheter plus de pagne pour vendre. A l’aide de son commerce, elle arrive à aider son époux qui est aussi commerçant à gérer leur famille. Après les ventes, elle aura un bénéfice qui lui permettra de continuer son activité mais aussi de prendre en charges certaines dépenses comme les frais de santé, l'habillements de ses enfants, etc.
texts.en: The Nerwaya group has been working with ACFIME since 2011. The group is composed of dedicated women who work hard for the well-being of their families. Haoua is the group leader. She is married and has seven children, four of whom are still in school, one works and one is an entrepreneur. This resilient woman sells traditional colorful "pagnes" fabric and needs this loan to restock on fabric for resale. Thanks to her business, she helps her husband, who is also a vendor, to support their family. After selling her merchandise, she will have a revenue allowing her to continue her business and also take care of certain expenses, for example related to the healthcare costs and clothing for her children.

loans.use: to buy traditional fabric for resale.

loans.name: Pyalo

texts.fr: Pyalo est une femme mariée de 39 ans très dynamique qui a un seul enfant. Pyalo vit à Attiégou et exerce un commerce de vente de pagnes traditionnels. Elle se déplace au Nord du Togo pour trouver les pagnes de qualités et avoir un revenu favorable pour l’éducation de ses enfants. Pyalo s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au Marché de Cinkassé. Pour commander de nouveaux pagnes, Pyalo demande ce crédit pour financer son achat. Pyalo souhaite apprendre à fabriquer elle-même les pagnes et développer son activité dans toute la région.
texts.en: Pyalo is a 39-year-old married woman who is very energetic. She has one child. Pyalo lives in Attiégou and works in commerce selling traditional 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa). She travels in northern Togo to find quality ‘pagne’ cloth and to obtain the revenues for providing education for her [child]. She gets her supplies three times a month at the Cinkassé Market. To order new ‘pagne’, Pyalo is asking for this loan to finance her purchase. She would like to learn how to make ‘pagne’ cloth herself and to develop her business throughout the region.

loans.use: to purchase 25 units of 'pagne' cloth

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to maintain the land where he feeds his livestock.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Agée de 34 ans, Afi est une femme mariée qui vit avec ses trois enfants à Kleve. Pour faciliter  les  dépenses quotidiennes à son mari, Afi s’intéresse à la vente des pommades et lotions. Son commerce satisfait majoritairement les femmes qui achètent ses produits de beauté pour embellir leur peau. Afi s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au grand marché de Lomé. Dans le but de disposer d’un local afin d’agrandir ses prestations, Afi demande ce crédit pour atteindre ses objectifs et pourvoir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Afi, aged 34, is a married woman who lives with her three children in Kleve. To help her husband with day-to-day expenses, she became interested in selling ointments and lotions. Her business has been satisfying for the most part the women who bought her products for beautiful skin. Afi gets her supplies three times a month at the big market of Lomé. With the goal of obtaining a spot to expand her display of goods, Afi is asking for this loan to achieve her goals and to meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase 15 of carowhite ointments and 15 of Cocoderme ointments

loans.name: David

texts.es:
David tiene 32 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, tiene 2 hijos, vive con su familia en el distrito de La Florida en una zona rural que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de San Miguel, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. La vida en la comunidad es tranquila y los pobladores se dedican principalmente a la agricultura y comercio.

El se dedica a brindar los servicios de plantación y venta de guayaquil contando con herramientas propias de trabajo, con más de 5 años de experiencia en el negocio y con buenas referencias personales y laborales por parte de los pobladores de su distrito. Solicita préstamo para la compra de más semillas de plantación de guayaquil para incrementar el tamaño de su cultivo así como para la compra de abono y fertilizantes, con esto David espera ofrecer un producto de mejor calidad a sus clientes lo que le va a a permitir incrementar sus ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
David is 32 years old, married, has two children, lives with his family in the La Florida district in a rural area located in the San Miguel province, Cajamarca region, in the northern mountains of Perú. Life in the community is tranquil and the inhabitants make a living primarily through agriculture and commerce.

He makes a living offering planting services and selling guayaquil, using his own work tools, with more than 5 years of experience in the business and with good personal and work references from the inhabitants in his district. 

He is asking for a loan to buy more guayaquil seeds to plant and increase the size of his crops as well as to buy manure and fertilizers. With this, David hopes to offer a better quality product to his customers, which will allow him to increase his income and through that he will improve the quality of his life and that of his family.

loans.use: To buy more guayaquil seeds to increase the size of his crops as well as to buy manure and fertilizers

loans.name: Amor Y Paz Group

texts.es: Amor y Paz nombre con el que se identifica el grupo al que pertenecen tres mujeres que lo único que quieren es salir de la pobreza para ofrecer mejores condiciones de vida a su familia, con tal intensión deciden solicitar por octava ocasión el financiamiento en ADIM y así invertir en sus negocios, la coordinadora es Yessica una joven mujer de 24 años de edad, y que a sus catorce años aprendió lo que era trabajar en el negocio de venta de leña y verduras y tortilla, es una mujer que realiza varias actividades para obtener más ingresos y así aportar a los gastos familiares, ya que los créditos anteriores le han permitido incrementar los productos ofrecidos y este crédito lo solicita para la compra de quintal de maíz y flete de leña. Las otras integrantes son, Rebeca de 25 años quien vende cosa de horno (derivado del maíz) y vende en las calles de uno de los departamentos del país, y Doña Julia quien aporta al grupo la experiencia de una larga vida dedicada al trabajo y a las responsabilidades que toda mujer posee, ella vende cosa de horno en su domicilio y en el departamento de Masaya. Estas tres mujeres tienen bien claro que el éxito se encuentra en el trabajo y en invertir en un negocio bien organizado.
texts.en:
Amor y Paz [Love and Peace] is the name of the group to which three women belong; the only thing they want is to get out of poverty in order to offer better living conditions to their families. With that intention, they decide to ask, for the eighth time, for financing from ADIM and in that way invest in their businesses. 

The coordinator is Yessica, a young 24-year-old woman who, at 14 years old, learned what it was like to work in the business of selling firewood and vegetables and tortillas. She is a woman who works various jobs to obtain more income and in that way contribute to paying for her family's expenses. Since the previous loan allowed her to increase the products she offered, she is asking for this loan to buy 100 pounds of corn and a load of firewood. 

The other members are Rebeca, who is 25 years old, who sells cosa de horno (derived from corn) and sells on the streets in one of the country's provinces. And Julia brings to the group experience from a long life dedicated to work and the responsibilities which all women possess. She sells cosa de horno in her home and in the Masaya province. These three women are very certain that success is found in work and in investing in a well-organized business.

loans.use: To buy 100 pounds of corn and a load of firewood

loans.name: Dúo La Moderna Ll Group

texts.es: Dúo la Moderna ll La señora Gladys Amanda de 62 años de edad madre de 2 hijos es propietaria  de una farmacia  ubicado en la colonia el frutal ella tiene 5 años de administrarla  ella le gusta ayudar a las personas.  Dentro de la historia que ella cuenta tiene sueños y metas muy grandes ella quiere que su negocio crezca un poco más para poder ayudar a los demás y brindarle un buen servicio a las personas y apoyar a sus hijos y nietos, esta solicitando este credito para la compra de medicina para surtir mas su farmacia.
texts.en:
Gladys Amanda is 62 years old, mother of two children, and the owner of a pharmacy located in the El Frutal community. She has been managing it for five years. She likes to help people. 

Within the story she tells, she has very big dreams and goals; she wants her business to grow a bit more to be able to help others and offer a good service to people and support her children and grandchildren. She is asking for this loan to buy medicine to stock her pharmacy.

loans.use: To buy medicines for the pharmacy

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 54 years old and married with 11 children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Erlinda is borrowing 6,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Erlinda has been raising pigs for one year and also earns additional income from vegetable vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Anna Lee

texts.en:
Anna Lee is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Anna Lee is 36 years old, and three of her children are currently in school.

Anna Lee has a rice selling business in the Philippines. Anna Lee requested a 15,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Anna Lee has been in this business for four years. In the future, Anna Lee would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Retchelda

texts.en:
Retchelda is 58 years old and married with four children.

Retchelda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like shampoo, canned goods, noodles, coffee, milk, sugar, etc.

Retchelda has borrowed and paid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 13 years and also earns an income from personal collection.

Retchelda aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like shampoo, canned goods, noodles, coffee, milk, sugar, etc

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz is 60 years old and married with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Beatriz has a tailoring business in the Philippines. Beatriz requested a 10,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials like fabric, threads, needles, etc., for her business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Beatriz has been in this business for six years. Beatriz would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like fabric, threads, needles, etc., for her business

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 51 years old and married with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Cecilia has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Cecilia requested a 15,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, spices, vegetables, fish, etc., for her food-production business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Cecilia has been in this business for six years. Cecilia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, spices, vegetables, fish, etc. for her food-production business

loans.name: Gerly

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Gerly works hard to support her family.

She has a barber shop business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from direct selling personal products. Gerly is borrowing 7,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase combs and other materials needed for her barber shop business.

Gerly has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase combs and other materials needed for her business

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 40 years old and single with four children.

She earns a living in the Philippines. Marilou is borrowing 14,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Marilou has been in this business for seven years and also earns additional income from fishing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to  save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 40 years old and has six children. Imelda is married, and four of her children are in school.

Imelda is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Imelda requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Imelda has been raising pigs for six years now, and has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Imelda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Emilda

texts.en:
Emilda is 45 years old and has six children. Emilda is married, and two of her children are in school.

Emilda is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Emilda requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Emilda has been in this business for eight years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Isabel is 40 years old, and one of her children is in school.

Isabel has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Isabel requested a 5,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-production business.

Isabel has been in this business for six years. In the future, Isabel would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-production business

loans.name: José Orlando

texts.es:
José, de 25 años de edad, no tiene ningún grado de estudio, pero se caracteriza por sus habilidades desarrolladas a través del tiempo en trabajos de mecánica automotriz y cobrador de buses, está soltero, vive en una vivienda alquilada, cerca de su trabajo, vive con dos amigos, con los cuales dividen los gastos.

Desde muy pequeño sus aspiraciones eran trabajos de mecánica, pero su familia no disponía de recursos para poder ayudarle a implementar su propio negocio, es por eso que junto a sus amigos buscaron una alternativa que les pudiese generar algún ingreso, dedicándose primeramente a trabajos de ayudante en buses para luego ser cobrador de unidades de transporte. Para realizar su trabajo tiene que viajar a diario y muy temprano para empezar sus labores que hace de lunes a sábado con horarios de 5 am a 7 pm.

Él necesita el crédito para comprar una motocicleta que un amigo le vende a un precio aceptable, acudiendo a una financiera para que le otorgue el crédito. Esto lo beneficiara en muchos aspectos ya que para cualquier situación se le hace necesario tener su propio transporte y mas aun cuando se le presente trabajo de mecánica en otro lugar. 	


Nunca pierde las esperanzas de superación ya que con esfuerzo ha logrado salir de muchas necesidades que se le han presentado en mas de una ocasión.
texts.en:
José, who is 25 years old, has not finished any grades of school, but he is characterized by his abilities developed during his time working as a car mechanic and a bus driver. He is single, and lives in a rented home close to his work. He lives with two friends, with whom he divides expenses.

Since he was very young, his aspirations were to work in mechanics, but his family did not have resources to be able to help him to start his own business. It is for that reason that he and his friends looked for an alternative that would allow them to earn some income. At first they made a living as bus assistants to later be drivers of transportation units. To do his work, he needs to travel daily and very early to start his work that he does Monday through Saturday with a schedule from 5am to 7pm. 

He needs a loan to buy a motorcycle that his friend is selling him at an acceptable price, turning to a financier who will give him a loan. This will benefit him in many ways, since for any situation it is necessary for him to have his own transportation, even more so when there is mechanic work in another location.	

He never loses his hopes of getting ahead now that he, with effort, he has succeeded in meeting many needs that have presented themselves on more than one occasion.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle that a friend is selling him at an acceptable price

loans.name: Josefina Damaris

texts.es: Josefina de 45 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar conformado por su esposo y sus do hijas, ella se dedica a la pesca artesanal desde hace 10 años, experiencia que le ha dado la oportunidad de vender una buena calidad de producto, por esa razón posee clientes fijos, Josefina está solicitando un crédito ya que necesita comprar las herramientas necesarias para continuar con su trabajo como: trasmallos, redes y darle mantenimiento a la lancha que muestra en la fotografía ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y de ingresos y asi ella podrá tener junto con su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Josefina is 45 years old, she lives in her own house with her familial group, comprised of her husband and their two daughters. She has made a living off of small-scale fishing for ten years; experience which has given her the opportunity to sell a good quality product. For that reason she has regular customers.  

Josefina is asking for a loan since she needs to buy the necessary tools to continue her work, like: trammel nets, nets, and to perform maintenance on the boat shown in the photograph, since it is her only source of income and in that way she can have, with her family, a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy trammel nets, nets, and to perform maintenance on the boat

loans.name: El Lucero De Diriá Group

texts.es: Tres mujeres y un varón tomaron la iniciativa de unirse para formar un grupo al que nombraron “El Lucero de Diriá”, estas personas que viven en la misma comunidad, comparten necesidades y valores similares, ya que poseen negocios y ganas de trabajar pero necesitan invertir más capital en sus negocios, para eso enfocaron sus metas y decidieron tomar la acción de trabajar juntos y guiados por Rosa, una mujer de 29 años que ayuda a su compañero de vida para suministrar el mantenimiento de su hogar, esto mediante el negocio que posee de venta de fritanga y nacatamales, ella sale a vender de forma ambulante en su comunidad desde hace doce años, este financiamiento lo solicita para invertir en maíz, carne de cerdo, arroz, chiltoma, cebolla, ajo, hojas de chagüite, etc. los otros integrantes son, María de 32 años de edad, que vende tamales un producto elaborado del maíz y también comercializa enchiladas en su comunidad desde hace tres años, Kenia una joven de 23 años pero que a su corta edad emprendió sus pasos hacia el comercio y lo que es la venta de tamales en su comunidad, y José un hombre de 28 años quien se traslada de su comunidad hacia el departamento de Rivas a vender verduras de manera ambulante desde hace cinco años. Estas personas con vidas similares quieren seguir luchando hasta alcanzar sus metas, las cuales son ofrecer lo mejor a sus familias.
texts.en:
Three women and one man took the initiative to come together to form a group that they named “El Lucero de Diriá.” These people, who live in the same community, share similar needs and values since they have businesses and the desire to work, but need to invest more capital in their businesses. That is why they focused on their goals and decided to take action by working together. 

Rosa, a 29-year-old woman who helps her husband maintain their home through her business of selling fried foods and nacatamales, leads the group. She has gone out to sell on the street in her community for 12 years. She requests this funding to invest in corn, pork, rice, sweet pepper, onion, garlic, banana leaves, etc.

The other members are María, 32 years old, who sells tamales, a product made of corn, and who has also sold enchiladas in her community for three years; Kenia, a young 23-year-old woman, who at a young age set out on her path toward business and sells tamales in her community; and José, a 28-year-old man who has traveled from his community to the department of Rivas to sell vegetables on the street for five years.

These people with similar lives want to continue fighting until they reach their goals, which are to offer the best to their families.

loans.use: to buy corn, pork, rice, sweet pepper, onion, garlic, banana leaves, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a larger amount of merchandise to stock her business

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en: In 2014, Narcisa applied for membership in PMPC after she learned about the benefits offered by the Co-op to the members. Narcisa is married and has a school age daughter; her husband is a farmer and they live in Villaflor, Oroquieta. Narcisa is an ordinary minimum wage earner employee for a private company, supporting the daily needs of her family. She is a persevering mother who wants nothing more but to see her only daughter holding her diploma and with a stable job. Narcisa is in need of financial assistance; she requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to pay for her daughter's medication. Someday, she hopes to build a concrete house for the family.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's medication

loans.name: Francisco De Los Angeles

texts.es: Francisco de 63 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa quien es comerciante, el se dedica a la venta de medicina natural desde hace 5 años, vende de manera ambulante por las colonias y pueblos aledaños, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas y con la ayuda de su esposa pueden salir adelante, Francisco esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas medicina natural por mayor y asi poder continuar con sus ventas para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Francisco is 63 years old; he lives in his own home with his wife, who is a shopkeeper.  He has been selling natural medicine for five years; he sells on foot in the neighborhoods and nearby towns.  With the earnings from his sales and the help of his wife, they are able to get ahead.  Francisco is requesting a loan to buy more natural medicine wholesale so he can keep selling and make more income.

loans.use: to buy natural medicine wholesale

loans.name: Dúo Lemar Group

texts.es: Dúo Lemar, Erick es soltero, se dedica a la venta de pan y choco bananos, inicio hace 5 años su negocio, ya que por falta de dinero empezó a trabajar, para ayudar a su familia con los gastos del hogar, solicita un crédito para la compra de una vitrina, y mercadería para surtir el negocio, anhela seguir estudiando para superarse. espera que le ayuden con el credito que esta solicitando ya que su anelo es seguir estudiando pero tambien creser como persona de negocio.
texts.en: Dúo Lemar, Erick is single and he sells bread and chocolate-covered bananas for a living.  He started his business five years ago when he started working to help his family with the household expenses because of a lack of money.  He is requesting a loan to buy a display case and merchandise to stock his business.  He hopes to keep studying to better himself.  He hopes you will help him with the loan he is requesting, as his dream is to keep studying as well as to grow as a businessperson.

loans.use: to buy a display case

loans.name: Charito

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Charito works hard to support her family. She has a frozen foods vending business in the Philippines, and also earns income from t-shirt printing.  Charito is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase more packs of frozen foods to sell.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Charito has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more packs of frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 52 years old and married with five children. Josephine works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as shampoo, canned goods, noodles, milk, coffee and sugar.

Josephine has borrowed and repaid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 8 years and also earns an income from personal collection.

Josephine aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as shampoo, canned goods, noodles, milk, coffee and sugar

loans.name: María Isabel

texts.es:
El cantón del Carmen posee una considerable riqueza en flora y fauna, siendo una de las fuentes principales de ingreso el cultivo del plátano de la variedad Barraganete, en este lugar se reúnen las socias del Grupo De Crédito El Palmar.
En este lugar vive la señora María Isabel,  tiene 27  años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 1 hijo de  5  años que estudia la escuela inicial, ella está embarazada de su segundo hijo. Su esposo es albañil.
Doña María Isabel se dedica a la cría de  aves de corral y ganado vacuno en una pequeña granja en su casa, en temporadas compra una gran cantidad de pollos los cuales los cría durante dos a tres meses que es el tiempo para que ya estén listos para la venta, después de este tiempo los entrega a algunas tiendas en la localidad, o también vende por libras por su casa y en pie a comerciante que llegan hasta su casa. El ganado saca leche y luego venden por litros, su esposo es quien le ayuda, lleva 6 años dedicada a esta labor y le ha ido bastante bien ya que es una forma de ganar algo desde su casa.
Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar un torete pequeño, alimentos y medicinas tanto para los pollos como para el ganado. Está en el  Grupo De Crédito año y medio, Le gusta el apoyo. Sus sueños es tener más ganado.
texts.en:
The canton of Carmen is rich in flora and fauna; one of its main sources of income is the Barragenete varietal of banana; and it is where the members of the El Palmar Credit Group meet.  

This is where María Isabel lives; she is 27 years old, married, and has one son who is five years old and who is in primary school.  She is pregnant with her second child.  Her husband is a contractor.  

María Isabel raises poultry and cattle on a small farm at her home.  She buys large quantities of chicken seasonally, which she raises for two or three months, the time they need to be ready to sell.  After this time has passed, she turns them over to some local stores, or she also sells them by the pound at her home and on foot to dealers who come to her home.  She milks the cows and sells it by the liter; her husband helps her.  She has had this business for six years and it has gone pretty well for her, as it is a way to make some money from home. 

She will use this new loan to buy a small beef bull, feed, and medicines for the chickens as well as for the cattle.  She has been with her credit group for a year and a half and she likes the support.  Her dreams are to have more cattle.

loans.use: to buy a beef bull, feed, and medicines for chickens and cattle

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.es:
Ernesto tiene 47 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive en casa familiar con su hijo en el distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. La vida en este distrito es tranquila, las principales actividades que se realizan son la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte en su mototaxi, realiza esta actividad desde hace 05 años contando con clientes fijos quienes dan muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de el. Solicita préstamo para realizar reparaciones y mantenimiento a su vehículo ya que actualmente se encuentra en mal estado, con esto Ernesto espera poder brindar un mejor serviio a sus clientes lo que tendrá un impacto positivo en su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Ernesto is 47 years old, in a relationship, and lives in the family home with his son in the district of Oyotún, Chiclayo Province, Lambayeque Region, on Peru's northern coast.  Life is quiet in this district; its main businesses are farming, commerce, and ranching.  

He offers transportation services in his mototaxi.  He has had this business for five years and he has steady customers who give hime very good personal and professional references.  He is requesting a loan to do repairs and maintenance on his car, as it is currently in bad shape.  With this, Ernesto hopes to offer his customers better service, which will have a positive impact on his income and thereby improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to do repairs and maintenance on his car, as it is currently in bad shape

loans.name: Luz De Luna Group

texts.es: En la actualidad las mujeres se han ganado un lugar muy importante en la sociedad y esto se ha logrado por la unión para demostrar que se pueden lograr grandes éxitos y logros en todos los aspectos, con esta iniciativa y mentalidad cuatro mujeres se unieron para formar un grupo al que denominaron “Luz de Luna” grupo donde estas mujeres quieren lograr el éxito en sus negocios, son lideradas por Erika de 26 años y con dos años de experiencias en la venta de frutas en el mercado del departamento de Masaya, ella está soltera y demuestra que no necesita estar alguien para poder trabajar y ser responsable, el financiamiento que solicita en ADIM es para invertir en melón, piña, naranja dulce, mandarina y tamarindo. El resto de las integrantes son, Romelia de 33 años y con tres años de experiencias en la venta de hojas de chagüite, ella las compra en el departamento de Rivas y las comercializa en su comunidad, Marbely de 31 años vende productos derivados del maíz (tamal y tamales relleno) en el mercado más populoso de la capital, y Geovania que tiene la edad de 28 años y tiene diez años de experiencia en la comercialización de frutas en el mercado del departamento de Masaya. Estas mujeres solo tienen un propósito demostrar que son capaces de mantener sus negocios en funcionamiento y seguir creciendo cada día.
texts.en: Currently, women have achieved a very important place in society and this has been won through uniting to show that great success and achievements in all aspects can be accomplished.  With this initiative and mentality, four women got together to form a group they named the Luz de Luna Group, where these women want to achieve success in their businesses.  They are led by Erika, who is 26 and has two years of experience selling fruit at the market in the department of Masaya.  She is single and shows that you don't need someone to be able to work and be responsible.  The loan she is requesting from ADIM is to buy melons, pineapples, sweet oranges, mandarins, and tamarind.  The rest of the group members are Romelia, who is 33 and has three years of experience selling banana leaves; she buys them in Rivas Department and sells them in her community; Marbely, who is 31 and sells products made form corn (tamales and stuffed tamales) in the busiest market in the capital; and Geovania, who is 28 and has ten years of experience selling fruit in the market in Masaya Department.  These women's only goal is to show that they are capable of keeping their businesses running and to keep growing every day.

loans.use: to buy melons, pineapples, sweet oranges, mandarins, and tamarind, as these are the fruits in highest demand

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a vacuum and a pressure hose for his business

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is thankful for the financial assistance that was granted to her because she has purchased more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Virginia dreams of having a bigger place to store all her products. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay grocery items needed to expand her product inventory for her general store.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel is 56 years old and has three children. She is a woman and one of her children is in school.

Isabel is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Isabel has been raising pigs for one year now and has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Isabel would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell of ready to wear clothing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 24,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock of ready to wear to sell. 

NWTF is listing Emelia's business profile for another loan in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of ready to wear to sell

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn is 37 years old and has two children. She is a woman and one of her children is in school.

Jonalyn is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Jonalyn has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, Jonalyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Flordeliz

texts.en:
Flordeliz works hard to support her family. She is married and has a selling of ready to wear business in the Philippines.

Flordeliz requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to buy more ready to wear to sell to her customers.

Flordeliz has been in this business for nine years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Flordeliz would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more ready to wear clothing to sell to her customers

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 50 years old and married with three children.

Gemma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, bread, milk, sugar, eggs, soft drinks, etc.

Gemma has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and earns additional income from rice retailing.

Gemma aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, bread, milk, sugar, eggs, and soft drinks

loans.name: Harlene

texts.en:
Harlene is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell of ready to wear clothing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy more stock to sell to her customers. 

NWTF is listing Harlene's business profile for another loan in support of her efforts to secure her future.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell to her customers

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Juanita works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from her general store. Juanita is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Juanita has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Lennie

texts.en:
Lennie is 51 years old and single. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Lennie has a tailoring business in the Philippines. Lennie requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more materials for her tailoring business. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. 

Lennie has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Lennie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her sewing business

loans.name: Las Malvinas Group

texts.es: Pilar de 45 años de edad es separada con 4 hijos. La Alcancía Comunal “Las Malvinas” está formado por 07 socias entusiastas y emprendedoras. Ella se dedica al negocio de alquiler de ropas, gracias a su perseverancia su negocio le va muy bien y ha mejorado su calidad de vida. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de vestidos, polos, faldas. El grupo “Las Malvinas” agradecen a todas las personas que facilitaron este crédito. Pilar es la primera del lado posterior derecho, ella se encuentra parada al lado de su hija, viste polo celeste.la sra. violeta no se encuentra en la foto ya que por motivo de trabajo no pudo asistir.
texts.en:
Pilar is 45 years old, separated and has four children. She is a member of the “Las Malvinas” communal bank, which has seven enthusiastic and enterprising members. 

Pilar has a business renting out clothes. Thanks to her perseverance, the business is going very well and Pilar has used it to improve her quality of life. Pilar is applying for a loan in order to buy skirts, dresses and t-shirts.

The “Las Malvinas” group is grateful to all those who are making this loan possible. 

In the photo, Pilar is at the back, on the right in the blue top. Violeta is not in this photo as she had to work when it was taken.

loans.use: to buy skirts, dresses and t-shirts.

loans.name: Erdenetuya

texts.en:
Erdenetuya, 35 years old, lives with her parents and brother in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been running a toy store since 2010. She brings her toys from China, Russia and Korea in order to meet the variety of customers' needs. 

Due to not having a vehicle for transportation, she spends a considerable amount of money on rental automobiles for transporting her toys from the border city to her store. So she is requesting a loan of 2900 USD to buy an electric car for transportation. The advantage of an electric car is that it emits harmless pollutants and wastes less fuel. The state encourages environmentally friendly cars and imposes less tax.

loans.use: to buy an electric car for transportation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy laying hens.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Don Juan Carlos es originarios de san Martin Jilotepeque, tiene 30 años y desde hace mas de 6 años se ha dedicado a la crianza de pollos y de estas fuentes es que ha logrado obtener sus ingresos para mantener a su familia. Junto a su esposa ha procreado tres  hijos. El sueño de Juan Carlos es hacer otra galera para poder criar más pollos y está confiado que con el apoyo de Fape y Kiva lo lograra. Este es el cuarto crédito que solicita, es una persona responsable y puntual en sus pagos. Además trabaja como panadero en una panadería del municipio del cual es el encargado del turno debido a su responsabilidad y experiencia.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos is originally from San Martin Jilotepeque. He is 30 years old and, for more than six years, has made a living raising chickens. This work has allowed him to earn an income to support his family. Juan has a wife and three children. Juan’s dream is to have another coop in order to be able to raise more chickens; he has faith that, with the support of FAPE and Kiva, he will be able to achieve this dream.

This is Juan’s fourth loan. He is responsible and punctual with his repayments. Juan also works as a baker in a local bakery. Owing to have responsible and experienced he is, Juan is shift supervisor there.

loans.use: to buy chickens to raise.

loans.name: Jesús Reynará Group

texts.es: El éxito es algo que todos buscan, que todos luchan para llegar a él y con este sentimiento de triunfo se unen cuatro mujeres decididas, optimistas y con un solo propósito en la vida, trabajar y crecer en sus negocios, por lo cual decidieron formar el grupo solidario “Jesús Reinará” pues tienen puesta la su fe en la experiencia de su vida laboral, el grupo es dirigido por Ligia una joven mujer de 27 años, ella es propietaria de una pulpería donde suministra productos básicos de consumo diario desde hace tres año, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de granos básicos como es arroz, aceite, aceite, sardinas, papel higiénico, toallas sanitarias, pan dulce, pan simple, jugos, etc. Las otras integrantes son, Darling una mujer de 39 años con tres años de experiencia en la hecha y venta de tortillas en su domicilio y también compra y vende cosecha que adquiere en la comunidad y negocia en los mercados, Ruth que tiene la edad de 29 años y tiene dos años de ser propietaria de una pulpería en su domicilio, y Mayra de 43 años ha dedicado cuatro años de su vida a la compra y venta de cosechas, ella compra frutas de cada temporada del años y las comercializa en el mercado del departamento de Masaya. De esta manera estas mujeres se ganan la vida aportando a sus familias, sus metas es crecer en sus vidas laboral y personal.
texts.en:
Success is something that everybody searches and fights for. With this longing for prosperity, four determined and optimistic women have come together to form a loan group.
