Sharing one goal of working and expanding their businesses, the four have come together to create the “Jesús Reinará” loan group and they all have faith in their professional experience. 

The group is directed by 27-year-old Ligia, owner of a grocery shop where she has been selling basic, everyday consumables for three years. She is applying for this loan in order to buy basic goods such as rice, oil, sardines, lavatory paper, sanitary towels, sweet and savoury breads, juices, and more.

One other member of the group is Darling, 39 years old. She has three years’ experience making and selling tortillas in her home. She also buys and sells harvests of crops in the community and the markets. 

Another member is 29-year-old Ruth who has two years’ experience as owner of a grocery shop in her home.

Last, Mayra is 43 years old and has spent four years of her life buying and selling fruits. She buys them every day season and sells them in the market of the Masaya department.

These businesses allow the members of the loan group to earn a living and support their families. Their goal is to prosper in both their professional and personal lives.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, allowing her to offer more products to the people in her community.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena works hard to support her family. Lorena is married and has a ready-to-wear clothing business in the Philippines.

Lorena requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of ready-to-wear clothing to sell to her customers. Lorena has been in this business for 10 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. Lorena would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of ready-to-wear clothing to sell to her customers

loans.name: Ludina

texts.en:
Ludina is a married woman with six children who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ludina is 38 years old.

Ludina has a business buying and selling meat in the Philippines. Ludina requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy meat to sell.

Ludina has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Ludina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy meat to sell

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 45 years old and married with two children in school. Marilyn works very hard to provide for them.

Marilyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like cigarettes, canned goods, and groceries. Marilyn has been in this business for six years now. 

In the future, Marilyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like cigarettes, canned goods, and groceries

loans.name: Nery Erodita

texts.es: Nery vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica desde hace 20 años a la venta de pescado de manera ambulante por las diferentes colonias que están cerca de su casa, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas pescado por mayor y asi seguir con sus ventas para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Nery lives in her own house with her family.  For 20 years she has been selling fish as a street vendor in different communities near her house.  She has many customers because of the good prices she offers, and is able to earn enough income to cover some of the household expenses.

She is requesting a loan to buy more wholesale fish to continue her sales activity and earn more income.

loans.use: To buy more wholesale fish.

loans.name: Matilde

texts.es: Matilde de 56 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella se dedica a la actividad de venta de ropa desde hace varios años, vende de manera ambulante por las diferentes colonias que están cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que le quedan de las ventas y con la ayuda del esposo pueden salir adelante, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas ropa y también zapatos por mayor y asi poder seguir trabajando para llevar el sustento a su hogar.
texts.en:
Matilde, 56, lives in her own house with her husband.  For several years she has been selling clothing as a street vendor in different communities near her place of residence.  With the profit she earns and help from her husband she is able to get ahead.

The loan she is requesting is to buy more wholesale clothing and shoes to continue working and supporting her household.

loans.use: To buy more wholesale clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Armando

texts.pt:
O senhor Armando e comerciante, casado, pai de 4 filhos dos quais 2 já são independentes vivem em casa própria, 2 estao a cargo de familiares, e responsável pela mae e 1 sobrinha.
Com o ultimo empréstimo o cliente reforçou o seu negocio e com este pretende igualmente comprar capulanas, chinelos, sapatos, calcas, para reforçar o seu negocio.
O cliente tem como sonho comprar uma viatura para lhe facilitar no seu negocio e melhorar as condições da sua casa para oferecer um lar melhor a sua família.
O cliente tem como desafios financeiros o cliente tem recorrido ao xitique diário que decorre no mercado, pretende tomar mais créditos com nosco para poder suprir as suas necessidades.
texts.en: Armando is a businessman and a married father to 4 children, 2 of whom live independently in their own homes and his remaining 2 children live in the family home. He is also responsible for his mother and his niece. He used his last loan to restock his business and he plans to use this loan for the same purpose: to buy traditional Mozambican sarongs, known as capulanas, slippers, shoes and trousers. Armando dreams of buying a business vehicle and of improving his home so that his family can live in greater comfort. He is also part of a daily xitique, an informal credit and saving initiative, which takes place in the market, and he hopes to apply for further loans with Hluvuku Adsema in order to provide for his needs.

loans.use: to buy traditional sarongs, slippers, shoes and trousers.

loans.name: Maria Santos

texts.es: Maria de 62 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tamales de gallinas, tiene de dedicarse a esta actividad mas de 12 años de experiencia, por esa razón posee muchos clientes, con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de materia prima como: gallinas, maíz, verduras, tomates entre otros ingredientes que utiliza y asi poder seguir con su trabajo ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria, 62, lives in her own house with her husband.  She makes and sells chicken tamales and has been in business for 12 years.  Because of her experience she has many customers.  The profit she earns covers some of the household expenses.

The loan she is requesting is to buy ingredients like chicken, corn, vegetables, tomatoes and other food items so she can continue her work, since it is her only source of income for a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy chickens, corn, vegetables, tomatoes and other food ingredients.

loans.name: Ester Agustina

texts.es: Ester de 52 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con su hijo quien trabaja y le ayuda económicamente, ella se dedica desde hace 25 años a la elaboración de alimentos, su negocio está ubicado en una zona muy transitada por esa razón posee mucha clientela, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas y con la ayuda de su hijo, logran salir adelante, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de materia prima para la preparación de los alimentos como: huevos, frijoles, queso, crema, pan francés, tomate, mortadelas, etc. todo por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas y asi poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Ester, 52, is a single mother who lives in her own house with her son who works and helps out economically.  For 25 years Ester has been making food at a stand set up in a very busy area, so she has many customers.  With the profit she earns she is able to help her son and they are able to get ahead.

The loan she is requesting is to buy wholesale foods such as eggs, beans, cheese, cream, french bread, tomato, cold meats, etc.  This is so she can continue her sales activity and earn more income.

loans.use: To buy wholesale eggs, beans, cheese, cream, french bread, tomatoes, cold meats, etc.

loans.name: David

texts.pt:
O senhor David e trabalhador e comerciante e casado pai de 2 filhas ainda menores de idade, vive em casa própria.
Com o valor do empréstimo pretende comprar  farinha, arroz, acucar, óleo, sabão, sabonete, boss, bebidas alcolicas e rebuçados para ampliar o seu negocio e responder as necessidades dos seus clientes.
O cliente tem como sonhos, construir uma barraca em sua casa, ampliar o seu negocio e concluir a sua casa para oferecer um lar melhor a sua família.
Os principais desafios são financeiros recorendo ao trabalho para os suprir e pretende tomar mais emprestimos para ver as suas dificuldades ultrapassadas.
texts.en: David is a working businessman and a married father to 2 young daughters. They all live together in their own home. He plans to use this loan to buy flour, rice, sugar, cooking oil, soaps, whiskey and other alcoholic beverages and candy so that he can expand his business and better respond to his customers' requirements. He dreams of building his own stall in his home, of expanding his business and finishing the building work on his home so that his familycan live more comfortably. The greatest challenges that he faces are financial ones and, consequently, he relies on his business to provide for his needs. He hopes to apply for further loans in the future so that he can overcome these difficulties.

loans.use: to buy flour, rice, sugar, cooking oil, soaps, whiskey, gin and candy.

loans.name: Mariana De Jesus

texts.es: Mariana de 48 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos y su esposo, ella se dedica desde hace varios años a la elaboración y venta de tortillas, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes, con las ventas que realiza y las ganancias que obtiene logra salir adelante  con los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz por quintales y cal para poder continuar con la elaboración de las tortillas y así poder tener mejores ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida junto con su familia.
texts.en:
Mariana, 48, lives in her own house with her two children and husband.  For several years she has been making and selling tortillas.  Her business is set up in her home and she has many customers.  With the profit she earns from sales she is able to cover household expenses.

The loan she is requesting is to buy quintals of corn and lime to continue making tortillas and earn more income for a better quality of life with her family.

loans.use: To buy quintals of corn and lime.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es: Maria de 34 años de edad se dedica desde hace 8 años a la venta de medicina popular y otros productos, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes por la calidad del producto y los buenos precios, Maria vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus tres hija, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de  mas medicina popular por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Maria is 34 years old and has made a living selling popular medicine (over-the-counter medicine) and other products for 8 years. Her business is located in her place of residence, and she has a lot of customers due to the quality and good prices of her products. 

Maria lives in her own house with her husband and their three daughters. 

She is asking for a loan in order to buy more popular medicine at wholesale, so that she can continue selling products and earn a better income.

loans.use: to buy more popular medicine at wholesale.

loans.name: Nuvia Maricela

texts.es:
El cantón del Carmen posee una considerable riqueza en flora y fauna, siendo una de las fuentes principales de ingreso el cultivo del plátano de la variedad Barraganete, en este lugar se reúnen las socias del Grupo De Crédito El Palmar.
En este lugar vive la señora Nuvia, tiene 22  años de edad, está casada y no tiene hijos. Su esposo se dedica a la compra venta de ganado (porcino, vacuno) trabaja con el suegro.
Doña Nuvia es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de zapatos por catálogo y bisutería (aretes, pulseras, cadenas, etc.). Trabaja sin horario establecido cuando tiene tiempo libre, tiene 5 meses en esta actividad.Ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días, le va muy bien y lo que más vende son los zapatos y pulseras.
Este crédito es para comprar cerdos para criarlos y luego  venderlos con la ayuda de su esposo que tiene 5 años en el negocio. Este es el tercer año en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque  apoya a personas que están emprendiendo negocios.
texts.en:
The district of Carmen possesses a considerable abundance of flora and fauna, and the cultivation of Barraganete plantain is one of the principle sources of income in the region. The members of the communal bank El Palmar meet in this district, and it is here that Señora Nuvia lives. 

Nuvia is 22 years old, married, and she doesn't have any children. Her husband makes a living buying and selling livestock (pigs and cattle), working together with her father-in-law. Doña Nuvia is a housewife, who, in order to have her own income and help her husband with the household expenses, makes a living selling shoes from catalogues and costume jewellery (ear-rings, bracelets, necklaces, etc.). She has been doing this activity for 5 months, and she works in her free time without a fixed timetable. She sells her products on credit, and charges her customers every 8 days. Her business is doing very well, and shoes and bracelets sell the best. 

This loan is to buy pigs, which she will raise and later sell, with the help of her husband, who has 5 years experience in this business. This is Nuvia's third year in the communal bank El Palmar, and she likes it because it helps people who are starting businesses.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
El comité Las Luchadoras inicia su primer ciclo, ellas son de la ciudad de Lambaré, el comité se conformo mediante una integrante que se esforzó para formar este comité. Ellas son luchadoras y emprendedoras, y están sacrificándose y luchando.
La señora Berta es empleada en un supermercado y a la par tiene un copetín, es una mujer emprendedora y luchadora no se da por vencida y es un ejemplo de dedicación y esfuerzo. Ella se esfuerza cada día para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia.
La señora Berta quiere invertir el préstamo en agrandar su copetín y así brindarle a sus clientes buena comida en un ambiente agradable, y seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
The committee called Las Luchadoras [The Fighters] are beginning their first loan cycle. They are from Lambaré, and the committee was formed by a member who worked hard to bring everyone together. They are determined, enterprising and self-sacrificing. 

Señora Berta works in a supermarket, and at the same time she owns a snack bar. She is an enterprising and persistent woman who never gives up, and she is an example of dedication and strength. Every day she works hard to improve her and her family's living conditions.

Berta wants to invest the loan in the expansion of her snack bar, and in this way provide her clients with good food and a pleasant atmosphere, and continue growing.

loans.use: expand her snack bar.

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
Santiago es comerciante en la Ciudad de Coronel Oviedo, se dedica al comercio desde hace 6 años. Comenta que con la ayuda de sus familiares pudo montar su propio negocio y gracias a su ingreso puede hacer estudiar a sus familiares dignamente.. y con sacrificio.
El tiene una despensa en la que trabaja todos los días desde muy temprano, hasta muy tarde, pone todo de si par air creciendo y mejorando.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de productos varios para su negocio, como ser bebidas, carne, panificados y otros, de manera a seguir ofreciendo una Buena variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Santiago is a businessman in the city of Coronel Oviedo, he has worked in trade for the past 6 years. He says that with the help of his relatives, he was able to open his own business and thanks to his income, he can provide an education for his relatives, with dignity...and with sacrifice.

He has a store where he works every day from the early hours until very late. He puts his all into continuing to grow and improve.

He asks for this loan to be able to invest it in the purchase of various products for his business such as drinks, meat, baked goods, and more, so that he can continue offering a good variety for his customers.

loans.use: to purchase drinks, meat, baked goods, and more.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado María Auxiliadora  está en su ciclo número 7 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, que les ayudará a conocer la situación de vida de cada una y conforme a ello poder seguir ayudando a sus familias.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Aidee quien se dedica a la decoración de todo tipo de eventos, y comenta que le va muy bien ya que siempre tiene muchos pedidos. Poco a poco se fue haciendo conocida y hoy día ya tiene clientes que siempre se acercan a ella, comenta que le gustaría poder seguir con su trabajo, ya que con ello ayuda a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para poder seguir con sus decoraciones, como ser: telas, sillas, maderas y demás.
texts.en:
The group called María Auxiliadora is in its 7th loan cycle in the women's committee program, where they all work and help each other to get ahead. They are completing the poverty elimination questionnaire, which will help them to know the living conditions of each one and according to that, be able to continue helping their families.

One of the members is Aidee, who works decorating all sorts of events, and says that it is going very well for her since she always had many orders. Little by little she made herself known and today she has customers who always approach her. She says that she would like to be able to continue with her work, since it is with this that she helps her family.

She asks for this loan to be able to invest it in the purchase of supplies to be able to continue with her decorations, such as fabric, chairs, wood, and more.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, chairs, wood and more.

loans.name: Perla

texts.es:
La Sra. Perla es de la ciudad de Santaní,  está casada, y también tiene hijos, casa es comerciante, tiene una pequeña despensa en la que todos los días trabaja desde muy temprano, hasta ya muy tarde en el día.
Comenta que su marido trabaja como encargado de una ropería en el mercado y que de esa forma ambos se ayudan mutuamente.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar productos para poder surtir su despensa, como ser: verduras, carne, frutas, y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas, y luchando por mejorar cada día.
texts.en:
Perla is from the city of Santaní, she is married, and also has children.  She is a businesswoman and has a small store in which she works every day from very early until very late in the day.

She says that her husband work as a laundry manager in the market and that in this way they help each other. 

She asks for this loan to be able to purchase products to stock her store, such as vegetables, meat, fruit, and more, so as to be able to continue with her sales and struggling to improve each day.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables, meat, fruit, and more to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Makimbilio Group

texts.fr: Donatienne est une commerçante, membre d’un collectif de crédits «Makimbilio», âgée de 41 ans, mariée, mère de 4 enfants scolarisés. Elle est vendeuse  des boissons dans un marché de la ville depuis 15 ans. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre ses activités. Elle va acheter des bières Primus, Amstell et sucrées. Ainsi, elle souhaite renforcer son capital, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux femmes entrepreneuses exclues du système bancaire classique.
texts.en: Donatienne is a shopkeeper, and an active member of the lending group 'Makimbilio'. She is 41 years old, married, and the mother of 4 children attending school. She has been selling drinks in a market in the city for the past 15 years. She is asking for a loan from Hekima in order to increase the level of her activity. She would like to purchase beers such as Primus and Amstell, as well as sweet beers. This will allow her to increase her working assets, and educate and feed her children. She is thankful to Hekima for the support provided to female entrepreneurs excluded from the classic financial system.

loans.use: purchase beers such as Primus and Amstell, and other sweet beers

loans.name: La Fontaine Group

texts.fr: Madame Mawazo occupe le poste de presidente dans le groupe de credit La fontaine. Agée de 49 ans, elle est  mariée à un agent de la fonction publique et  mère de 8 enfants tous scolarisées. Elle est vendeuse des poissons depuis 1985 au marché central de la ville. Elle sollicite ce credit pour acheter 10kg des poissons frais. Son objectif est d’acheter une parcelle. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien qu’elle apporte aux femmes.
texts.en: Mrs Mawazo is the president of the lending group La Fontaine. She is 49 years old, married to a public service worker and the mother of 8 children, all of whom attend school. She has been invovled in the sale of fish at the city's central market since 1985. She is asking for a loan in order to purchase 10 kilos of fresh fish. Her goal is to purchase a plot of land. She is thankful to Hekima for the support the organization provides to women.

loans.use: purchase 10 kils of fresh fish

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
Celia es una persona responsable, honesta y con gana de salir adelante, está estudiando la carrera de Derecho, con lo cual quiere poder ayudar a las personas de la sociedad.
Ella pone todo de sí, y con sus estudios quiere poder ayudar a sus seres queridos y darles todo lo que necesitan.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su universidad, de manera a poder seguir luchando por sus sueños.
texts.en:
Celia is a responsible and honest person, and has a strong will to get ahead. She is studying Law, and would like to help society with the knowledge she acquires. She works very hard and wants to help her beloved ones and give them anything they might need.

Celia is requesting a loan to pay the university fees and be able to continue fighting to make her dreams come true.

loans.use: to pay the university fees.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan vive en la ciudad de San Pedro, está estudiando la carrera de administración agropecuaria, el ve una gran riqueza en la tierra del país, es por ello que está estudiando esta carrera.
El motivo de mi préstamo, es para poder terminar y cubrir sus gastos de tesis. Su objetivo es trabajar en un establecimiento ganadero como administrador y poder ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Juan lives in the city of San Pedro and studies Agribusiness. He knows the country’s potential in that sector, which is why he chose to study that program.

With this loan, he plans to cover some expenses related to his thesis. His goal is to work as an administrator for a cattle ranch and be able to help his family.

loans.use: to cover some costs related to his thesis.

loans.name: Gilberto

texts.es:
Gilberto esta estudiando la carrera de derecho, trabaja y a la vez estudia, es por esto que se esta esforzando bastante para poder realizarlo y cumplir con su meta. Comenta que su préstamo anterior lo uso para poder cubrir su gasto de titulación.
El pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su universidad, de manera a poder cubrir ese gasto que tiene. agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Gilberto is studying law, he is working and studying at the same time, making a great effort to do so and to reach his goal. He says that he used his previous loan to cover his degree expenses.

He is asking for this loan to pay university fees, so that he can cover this expense. He is grateful for the opportunity he is receiving to continue to move forward.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Eva

texts.es:
Eva vive con sus padres y un hermano, trabaja en una farmacia a la vez que estudia su carrera de enfermería, para poder solventar sus  estudios.
Su proyecto es terminar la universidad para poder trabajar en un hospital público en la ciudad y de esa forma ayudar a sus padres y a la comunidad.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en: Eva lives with her parents and one brother. She works in a pharmacy at the same time as studying nursing, to be able to pay for her studies. Her plan is to finish university and work in a public hospital in the city, and in this way help her parents and the community. She is asking for this loan to be able to pay her tuition fees and be able to continue with her studies.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stocks of rice, grocery items, fruits and vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Rasel

texts.en:
Rasel works hard to support her family. Rasel is married and has a business selling ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines. Rasel has been in this business for 11 years now.

Rasel requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of ready-to-wear clothes to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Rasel would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of ready-to-wear clothes to sell.

loans.name: Melisa

texts.en:
Melisa is 30 years old and has three children, two of whom are in school.

Melisa is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for a year now, and has borrowed once in the past from NWTF to sustain it. 

Melisa requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

In the future, Melisa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
Blanca está estudiando la carrera de ciencias en la educación, por medio de su carrera quiere ayudar a las personas que quieran estudiar y ampliar sus conocimientos.
Ella quiere poder ayudar también a su familia y retribuirles todo lo que la han ayudado.
Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma estar cada vez más cerca de cumplir su sueño.
texts.en: Blanca is studying sciences in education, through her career she wants to help people who wish to study and widen their knowledge. She also wants to help her family and repay them for all the help they have given her. She is asking for this loan to cover degree costs, and thus be ever closer to achieving her dream.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Karanjung Lestari 1 Group

texts.en:
Ni Made is the head of the Karanjung Lestari 1 group and has informed the other members about repayment to MUK. The group completed repayment of a previous loan on 18 February 2015. However, this group will continue lending.

To repay the loan to MUK, Ni Made sold pigs that have been kept for 5 months with a total price 6,000,000 IDR because the price of pork is starting to go down. After deducting the purchase of 3 piglets and feed, she earned 1,500,000 IDR for 5 months. The profit earned is quite small because the price of pork is only 24,000 IDR / kg.

The profits are used to meet the daily needs with her husband who was not able to work due to illness. All of her children are married. Only her youngest son lives at home and opened a bike wash business at home.

Now after receiving a new loan, Ni Made will use it to purchase 5 piglets and feed. The cage is still strong, so she will not need to fix it anymore. Her son helps to feed and clean the pigs. Ni Made will save all the profit and use it to support her future needs. 

There’s a change in the composition of the group.  Member Ni Wayan was able to pay off her loan and stop borrowing. She decided to continue the business with her own money after she had enough profit from the sale of her pigs.

loans.use: to purchase 5 piglets and feed.

loans.name: Los Olivos Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Los Olivos está en su ciclo número 15° Del programa de comité de mujeres, ellas también forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, que les permitirá poder conocer la situación de vida de cada una de ellas, y conforme a ello poder ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia. 
Una de las que integra este grupo es la Sra. Zulma, quien se dedica a la venta de pescados, comenta que siempre se esfuerza para poder tener productos frescos para poder ofrecer a sus clientes. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora que con sacrificio tiene los ingresos que necesita para poder ayudar a su familia.
Ella quiere poder mejorar cada día, para ir superando su situación de pobreza, es por ello que pide este préstamo para poder comprar pescados frescos, y con ello cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The Los Olivos (The Olive Trees) group is in its 15th loan cycle of the programme of the women's committee. They also form part of the programme of the elimination of poverty. This allows them to understand the life situation of each of the members and in line with that be able to help improve their living conditions and those of their families.

One member of the group is Zulma, who earns a living selling fish, and says that she always works hard to have fresh produce to be able to offer to her customers. She is a very hardworking person, who through sacrifices earns the income she needs to be able to help her family. 

She wishes to improve every day, to be able to get over her situation of poverty, and for this reason she is asking for this loan to be able to buy fresh fish and be able to meet the demands of her customers.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish to sell.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina works hard to support her family. Rosalina is married and has a buy and sell ready-to-wear clothes business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 11 years now.

Rosalina requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of ready-to-wear clothes to sell to her customers.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Rosalina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of ready-to-wear clothes to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is a woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Remedios is 53 years old, and two of her children are in school.

Remedios has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Remedios requested a 6,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-production business.

Remedios has been in this business for two years. In the future, Remedios would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-production business

loans.name: Los Angeles Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Los Angeles forma parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, que por medio de la encuesta de los 50 indicadores podrán conocer la situación de vida, y con ello poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y sus ingresos.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Aurelia, quien en su  encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, es decir en un nivel extremo de pobreza, que va mejorando poco a poco y por medio del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y de la venta de comidas que ella misma hace y que sale luego a vender por su barrio. Se hizo ya de muy buena clientela y es por ello que sigue luchando y saliendo adelante.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para poder hacer sus comidas, como ser verduras, condimentos, carne, pollo y otros, con lo cual podrá seguir luchando por mejorar cada día.
texts.en:
The group named Los Angeles forms part of the program of eliminating poverty. Through a survey of 50 indicators they will be able to learn the living situation of the members, and with this be able to improve their living conditions and their income.

One of the members is Señora Aurelia, who in her survey showed a level of poverty in level one, i.e. a level of extreme poverty. She is gradually improving through effort and continuous work, and through the sale of meals she makes herself and then sells in her neighborhood. She has already made a great clientele and therefore she continues fighting and moving forward.

She asks for this loan to be able to invest it in the purchase of inputs to make her foods, such as vegetables, condiments, meat, poultry, etc., with which she will be able to continue fighting to improve every day.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, condiments, meat, poultry, etc.

loans.name: Sainkhuu

texts.en:
Sainkhuu, 39 years old, lives with his wife and child in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He is very hardworking individual who strives for a better future. 

He has been transporting goods between districts since 2009, using his heavy truck. His wife works as druggist at the hospital. 

He is requesting a loan of 3,000 USD to buy spare parts in order to upgrade his truck. By doing so, he will ensure the efficiency and safety of his truck.

loans.use: to buy spare parts in order to repair his heavy truck.

loans.name: Asri Lestari Group

texts.en:
The main goal of all pig farmers’ groups is to be successful and independent in terms of capital. Asri Lestari Group has undergone several periods of repayment of the loan, and this time there is one member who already has enough capital to continue her own business.

As a group that not only received venture capital, but also received training, it is attracting some women to join. Currently there are four new members. They want to develop a business raising pigs, and also quality of life.

As the leader, Ni Luh successfully manages the pigs and leads the Asri Lestari Group. With the new loan, she will buy piglets and feed.

The loan is also used to support other businesses such as shops, services, and other businesses that could support the family income. Ni Luh and all the members of Asri Lestari Group hope to become successful pig farmers and self-sufficient in terms of capital.

Ni Luh is in front, holding a white book.

loans.use: to purchase three superior piglets for fattening, and to use the rest for feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay medical expenses (specialist examinations for her mother).

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en:
Meriam is thankful for the financial assistance that was previously granted to her. She was able to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, and for her personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for a new 10,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Meriam looks forward to seeing her children having a better life through all her hard work in business. She also wants to save money and expand her business. She meets each week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God, which she studies. 

*All CCT (Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 50 years old, married and has six children. 

Lilia is in the agricultural business, farming sugarcane in the Philippines. She has been farming sugarcane for ten years now and has borrowed 18 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. 

Lilia requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

In the future, Lilia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Victorina

texts.en:
Victorina, 36, is a married woman with three children who are all in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Victorina has a food-vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 16 years.

Victorina requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase ingredients and materials for her food-vending business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Victorina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients and materials for her food-vending business.

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buying and selling of dried fish business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional sacks of dried fish to sell for her buying and selling of dried fish business.

Angela has been in this business for eight years. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Angela has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Riza is 31 years old, and has two children who are in school.

Riza has a buying and selling of beverages business in the Philippines. Riza requested a 7,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase beverages to sell.

Riza has been in this business for two years. In the future, Riza would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase beverages to sell

loans.name: Digna

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Digna works hard to support her family.

She has a bamboo weaving business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Digna is borrowing 11,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional bamboo to weave for her bamboo weaving business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Digna has been sustaining her business activities through her past 25 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional bamboo to weave

loans.name: Penny

texts.en:
Penny is a married woman with five children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Penny is 45 years old.

Penny has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase fish net and to pay for maintenance of her boat.

Penny has been in this business for seven years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fish net and to pay for boat maintenance

loans.name: Arceli

texts.en:
Arceli is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Arceli is 44 years old.

Arceli has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy more sacks of rice to sell.

Arceli has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Arceli would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business making dried fish in the Philippines. She is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more fish to dry for her business.

Lilibeth has been in this business for five years. She earns more income from buying and selling nipa roofing. She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Lilibeth has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to dry

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
As a married mother of nine children, Concepcion works hard to support her family.

She has a fruits and vegetables vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from charcoal retailing and pig fattening businesses. Concepcion is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell.

Concepcion has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Anacil

texts.en:
Anacil is 33 years old, married, and has two children who attend school. She is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines, which she has been doing for six years. 

Anacil requested her eleventh loan from NWTF for 15000 PHP, which she will use to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. In the future, Anacil would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Ligaya works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Ligaya is borrowing 9,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Ligaya has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Marlene

texts.en:
Marlene works hard to support her family. She is married and has a furniture-making business in the Philippines. She requested a 40,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional wood, paint, and other equipment for making furniture. Marlene has been in this business for eight years now.

In the future, Marlene would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional wood, paint, and other equipment for making furniture

loans.name: Morena

texts.en:
Morena is 48 years old, married, and has four children. She owns and manages a hog raising business in her village, which she has been doing for almost 15 years. She earns a net income of 20,000 PHP every three months. Her income is usually spent on the school allowances for her children. 

Due to insufficient funds in her business, Morena requested a loan for 50,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase a supply of hog feeds for her hogs. She hopes that her business will continue to grow and become more productive so that she can earn more income.

loans.use: to purchase hog feeds for her hogs.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is grateful that she was granted a 15,000 PHP loan, which she used to buy raw ingredients needed in her "puto" making business. Her earnings helped support her family and meet their daily basic needs.

She would like now to apply for 20,000 PHP which she will use to buy raw ingredients like sticky rice, flour, sugar, and coconut milk needed to make her "puto" for sale. She is so encouraged for the positive sales of her native rice cakes. She is thanking God and you in advance for a good return on her investment and the financial help that will be given her, since it will surely help fund their everyday personal and household needs and her children's education. 

Nida dreams that all her hard work will bear fruit to give her family a bright future. She desires for all her children to finish their schooling. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

. * All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients like all-purpose flour, baking soda, sugar, lehiya, cheese and coconut for her  "puto" (native rice cake) business.

loans.name: Noriza

texts.en:
Noriza is 46 years old and married. She has four children. With three children in school, Noriza works very hard to provide for them.

Noriza runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years now and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like biscuits, canned goods, groceries, etc.
 
In the future, Noriza would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like biscuits, canned goods, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Novelyn

texts.en:
Novelyn is 32 years old, married, and has three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Novelyn has been raising pigs for five years and also earns additional income from food vending.

Novelyn is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita, 44, is a married woman with three children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Teresita has a rug-making business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years.

Teresita requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more materials for her rug-making business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Teresita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her rug-making business.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Merlinda works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell for her fish vending business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Merlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 25 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Loleta

texts.en:
Loleta is 34 years old and married with nine children, four of whom are in school. Loleta works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, eggs, etc.

Loleta has been in this business for ten years.

In the future, Loleta would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Senara

texts.en:
Senara is 51 years old and has eight children. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Senara requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Senara has been raising pigs for one year now, and has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Senara would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 47 years old and married with seven children, three of whom are in school. Mary Ann works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell such as canned goods, eggs, milk, noodles, etc.

Mary Ann has been in this business for eleven years.

In the future, Mary Ann would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell such as canned goods, eggs, milk, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Antonia is 54 years old, and one of her children is still in school.

Antonia has a firewood and charcoal vending business in the Philippines. Antonia requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.

Antonia has been in this business for two years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Blanca

texts.en:
Blanca works hard to support her family. She has a buy-and-sell firewood business in the Philippines.

Blanca requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more firewood to sell to her customers.

Blanca has been in this business for 17 years now.

In the future, Blanca would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more firewood to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Merlinda works hard to support her family.

She has a clothing sales business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Merlinda is borrowing 9,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more stock of clothes to sell.

Merlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy works hard to support her family. Daisy is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.

She requested a 19,500 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase spare part for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

Daisy has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Daisy would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Crédo

texts.fr: Crédo est un homme marié âgé de 25 ans et vit à Kponouvé. Pour rendre possible ses tâches familiales et aider sa femme à réaliser ses attentes, Crédo gère une cafetaria où il prépare divers pour satisfaire ses clients à soulager leur faim. Grâce à ce commerce Crédo gagne un revenu lui permettant d’avoir une épargne pour répondre aux besoins de sa famille. Crédo s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au grand marché de Lomé. Pour acheter ses matières de préparations, Crédo demande ce prêt afin de réaliser ses attentes
texts.en:
Crédo is a 25-year-old married man who lives in Kponouvé. In order to be able to provide for his family's needs and to help his wife achieve her goals, he runs a food stall where he prepares various items to help his customers satisfy their hunger.

Thanks to this business, Crédo earns an income which allows him to save and provide for the needs of his family. 

Crédo  acquires his supplies twice per month at the grand market in Lomé. In order to purchase the materials for his food preparation, Crédo is requesting this loan in order to achieve his goals.

loans.use: to purchase 6 boxes of spaghetti and 6 cases of Coca Cola

loans.name: Karanjung Lestari 2 Group

texts.en:
After passing five periods, the Karanjung Lestari 2 group succeeded in paying off all the loan on time. During the loan period, they kept the pigs well, away from disease, and they grew healthy. The pigs were always fed with a nutrious feed and vitamins.

Ni Made sold all of her pigs and earned enough profit. She’s also become a piglets seller in her village. She’s very happy for the result. Her husband and all the family feel the benefits. The children can go to school and the daily needs are fulfilled. She said thanks to lenders, Kiva and MUK for supporting her bussines. 

One member decided to stop borrowing and resigned from the group after she had enough profit from her sales. Now she continues the pig business with her own money.

Evaluating the last period, the Karanjung Lestari 2 group decided to continue their loan from MUK. They still need the loan to increase their business, and they will stop after they all have enough savings as capital to run the businesses by themselves.
 
Ni Made will use her loan to purchase five superior piglets. She hopes in the next five months, the pigs can grow healthy and earn a satisfactory price. All the profit will be saved for the capital of her business.

loans.use: to purchase five superior piglets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beams, zinc sheets, blocks, steel, cement, sand, gravel and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Saypocho

texts.en:
Saypocho is a generous woman. She was born in 1971. She is married and has five children. She is living in a remote district. 

She is a cook. She makes cakes and candies and sells them in a domestic market. Saypocho has been busy with this activity since 2008. She knows the way of how to cook and attract clients. 

She wants to enlarge her business and buy the needed materials such as equipment and products for preparing cookies. Saypocho is asking for financial support from the Kiva project to buy equipment and products for cookies.

loans.use: to buy equipment and products for making cookies

loans.name: Crisanta

texts.en:
Crisanta is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Crisanta is 46 years old, and two of her children are currently in school.

Crisanta has a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell to her customers.

Crisanta has been in this business for six years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Razelda

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Razelda works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell rice business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Razelda is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell for her buy-and-sell rice business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

Razelda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 26 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Eva

texts.fr: Âgée de 39 ans,  Eva est une femme mariée qui vit  dans le quartier d’Agoè. Pour subvenir à ses charges quotidiennes, Eva vend des pagnes dans son quartier. Grâce à ce commerce Eva trouve la rentabilité nécessaire pour assurer ses besoins et aider son enfant qui est présentement scolarisé. Eva s’approvisionne cinq fois par mois au grand marché de Lomé. Dans le souci d’augmenter sa marge de bénéfice, Eva demande ce prêt pour commander des pagnes.
texts.en:
Eva, 39 years old, is a married woman who lives in the Agoè district. In order to cover her daily expenses, Eva sells lengths of African print cloth in her area. Thanks to this business, Eva manages to pay for her needs and help her child who is presently enrolled in school. 

Eva buys her supplies five times a month in the Grand Marche in Lomé. Wishing to grow her profit margin, Eva is asking for this loan so that she can order more lengths of cloth.

loans.use: to buy eight lengths of African print cloth

loans.name: Decena

texts.en:
Decena works hard to support her family. She sells firewood in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 17 years.

Decena requested a loan from NWTF for 13,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more stocks of firewood to sell. In the future, Decena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of firewood to sell

loans.name: Magdalina

texts.en:
Magdalina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rice milling business and a general store in the Philippines. She is borrowing 30,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy new tools and equipment for her rice milling business.

Magdalina successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. NWTF is relisting Magdalina's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy new tools and equipment for milling rice.

loans.name: Ana Edelmira

texts.es:
Ana de 47 años de edad, está casada y tiene 5 hijos, algunos trabajan y otros estudian, su esposo se dedica al trabajo de agricultor y también a la elaboración de tejas.

Ana se dedica a los oficios del hogar y a atender a su familia, también se ha dedicado al negocio de la teja artesanal, ella solícito un crédito para invertir en el negocio dela teja el cual ya terminó de cancelar.

Ella ha recurrido a Credicampo nuevamente para solicitar un crédito el cual necesita  para comprar herramientas de trabajo para montar una peluquería.

Ella desea poder montar su negocio para seguir trabajando por su familia, darles una mejor calidad de vida y sacarlos adelante.
texts.en:
Ana, aged 47, is married and has five children, some of whom are working, and others in school. Her spouse works in agriculture as well as making clay tiles. 

Ana looks after the household and her family. She is also involved with the tile business; she previously requested a loan to invest in this, which is now fully repaid. 

She has now returned to Credicampo to request a loan which she needs to buy tools to set up a hairdresser. She wishes to set up this business so that she can continue working for her family, giving them a better quality of life and helping them get ahead.

loans.use: to buy tools to set up a hairdresser.

loans.name: Morena Guadalupe

texts.es:
Morena, de 35 años de edad, está casada y tiene dos hijos, un joven de 14 años de edad, que estudia séptimo grado y una niña de 11 años de edad, que estudia quinto grado. 

Morena, trabaja en una maquila textil desde hace 10 años, trabaja en el área de control calidad.

Ella solicita el crédito para reparar el techo y arreglar el piso de su vivienda.- Morena, comprará pintura, cemento y arena; con el objetivo de darle mejores condiciones y mayor seguridad a su familia.- Con esto espera, que su familia sea menos vulnerable a enfermedades respiratorias y parasitarias.

Sueña con apoyar a sus hijos en la preparación académica y que tengan la capacidad de crear y aprovechar futuras oportunidades.
texts.en: Morena is 35 years old.  She is married with two children, a boy, age 14, who studies in 7th grade, and a girl, age 11, who is in 5th grade. Morena has worked in a textile factory for the past 10 years, she works in the quality control area. She is asking for a loan to repair the roof and fix the floor in her house. Morena will buy paint, cement, and sand with the goal of bringing better living conditions and security to her family. With this, she hopes to prevent her family from being exposed to respiratory and parasitic diseases. She dreams of supporting her children's academic preparation so that they will have the ability to create and to take advantage of future opportunities.

loans.use: To repair the ceiling and fix the floor in her house.

loans.name: Judith Del Carmen

texts.es:
Judith, de 24 años de edad, está recién acompañada, vive en casa de sus padres.

Judith, desde hace un año, administra un cafetín que está ubicado dentro del centro escolar de su camunidad que está a 2 kilometros de su casa.- Este negocio le proporciona los ingresos suficientes, para apoyar a sus padres y a su pareja en los gastos del hogar.

Judith, solicita el préstamo para hacerle remodelaciones al cafetín; además comprara mercadería para la venta.

Ella sueña con instalar una tienda en su casa y comprar una vivienda para ella, su pareja y sus futuros hijos.
texts.en:
Judith, 24, just got married. She lives with her parents. She has been working for a year administering the cafeteria of a school located 2 km [1.25 miles] from her home. She makes enough to help her parents and her husband with the home expenses.

Judith is requesting this loan to remodel the cafeteria and buy products to sell. Her dream is to open a store at home and buy a house for her, her partner and the children they will have.

loans.use: to remodel the cafeteria where she works and buy products to sell.

loans.name: Endang

texts.en:
Endang is married and has two children. She lives in Bogor, a suburban area located about an hour from Jakarta.  Endang is a civil servant. She joined Ruma in 2013 because she wanted to learn how to become an entrepreneur, as well as increase her saving. Her community sees her as a cheerful, friendly person as well as a trusted mobile payment services provider. 

Endang requested her second loan, which she will use to provide more mobile payment services to her community, especially on weekends. Her previous loan helped her to start her new business with Ruma.  This loan will help Endang improves her business and accordingly, her community which needs access to such services.

loans.use: to provide more mobile payment services for her community

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Etant une femme mariée et mère de quatre enfants, Afi est âgée de 37 ans. Elle vit dans le quartier de Vakpossito et vend des savons et des détergents en se promenant dans les quartiers pour répondre aux sollicitations de ses clients. Afi s’approvisionne six fois par mois au grand marché de Lomé afin de disposer ses articles. Pour avoir un local de distribution de savons aux détaillants Afi demande ce crédit pour commander des détergents afin d’avoir le bénéfice nécessaire pour accomplir son projet.
texts.en:
Afi is a married woman who is 37 years old and the mother of four children. She lives in the Vakpossito neighborhood and sells soaps and detergents walking through the neighborhoods in order to meet the requests of her customers.

Afi purchases her supplies six times per month at the big market in Lomé in order to sell her wares. In order to have a local area to distribute her soaps at retail, Afi is requesting this loan which will help her order detergents and earn the income necessary to accomplish her goal.

loans.use: to purchase 1 case of soap

loans.name: Hikoyat

texts.en:
Hikoyat is a woman who communicates well. She was born in 1978. She is living in a remote district and is a widow. She has four children.

Hikoyat's husband had a canteen at an auto service business. After the death of her husband, Hikoyat inherited that canteen. She has been in this business for almost four years. 

Year by year she become more experienced and met the challenge of serving people, but her canteen is in bad condition. Hikoyat wants to make it better and decided to renovate the canteen. Additionally, she is planning to widen her assortment of dishes. She is asking for financial support from KIVA to renovate her canteen and enlarge the assortment of dishes.

loans.use: to renovate the canteen she inherited from her husband and expand the assortment of dishes

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LOS CORAZONES VALIENTES DE MORRO SAN JUAN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Santa Ana, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Susana   se dedica al negocio de agricultura, ella tiene un terreno donde cultiva cacao y café, la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar su terreno de cultivo. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank "LOS CORAZONES VALIENTES DE MORRO SAN JUAN." The bank is located in the Santa Ana district, belonging to the province of La Convención and department of Cusco. 

The member, Susana, works in agriculture. She has a plot where she grows cacao and coffee. The member works from 6am to 5pm. She has been in this business for several years and it is going very well for her. The member's dream is to expand her farming plot. She is requesting a loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer. 

The member is happy about the loan and is committed to making the loan payments.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en: Eliza is 48 years old and single. To earn a living, she has been engaged in a vegetable vending business for almost 8 years. She aims to further improve the business and increase her income to satisfy her necessities and save some for future emergencies. Due to capital insufficiency, she is asking for a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy more eggplants, tomatoes, string beans, okra, cabbages, onions and more leafy vegetables to sell. She is hoping that she will avail her loan request to be able for her to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy more eggplants, tomatoes, string beans, okra, cabbages, onions and more leafy vegetables to sell

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan has greatly enriched her business. She was able to buy products and supplies which are needed in her business. The loan also helped her provide for their daily needs and expenditures.

Mary Grace is very positive that she could improve her business more if you will let her borrow again an amount of 50,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional meat products which she needs to improve her profit from business. She also plans to increase her product inventory for her direct-selling business and she will use a portion of the loan to buy personal products she sells. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family through the help of this assistance.

Mary Grace wants to have business expansion so that she will be able to provide for her children's educational expense. She meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients like meat products and personal products needed in her business.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine works hard to support her family. Josephine is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

Josephine has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Josephine would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Donnabel

texts.en:
Donnabel works hard to support her family. Donnabel is married and has a business buying and selling crabs and shrimp in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years now.

Donnabel requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional crabs and shrimp to sell. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional crabs and shrimp to sell

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

Evelyn has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Evelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell
